Reviews.Title: “Good Location / Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjz_kc
Reviews.Content: The Westin Hotel Europa & Regina occupies a good location on the Grand Canal and is very convenient to sites and top notch shopping. Common areas of the hotel are very grand/oppulent, which is not my taste. However, I knew this going into our stay. Venice does not offer many options when it comes to contemporary design hotels, so we opted to stay at an SPG property. Our fifth floor room was clean and featured a large bathroom, balcony, and view of the Grand Canal -- which was great. While I only saw two rooms in the hotel, they do seem in need of refurbishment. The addition of WiFi in the rooms would be a plus. We had no issues with service, but nothing stood out. Drinks and food were on the expensive side, but so is Venice in general.

Reviews.Title: “just average”
Reviews.Author: Adelalzayed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to have a romantic short break. No doubt Venice was the first destination to jump to our mind. Of course we wanted a Hotel to complement our romantic holiday. We searched the internet we red the available reviews we compared prices and finally we choose Westin hotel and Regina. Have to say apart from the location there is nothing much about this hotel. Staff are very friendly and helpful, but this you can get any where in Venice. Rooms were very clean, O.K. in size, but they do not worth the price we had paid.

Reviews.Title: “What a poor experience”
Reviews.Author: mnacc
Reviews.Content: To begin with, my husband and I stayed here on out honeymoon 15 years ago, and remember it as a fairly magical place. Boy have things changed. The rooms were unbearably hot with no way of shutting the blasting radiators off, and we were told that the air conditioning was shut off for maintenance " a week ago". They then proceeded to tell us NOT to open the windows because of mosquitoes. Well, long story short we had to crack it opened when my 9 year old became queasy and faint from the heat and his face and back are covered in bites. My husband then pointed out the dirty stained wall right above our headboard, which appeared to be dead, squashed and UNCLEANED bugs. Stained towels, crumbled bathroom fixtures, and on and on. Had we been back in the states we would have checked out immediately, but seeing as it was the last leg of a 10 day journey with our 2 young kids we sucked it up and counted down the minutes until our departure. I'm so sad to say this was beyond unacceptable and a real low point on an otherwise fantastic Italian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: SurfriderCA
Reviews.Content: I really had a nice stay at the Westin Hotel Europa & Regina last week. They were able to upgrade me to a canal view room on my second night which was very nice. A beautiful, corner room which had a wonderful view of the canal outside my window. It did cost me extra as apparently they don't upgrade to canal view rooms due to the demand for such rooms in Venice. The hotel really is quite beautiful and the lobby is quite exquisite. I was a little surprised at how much food and drink was at the hotel. I've stayed at similar pricey hotels and didn't find the food to be quite as expensive as it was at the Westin Regina. It is Europe though and I know you have to expect it. I was also a little taken aback that there was a charge for WIFI. I had stays in smaller hotels in Italy that had free WIFI so I guess when you pay as much as you do at such hotels like the Westin, you might expect WIFI to be complimentary. But whatever.....was still a very nice stay, and I would return to the hotel. It will be especially nice when all the construction is done and the patio on the canal is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not that type of Westin we usally stay”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie C
Reviews.Content: We booked the superior deluxe, but when we arrive they just gave us a very small room which is only 100sq and standing shower terrible room for us with a little canal view. We complain about and we got swap the room like superior deluxe but they said we got upgrade....Which is much better and bigger and have a bath tub I without the canal view. We asked concierge to help to call the restaurant to change our dinner booking but it takes half hour still no reply and they said can't reach the restaurant. Than we call the restaurant directly ourselve in once and in touch with them.... The breakfast is great they with a canal view, location is great few mins walk to the St Marco square and lots of shops around. Is a nice hotel but just not the same Westin we stay usally...

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in the centre of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Emozione
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in the very centre of Venice, close to San Marco but in a very quiet coutryard. Rooms are a bit old-fashioned and tiny but give a kind of atmosphere of the place and clean. We had a room with almost no view but we didn't care much. We encountered a couple of problems during our stay. In the room of my parents it was very hot because the AC didn't work. When we approached the front desk lady with the issue, she answered that at this time of the year the AC is off at the whole hotel. So my parents had to open the windows all the time and let in mosquitos which didn't let them sleep normally. In our room tempreture was fine, so it depends on the room location I suppose. According to the law (we were said) hotels are not allowed to give irons to their guests, so the only option was to give clothes for ironing. For me that was surprising because in Milan and Rome there was no problem with it. The restaurant is rather pricey, so we didn't have our meals there, but we used the bar quite often. The staff was very polite and helpful. They have a great terrace there. We also didn't have our laptop with us and a couple of times used the internet at the front desk and it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but little recognition of Starwood status”
Reviews.Author: Pishi
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location and some rooms have spectacular views. We stayed for 3 nights and booked 2 connecting rooms. We were hoping for an upgrade as Starwood Platinum members, but did not get one. Oh well, maybe next time. Still, even standard rooms were very nice. Just a word of warning: this hotel (and many others) offers complimentaly water taxi to Murano island and back. If you choose to take it, be aware that there is a high pressure sales pitch awaiting you at the island's glass factory. If you can handle it, the trip is nice and you can explore the island on your own after they let you go. It was a bit of a surprise for us that we had to sit thru the sales presentation, as nobody at the hotel mentioned it to us. They probably should warn their guests when offering a complimentary water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Newbie_Vacationer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin last month. Most wonderful experience. We stayed in the room that had a walk out balcony directly overlooking the Grand Canal - wow that was wonderful. The wall paper in the room was insulated fabric so it is absolutely quiet. Glass chandaliers. Most comfortable beds. Well appointed bathroom. You cannot beat the location. Within 15 minutes, you can pretty much walk as far as Cannaregio. Finding the hotel from the main street I must admit was a bit difficult, as you need to travel through a several small corridor looking streets to get to the front of the hotel. What is unique about Venice in general is that because there's no cars, it's absolute silence on the streets by about 10am (at least in the month of March). Opening our windows, all we could here were a bunch of alley cats. I must say that the buffet breakfast was the best of the 6 cities we stayed. Lots of variety and great selection of hot and cold items. Our favorite was the mango puree ! The seating area itself was fantastic. There's an indoor and outdoor section. The outdoor section is adjacent the Grand Canal. What a wonderful experience. The only suggestion I'd like to make for management is the cost of some of the items. I appreciate that Venice overall is extremely expensive and items must be delivered by boat, but 10 Euro for a bottle of water is a bit steep. Overall, highly recommended. Would live to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy room and poor quality room service food.”
Reviews.Author: RachelNew1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fabulous location overlooking the Grand Canal. We had booked a superior double but we were given a complimentary upgrade to a small suite on arrival. The room itself was perfect, as was the complimentary bottle of sparkling wine and strawberries, but it directly looked onto a construction site next door. This work started at 7.30 each morning on weekdays, and disturbed me every morning. We didn't ask to move rooms, as we decided that the room itself was worth the noise, but we have wondered if we would have have been given a room with Grand Canal views if we hadn't been upgraded! The hotel stops serving bar food at 10.30pm, we were caught out one evening and ordered room service. Two very mediocre sandwiches plus service came to 75 euros, and the service trolley had two glasses for water but no water, which would have cost 10 euros extra from the mini bar! All in all we would recommend staying there, just be careful on which room you accept and avoid the room service!!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra201255
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel on a three day break with Citalia. We paid in advance for a Grand Canal room and then we arrived we had been upgraded even further to a room with a terrace to sunbathe. The service was superb, the staff friendly and helpful and the food out of this world. For breakfast we even had prosecco with the smoked salmon - amazing. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: TravelteamCT
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a beautiful city. Lovely room, with a view of the courtyard and the grand canal, excellent service, lovely restaurant. And those Westin beds! We couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a view!”
Reviews.Author: WinterTravelin
Reviews.Content: We were blown away, they gave us an upgraded room with what is probably one of the best views in Venicia. Service was outsanding. Very nice staff and very helpful. Clean and well maintained hotel. Very close St. Mark's Square, San Marco Basillica and to Musica a Pallazo (which was a great performance too). To get to the closest bakery, travel left on street with high end shops. It's next to Le Cafe. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS WESTIN HOTEL. BEST TRIP OF A LIFETIME.

Reviews.Title: “First rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: classicalmusictravel
Reviews.Content: The Europa and Regina is a first-rate hotel. My room was large and beautiful--really perfection. The room had a little view of the Salute and the canal; it was light and bright during the day and had excellent blackout curtains if you want a dark room at night. Worth it to have a bit of a view. I don't know how the hotel manages to be so very quiet. While I was there, it was clear that there were tour groups going through. But in my room, I did not hear conversation or noise of any kind--really tranquil. Breakfast was excellent--wide variety of hot and cold with lovely fresh fruit. The windows opened out to the fresh air--But close your windows at night as there could be some little biting mosquitos as I experienced. The internet cost was 12 euros/day. The good part of this is that the lounge areas were not filled with people doing their online work--mostly just sitting and relaxing, having a drink or coffee and talking. This is a perfect place if you don't mind spending the money and would like a break from constant connection.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: ajsm
Reviews.Content: The Europa and Regina is in a quiet square on the Grand Canal less than 5 minutes walk from St. Mark's, somewhat hidden at first, but easy to find thereafter. I think it's an even better (quieter) location than the Danieli. We had a room (252) overlooking Santa Maria della Salute with a vew down to the Peggy Guggenhiem - sunny, airy and spacious. The wireless signal in the room was weak, but there is ethernet that was fast and reliable and if you have your own router, very useful for multiple devices. There's a small "Westin Workout" exercise room that is useable, a rarity in Venice. Breakfast is â‚¬35 for continental or approximately â‚¬20 a la carte. The concierge will book you a private water taxi from the hotel's door to Venezia S. Lucia train station: â‚¬65 (faster route, 20 minutes) or â‚¬75 (Grand Canal route, about 30 minutes). The latter is worth it for its private view of Venice and definitely worth it if you have several people.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par...”
Reviews.Author: Ann R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Venice for a long weekend and chose the Westin primarily for its location.....and the location is great....just a few blocks from Piazza San Marco. It is a bit tough to find as it is off the beaten path - but it was kind of fun to find. Our first impressions were not great. The door mat leading into the lobby was very warn out - now this sounds petty, but when you're paying "Westin prices" - you expect more. We were in a Deluxe room which was newly renovated - the decor was upscale, heavy drapery, chandelier. But when we got settled we heard hammering and sawing. When we looked out the window we realized the building next door was also being renovated (the front desk said through June). We asked to be moved to the other side of the building - and they gladly moved us (we wondered why we had to ask for the switch...surely they had received other complaints). I know this will sound like a nit-picky complainer, but once you've had a less than satisfactory experience right out of the gates - your guard goes up. In our new room, which was quiet, the pillows seemed to be just thrown on the bed, the towels in the bathroom were messy on the rack (and true each day after the maid came), a very tattered magazine had been left on the coffee table. Again, all fine for a 2 or 3 star hotel but not a Westin. We would look to stay at another hotel in the same area next time.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: whisperozzie
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, great views, brilliant location, staff are really helpful. our room was spotless and newly refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful return visit”
Reviews.Author: KTFam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time in less than a year and once again had a wonderful time. The hotel is in a great location, and the rooms are large and spotless. This is definitely one of our favorite places to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great winter stay for Carnevale”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Mom and I had a great week here using SPG points (my second stay). Our room was supposedly a Platinum upgrade - I'm assuming because we were on the 6th floor with views of the surrounding roof tops. Comfortable beds, impeccable housekeeping, great heating system, plenty of hot water and good water pressure in the bath, in-room safe, flat screen TV, beautiful details like Murano glass light fixtures. The common areas of the hotel are truly beautiful - lots of marble and lux fabrics. Perfect location if you want to focus on St. Mark's and around - easy access to 1, 2 and many other vaporetto lines. Concierge was just as rude as my last stay - just unfortunate given the caliber of the hotel and the quality of other staff members. I would definitely stay here again if I could use points, but here are a few notes to consider: Location for Carnvevale is good and bad - you're right there for all the action in St. Mark's Square, but that also means braving huge crowds just to get back to the hotel (on the weekend, not nearly as bad on Fat Tuesday) and noise late into the night. We could hear the bands in our room, which may be OK some nights, but was particularly painful the night something called the Spleen Orchestra headlined. Tip for Fat Tuesday - the bar staff let us sit outside on the terrace even though it was closed so we were able to watch the gondola regatta as they passed Salute and then watched the bull light on fire looking down the Grand Canal towards St. Mark's. If I go for Carnevale again, I think I'll stay in a quieter part of the city and just go back and forth on the vaporetto. Bar is outrageously expensive - it is beautiful and all the bar staff we met were so nice, but at these prices you may as well go to Harry's Bar down the block. If you need a quick coffee or drink there is a little bar on Calle Larga XXII Marzo and a newshop that has an outdoor vending machine we used late nights on Calle delle Ostreghe. Do not disturb signs not respected - we had the mini-bar staff barge in on us dressing twice even though we had DND signs on the door. There was construction while we were there - at check in we were told the construction had been over for a long time and there was just some painting going on. No idea what they were talking about because there was a huge crane hard at work during our stay and plenty of construction noise at the hotel entrance, but luckily we could not hear it from our room. Have a great time in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “â€œVisiting Veniceâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Margaret575
Reviews.Content: The staff are all helpful, courteous and polite - all appear geniunely happy that you are staying in their hotel. The room was perfect Breakfast more than adequate. Good choice of local restaurants nearby. We loved La Caravella at 2 minutes walking, but were disappointed with restaurant Beccafico at 10 minutes walking. The hotel is a few minutes walk St.Mark's square - perfect location!! Overall, a fantastic hotel in a wonderful location - we will stay again and would reccommend to anyone!! while visiting Italy and I will confidently recommend this hotel to friends and family travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Europa on Jan 2012 and didn't want to leave. Booked a base room selling for $220 that week for 12000 pts, send a nice email prior to check-in, and bumped up twice to top floor beautiful King room with hardwood flooring, huge marble bath with soaker tub and 300 sg ft wood deck terrace w/roll out canopy on the Grand Canal...incredible views in a room posting for $920 that day. Immediately booked a 2nd night for 12000 and a 2nd room for a guest at $150 ($220 rate) and had that room bumped up to a nicer King room ($320 night)...with such a nice room Florence could wait another day. Great location with a 8 min walk to St.Marks square. Never used the pricy hotel restaurant (2 probably $150+ ) but heard food amazing. Lots of eating options (range from 2 for $40-80 ) all over so not to worry but make a reservation if its a sit down meal if you can. Great Plat recognition from Staff on upgrades, service , late check-out, and my Prosecco amenity showed up on time every night. Interstingly, most everything closes down after 9pm with a few restaurants open to midnight. Not much night life but walking deserted streets in Venis was a treat in itself. Esspecially on a full moon night for La Befana (Night of the Witch Jan 6) Parking on the Island was $78 for 2 days, waterbus (public) was $6.90 one way (45-55 min) from the Westin to the Bus depot/parking center or book a 10 min private water cab for $65. Some reno's in the hotel but no noise or workers seen probably due to the holidays. Great deal, Excellent SPG Plat recognition w/terrific room, definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss The Venetian Cooking Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Patay1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights here at the beginning of Carnival and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room (105) which overlooked the Grand Canal was very comfortable, spacious and the view was fantastic. The front desk staff was always very prompt, efficient and helpful. They were more than happy to discuss options for site-seeing and restaurants. On Sunday we experienced the true delight of "The Venetian Cooking Experience" which is offered by the Chef of La Cusina. The Chef prepared a three course lunch and demonstrated interesting techniques while the M'aitre D translated into English and we enjoyed a delightful Prosecco. We were introduced to regional products including incredible vinegars and two types of radicchio that we had never seen before. This was followed by lunch of the items the Chef had prepared - paired with three local wines. Delicious!!! We had the added pleasure of sharing the table with a lovely Venetian lady. Our Italian is miniscule but with her English - and the help of the Sommelier - we had a very nice conversation. We will proudly wear our "Venetian Cooking Experience" aprons at home and impress our friends with what we learned. Venice is a magical place - especially at Carnival - and the Hotel Europa and Regina was everything we had hoped for and more.

Reviews.Title: “The Least of the Ciga's Has Fallen”
Reviews.Author: Venamo
Reviews.Content: When Ciga ran this perfectly located hotel with great canal view rooms, one knew that this was a notch below the Gritti and Danieli, but it had charm. No longer. The staff is roude and uncooperative & the onwwers have not put much money into maintainace. Still, one can say it has some small dingy rooms with hugwe gorgeous terraces, such as 456and 452 so there is some redemption. Unfortunately this is also not true a the breathtaking views across the canal to Sta Maria della Salute and down to the Guidecca is ruined at night by the worst most garish LED billboard advertising resortation by the lighting company. For a person whose family stayed here for nearly 60 years; this was one bulb too many and we are off to the Bauer

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff...”
Reviews.Author: Rod A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Westin for a romantic getaway in Venice. We made an excellent choice! Location is simply fantastic - right on the Grand Canal, a short walk to San Marco square, great shops and dining nearby. Staff was very professional and helpful. Front desk staff was great with directions and recommendations and also provided a very nice room upgrade at check in. Georgio at the bar was simply fantastic - one of the nicest and most helpful people we met during our one week stay in Italy. Room was large, well kept and relaxing / enjoyable. Bathroom was great as well. The cost was high but we found it worth it for a "splurge" for ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “You must go, and this has to be one of the top 3 hotels in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ronneedham
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend in between business travels in Europe and no particular place to go (had to be in Milan on Monday) so stopped for the weekend in Venice along the way. First, my wife will kill me for going here without here, but, it was a good 'recon' mission for bringing her another time (or, at least that's how I sold it to her). The Westin Europa & Regina was simply outstanding. It will cost you (even if the rooms are reasonable -they were for me - everything else is very expensive, more than any other place I've traveled - London, Dublin, Paris, you name it...this was the most expensive. Having said that, this is a bucket list location. Venice was, by far, the most beautiful city I've been to. The Westin is stunning. You obviously need a water taxi to get there from the airport. It set me back 110 euro so plan accordingly (I believe they have a "water bus" that's considerably cheaper but takes 2 hours or so and will kill the romance if that's what your plan is with the bride/husband). But what a ride. Think of the 110 euro as part of the adventure, if you must. Rooms are in great condition and well appointed. Internet, etc, will cost you (I believe a beer from the minibar was 10 euro- that's right, $13 for a beer). But it's all there. Hotel bar is stunning, a bit quiet on a January night, but nice to chill and have a beverage or two in. Fitness center well appointed. Everything is in walking distance. Get a map and get out on the streets. If you weren't in the infantry you are going to get lost so plan accordingly. If you were, it really isn't that difficult to figure out where you are at. My recommendation is avoid the $50 per person room service breakfast (cappucino, a glass of orange and one croissant) and take a walk. You will find great little places to spend 5 euro and have the equivalent meal. And you will love the walk. See everything, walk everywhere, eat too much, have pastries every other block. And a wine or six. Just get lost, find a museum, etc. It's a four-day sort of town. And stay here, it's worth the life experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jrld
Reviews.Content: We typically stay in Starwood properties when traveling in Europe as they are great hotels to begin with and typically in great locations. This hotel was everything we expected for our 4 day long weekend in early October 2011. Yes , the hotel is somewhat difficult to find at first, but there are signs to naivgate your way back to the hotel. Upon arrival early in the morning, as expected the room was not ready, so we dropped of our luggage with a bellman and went to enjoy the morning at a cafe in one of the Campos. The staff was friendly, not over the top, but everything I expect of how to be treated when checking in into a hotel. Upon getting to our room in the early afternoon, we realized were upgraded to a suite overlooking the front entrance to the hotel. (no view). We personnaly didn't care as we are not in the room much. The room was fantastic two rooms, large walk in closet and large bathroom. The rooms was very clean, fresh and modern. We did not eat at the hotel, but did enjoy the bar overlooking the canal several times. Yes, the drinks are pricey, but what do you expect at a high end hotel in Venice overlooking the Grand Canal. Surprisingly, the staff was extremely friendly and attentive as at times we find this not always to be in Europe. We did make a trip to Lido, we asked the conceirge about getting a water taxi, but he said the hotel has reciprocity with a hotel over there and will take you for free. Its about a 20 minute ride over, however it is a short walk to town in lido once you get over there. On our final day, we had the water taxi pick us up at our hotel as we had an early morning flight back to the states. It is expensive for a water taxi ( about $140 one way), but it literally takes about 20 minutes early in the morning and illeviates any stress. You can pre book online with the water taxi company for about $90 each way. We will do this on our next visit to Venice. This hotel is great, the conceirge is okay for providing maps and general info. But really explore Venice, there are great restaurants off the beaten path. Don't get hung up on what view you have or what type of room, because this hotel has everything to offer for a trip to Venice. However, the only thing that anoyed me at this hotel was the internet, it was expensive and the only wireless was in the lobby. I think I paid $10 for 15 minutes of internet.

Reviews.Title: “Historical hotel in the heart of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: ianlin
Reviews.Content: Overview: The hotel is in an excellent location. Just a few minutes away from Piazza San Marco. It is an historic hotel. The building appears to several buildings joined together. So the hallways and stairs can be become labyrithine. Overall well maintained. But some areas are definitely showing wear and tear. Rooms: good sized, considering the location. Nicely furnished. Excellent, comfortable beds. We are a family of four. The reservations were made months in advance. We requested adjoining rooms, but got room on different floors instead. Service: the front desk area is very small and can easily become crowded. There was a group of people checking in at the time we checked in. The staff appear to be overwhelmed. Breakfast: Pricey buffet. Nicely located, right next to the water. Reasonably good selection of items. Very good coffee. Internet: very poor signal WiFi. Almost unusable. Definitely not worth paying extra. Conclusion: Nice historic hotel. Wonderful location. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: mdculpepper
Reviews.Content: The Westin hotel chain is one of my favorite and this is hotel is on my short list of favorite hotels. This is a beautiful hotel. Great location on the water and walking distance to all the major attractions, small but comfortable rooms, friendly staff, nice restaurant on the water with a spectacular view (I enjoy the breakfast there the most - it is very expensive however). It is very expensive $$$$

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: barrolove
Reviews.Content: We used part hotel points to book this hotel and found it to be a wonderful experience. This hotel is right on the Grand Canal and has wonderful views from the bar. It is also just a short walk from Harry's Bar and Piazza San Marco. Couldn't have wished for a better place to stay in such a magical city.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: bellaj2000
Reviews.Content: I love Westin properties and this one is no exception. We stayed for five nights during which we celebrated New Year's Eve/Day at this hotel. We had thre rooms during our stay. I recommend the top floor (6th floor) room in the newly rennovated area. It had it's own patio terrace. I also liked the room in the building near the bar. It had a great view of the Grand Canal. My least favorite room was on the second floor with no view and lots of outside and inside noise. The bar is cool but the prices are expensive. It cost 10 Euro for a cup of tea. Great location about three minutes walk to Piazza San Marco, The Doge's Palace, The Clocktower, and St. Mark's Basilica. The staff was helpful for the most part. Great restaurants and gelato nearby. Love this place and will stay here any time I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Location is about all this hotel has going for it”
Reviews.Author: Brooke1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for two nights over the New Year period. Staying on SPG points, and staying over a peak holiday period, there is no doubt we were given a room that would generally not be allocated to guests unless occupancy was very high. The room was dark looking directly into appartments, there were stains on the wallpaper and the marble in the bathroom had large chips in it and the chandelier lights above the bathroom vanity had parts missing and one was partly falling off the mirror. Upon check-out we observed particularly slow and rude service - there was one front desk agent (wearing sunglasses!!?? - not sure if she was trying to disguise a hangover as it was New Years Day) who I observed to be particularly rude to a guest checking out when the guest asked for his receipt to be stamped to show his account had been finalised with cash. The second person working on the desk seemed to have no idea how to check-out a guest in what appeared to be a fairly straight forward check-out. Perhaps the hotel she adopt an option for express check-out considering credit card details for guests are on file. It took 20 minutes of waiting before we checked out but fortunately we had allowed enough time. Having worked with Westin myself previously I know this standard of service would not have been tolerated in hotels I worked with. While the Westin has a superb location, the rooms are of a good size for Europe and of course the Westin beds are known for being comfortable world-wide, I would not recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but needs more staff at reception”
Reviews.Author: tthlady
Reviews.Content: In terms of luxury, this is surely one of the best hotels in Venice, possibly even THE best hotel. I was there on my own and only booked the smallest room, but even this was quite spacious compared to small rooms in other so-called five star hotels. The Westin Heavenly Bed ensured that I had my best night's sleep in ages, the view from the window was fantastic and there was even an additional dressing room. Breakfast was lavish and generally very tasty - apart from the bacon which had far too much fat in it. The service from the staff was generally very good, with one small exception at check out. When I reached the reception to pay my bill there was just one guest in front of me. He seemed to be having tremendous problems with his credit card - or possibly the hotel was having problems with its credit card machine (as they weren't speaking in English I couldn't tell which was the case). 15 to 20 minutes later, I was still standing there before eventually the receptionist told the guest in front of me that he'd have to wait while she served me. Fortunately I had plenty of time, but would have hated to be in this situation if I was in a rush and wondered what might have happened if several people had been trying to check out then? The problem can easily be solved by having a second member of staff who can check guests out. I hope they can sort this out before I go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Singapore_Fish
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on SPG points redemption at the tail-end of our Italy vacation. Given a standard room which we found to be a little dark, but very spacious which is not what we expected given other reviews of this hotel and the norm for this city. We all know Venice is expensive, and the breakfast here was no exception, but it was very high quality and not out of line price wise compared to other hotels. Room service was excellent and a simple misunderstanding on our order was met by a gracious and generous response by the Room Service Manager. Outstanding location makes this Hotel a terrific choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: vlotty
Reviews.Content: Was lucky enough to get upgraded (as an SPG Plat) to a canal view suite. The hotel is located within a 3 minute walk of San Marco Square and close to two vaporetto stops. It's an older property so it has charm, and at least the room that I was in looked like it had been renovated recently. While the front desk staff seemed a little overwhelmed and started off cold, a little chit chat and light banter brought some smiles. Thanks Elena! :) Pros: - Location - Canal view (if you can get it) - Service for Platinum SPG guests - Cleanliness - Bathroom, especially the towel warmers - Internet complimentary for SPG plats Cons: - No wifi in the rooms! (signal is super weak) One thing to keep in mind is if you have a credit card that has no foreign transaction fees, DO NOT opt for the "currency choice" option at check-out, or you will be charged more than you should for the convenience of paying in your native currency.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles73uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a while ago but have only just started writing reviews on this site! I thought The Hotel Westin Europa & Regina was a wonderful hotel. I found it through Citalia and got a great deal; a Junior Suite double room & including breakfast. Because I was arriving so late I decided to take a private water-taxi from the airport & within minutes I was delivered to the Grand Canal entrance of this magnificently restored hotel. You go past the Bar Tiepolo & the Lounge to get to reception. I had a wonderful, clean room, beauifully & lavishly decorated in a traditional Venetian manner, using fine fabrics & high quality furnishings. It had a fabulous king size bed with crisp clean white sheets and pillows. It was also air-conditioned. The bathroom was large and marbled floor to ceiling with a bath and shower. The staff were very helpful. The hotel's Restaurant La Cuisina has a wonderful terrace where you can watch the world float by on the Grand Canal. If you are a solo traveller & looking for a weekend or week away in Venice try this hotel, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “It grows on you”
Reviews.Author: tequilatamm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Hotel Europa & Regina from Christmas Eve until 29-Dec. As platinum guests, we were lucky enough to have a chance to stay in suite 453, more popularly known as "The Talented Mr Ripley" suite, which was the one they used in filming the movie. The suite has 3 window frontages onto the main canal, two in the bedroom, and the lounge area is one window wide. There is also a huge decck off the bedroom, and a smaller connecting deck off the lounge area. Having just come from another Starwood property in Florence which had much larger, more recently renovated rooms, even this top room at the Europa & Regina was a little disappointing in comparison. Firstly, although they told us they had just renovated the soft furnishings in the room, it had that Venice feel, which I like to call crappy chic: A bit dark, and certainly not my style. In addition, although there was a separate lounge room, there was only one TV in the room, which faced into the bedroom, and couldn't be turned sufficiently to watch in the other area. My biggest complaint, however, was the bathroom. It was a huge space, but also had the look of not being touched in years, and not having been kept in very good condition in the meantime. Although it did have a separate bath and shower, it may as well not have, as the shower was one of the tiniest I've ever seen, with a crappy, half-broken shower head, old fashioned and rusted sliding door, and lime scale on everything. I am a rather slender 5'6" woman, and I did not have room to lift my arms in the shower to wash under them. Forget entirely trying to bend over to wash one's hair. This is unacceptable. What made it even more unacceptable to me is the fact that there was plenty of open room in this very large bathroom to simply change the shower tray, add a larger shower screen, and double the shower in size very easily... and once that was done, adding a shower head that is not circa 1920 would have also been a nice touch. The bathroom also had only one sink in it, which I can easily live with, but given the size of the bathroom and the fact that it is one of the better rooms in the hotel, it might have been nice to have two basins in there too. Since we were there for 5 nights, I had a chance to get over my angst and disappointment with the bathroom and try to concentrate on being in Venice. Luckily the sun was up and clear each day, so that although it was cool in winter, it was absolutely beautiful skies and beautiful views. Having the lovely terrace with full views of the canal and distant shores was sensational, and the sunrises and gondola singers' music wafting off the water each day made me forget the few minutes each day I had to trudge to the tiny shower box and try in vain to wash myself sufficiently in it. The bed was comfortable, and the lighting in the room good, although it was impossible to turn off the overhead lights without also turning off the bedside lights, another thing I struggled with. It was all or nothing, and no chance to have low lighting just next to the bed when retiring for the night. We ate breakfast each day in the hotel, and the buffet is a very nice one, with some fresh juices, prosecco, reasonable scrambled eggs (which they so often aren't on buffets),also a harder frittata egg dish, cheeses, meats, fresh and canned/dried fruits and nuts, yogurts and yogurt drinks, pastries and tarts, and toast and cereals. And the views from the breakfast room are also nice, but would be even nicer in summer when you could sit out on the deck without freezing! The concierges at the hotel were exceptional, especially Alessandro, who helped us try to organize porter service by calling some colleagues in Milan... pre-arranged porter service in Milan is nearly impossible to arrange, but he found us a compromise that was suitable, for our ensuing visit there after Venice. We also had hotel boat transfers each way from the train station in Veice to the hotel, and it was prompt and efficient, even though this time of year they use taxis and tour guides to escort you to/from the train, rather than their own boats and people. Efficient and worth the money. The title of my review is "it grows on you" because this was the reaction someone else who stayed at the Europa & Regina had to it when telling people to give it a chance for a few days. Certainly my fondness for the terraced half of the room grew each day, and I enjoyed that half of the suite... then I would trudge back to the other part in the background where the crappy shower was, and be let down again. I give this hotel 4 stars only because we were in what the front desk manager called "The best room in the hotel." I certainly hope it wasn't THE best, because while it was large by Venetian Standards, and the terrace was nice, the furnishings and certainly the bathroom were a huge let-down. Had it not been such a large room with a view, I would have given my experience there only two or three stars at best. Would I stay here again? If not in this suite, I wouldn't even consider it... and if my intention was to stay in this suite or at another hotel, there are several other properties I would investigate very thoroughly as alternatives, before even considering it. The property could be nice if it had a large renovation to bring it up to proper standards and take a little of the crappy out of the chic. It looks a bit tired, even by Venice standards, and needs a facelift and new bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Grand & Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: M0ppy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Westin after a 2 night stay off the island, we got a water taxi from the train station as there was no way we were going to walk with all our luggage - it isnt the cheapest taxi around but with 6 of us it worked out ok. As soon as you walk into the property you are taken back a few hundred years and it does have a very charming old world charm about it - all the decorations and marble flooring give it that added touch. The rooms are not huge however we were lucky enough to have a small balcony so we could step out and see the water from. The hotel is close to everything and there are small cafes and restuarants around every corner which cater for all types of travellers. Dont expect to stay out for long as most restaurants are closed by 11 or 12. It is a little on the expensive side however you need to expect that from Venice or Italy as a whole - dont forget your cheque book :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, expensive, and quirky. Just like Venice.”
Reviews.Author: twinlions
Reviews.Content: Our room was right on the Grand Canal with huge, shuttered windows we could actually sit in and watch the boat traffic. The room was smaller than in other cities, but by European standards, was perfectly adequate, and beautifully furnished. The paint and fabrics looked recently refurbished. The bar and restaurant are very expensive, but c'mon, you're sitting right on the water and we lingered over glasses of wine, and never felt like we were being rushed. Little oddities: Lovely floor lamp that could never be used because the nearest outlet was across the room. Burnt out lightbulbs that were never replaced, no matter how many times we asked. A refrigerator that was permanently set at lukewarm. But we adore Venice and overlook many of the minor challenges that seem to give other travelers fits, and so it goes for this hotel with its amazing setting and gorgeous public spaces. All in all, an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Starwood choice for Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Ringettechick
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed for 2 nights before our cruise. We were torn between booking at the Hilton across the river and this Westin. We're glad we booked with the Westin as there were so many more things to see within walking distance. Here's what you need to know: Getting There: There are only 2 ways to get to the Westin, by Water Taxi or by Water Bus â€“ there are no roads with vehicles anywhere. The water taxi is called Water Taxi and is more like a limo (see picture with green leather seats of the boat) and itâ€™s a private ride costing about $100 USD. The Water Bus is called AliLaguna and this is what we chose to get from the airport to the hotel as it was only about $13 per person. This is the most affordable option however do not choose this if you land at night â€“ actually Iâ€™m not even sure if they still run at night. The ride from the airport to the Westin using AliLaguna is great â€“ however is about 2 hours â€“ but treat it like an excursion. From getting off the plane to catching the boat which only runs every 30 minutes, the whole process may take you 3 hours from landing to hotel check-in. The boat ride is slow and you get some wonderful views of the city and surrounding islands. Alilaguna stops at each of the smaller islands the. If you have lots of luggage you may want to consider hiring the Water Limo (taxi) which drives you right to the Westin waterfront entrance. Disembarking the water taxi: Finding the hotel is a little tricky since itâ€™s on the waterfront and is situated down skinny alleys which makes it hard to find â€“ especially at night. Get off the Alilaguna water bus at the San Marco stop. From here you will have to walk about 3 blocks to the hotel. Keep in mind there is no one to hire/help you carry your luggage or carts to rent, so you will have to carry/roll your own luggage. There are a couple of small bridges to cross over which are staircases with no ramps. I would advise to pack light and use sturdy suitcases with strong wheels to go over the old stone walkways. Once you get directions from the water bus staff for the Westin, as you start walking you will come upon a square with Hotel Bauer, from there cross the bridge and immediately turn left into the alley along the waterway/gondola station. Through the alley is another small boutique hotel and then around the corner is the front entrance to the Westin. Voila! Check In: The check in process was simple and the front desk was very pleasant with basic English skills. They actually use iPads to sign you in. Hotel location: The Westin is surrounded by very expensive shops (Gucci, Prada) and itâ€™s a good 15 â€“ 20 minute walk away to much more affordable options for shopping and restaurants, which is in the district known as Rialto. I think next time I would choose to stay in this area instead. Donâ€™t get me wrong â€“ there are plenty of restaurants near the Westin, however spaghetti nearby would be 14 euros and if you walk 15 minutes you can get it for 9 euros just as good. Rialto has a grocery store called Billa and itâ€™s a wonderful place to get the basic goods like water and snacks. Panna 1 litre bottle of water is only .47 pence at Billa versus 3 Euros at a convenience store/deli near the Westin. One day we walked around the whole island(s) from the Westin to Campo Roma, to Rialto and back to San Marco, which took about 6 â€“ 7 hours including shopping and lunch. The whole time we felt completely safe and it was actually really fun to get lost in all of the alleys! The city is all pedestrian only and NOT wheelchair/accessible friendly despite what you may read. Concierge: There were always men at the concierge/bell desk around to help with luggage and shopping packages. The Very helpful, spoke great English and we went to both restaurants he recommended for pizza and then for a fancy meal at Vino Vino. Both were great experiences. Inside Hotel: Restaurant and the bar were very expensive so we did not eat or drink there. For example the Toast (which actually is 2 slices of toast, cream cheese and a slice of ham) is $10 USD. Lobby was a gorgeous marble foyer with a ballroom on the main floor and various smaller meeting rooms. There were only 6 floors to the hotel so it was small for a Westin but very classy with a grand staircase throughout the centre of the hotel so you could take the stairs to your room. Bedroom: We were graciously upgraded to a full suite upon check-in with itâ€™s own living room, walk-in closet/change room, very large bathroom and the King bed was 2 singles put together with their own individual linen. This is great as you can not steal each others covers making for a wonderful sleep! The walk in closet had 2 luggage stands and a full length mirror, along with shelving and storage area. The value of the room is about $800 Euros/night but we are SPG Platinum and used points. The bathroom was wonderful with the usual Westin Speakman showerhead, (great water pressure) and in addition a hand held shower head. The bathroom also had heated towel rod. Internet: Can you believe in this day and age there was no wireless internet! Only wired from the desk in the bedroom, which was complimentary. We travel with iPhone so found that frustrating. Everything else was excellent and we hope to return when the warmer weather comes! I figure you can see the room/hotel photos on every other website, so I have included pictures on how to get to the Westin from the San Marco water bus/Alilaguna stop.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a romantic place”
Reviews.Author: HakeemHaron
Reviews.Content: First impression of the hotel was really good. Me and my wife were taken aback by its beautiful decor. The chandeliers and marbles lined along the lobby of the hotel was breathtaking. We took a room overlooking the grand canal which cost us a bomb but it was worth it. The view was stunning, the room was spacious and the bathroom was as big as the room itself. The location of the hotel was excellent as well, only a few minutes walk from the Piazza San Marco. Just around the corner of the hotel is where the designer boutiques. So for those who loves to shop, its a great location. However the breakfast buffet spread was disappointing. I have stayed in few Starwood hotels across the globe and i have come across better breakfast buffet spread. We were also quite disappointed with the bed, we were given 2 single beds attached together to make a queen bed. When we asked we were told that is the standard. How bizarre. But we didnt make so much fuss about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: wvillegasv
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Westin Europa & Regina last april, and I can't really complain about anything. The location is perfect and close to everything, although a little bit difficult to find if you are not familiar with the city and don't speak enough Italian to ask. The rooms are not huge but they are very nice, comfortable, and with everything your need. The service is impeccable, and the breakfast in the terrace is amazing (they have the best hot cocoa I have ever had). The city is just incredible, we visited a few places in Europe and Venice is one of may favorite cities.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the canal!”
Reviews.Author: nyc1acc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the canal, we hopped off the Vapporetto (public water taxi) and we were right there. The rooms are small, but expected in Venice. Decorated lovely! Beautiful bathroom too. The room had a view of the canal that was gorgeous. But I didn't even buy a snack or bottle of water from the hotel, as it is ridiculously expensive. The staff was extremely helpful. One of the best experiences on my trip the concierge set us up with free transportation (private water taxi) to Murano Island where a gentleman was waiting to give us a tour of a Murano gallery and glass blowing shop. Just amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, yes; but a nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Witness2000
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is ideal--along the canal and minutes from the main square. Excellent shopping and restaurants are nearby. There is also a stop for the public transport within wakling distance. The Westin is a classic, elegant hotel in excellent physical condition with nicely appointed rooms and spacious bathrooms. Guest rooms appear to have been renovated recently.. Service was capable, although did not stand out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great views”
Reviews.Author: Harbourbridgetopumpr
Reviews.Content: Arrived by boat from the airport, so was very easy to get to. It is very difficult to find on foot, tucked away from main lane ways. It is very close St Marco square, shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is nothing flash, but the reason for saying here would be the location and the potential to get a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Generator515
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights on our honeymoon at the end of November. I paid for the room using Starwood's cash and points option. We arrived at the hotel after taking the vaparetto from the train station. You can take the #1 or the #2 express boats. We got a little lost coming off the boat but eventually got there after googling the directions on my phone. We checked in and were given a renovated room. It had a couch, view of the courtyard, huge closet area and huge bathroom...especially for European standards. The beds were firmer than I am used to for Westin's here in the US but I still slept like a log. One of the best perks of this room (or hotel at least) was that each day there was a new complimentary bottle of Aqua Panna. Also nice was after our first day of sightseeing, when we arrived back at the room, the hotel manager had sent us a chocolate cake, a bottle of Voss water and a nice note congratulating us on our wedding. Was truly a nice touch. The hotel was located within a 3 minute walk of St. Mark's square. It was down what I would consider a main shopping artery of the city. However, to get to the hotel you had to 'navigate' a few alleys back which really helped you get away from the crowds while being so close to the main areas. Overall, we were really happy with the hotel. It was clean, comfortable, located perfectly and overall just a nice hotel. We would not hesitate to stay here again should we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “the best balcony on the canal - Room 456”
Reviews.Author: Margaret P
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 12 nights staying in your hotel in room 456 with surely the best balcony on the canal and were able to drink champagne whilst watching 100 metres away the finish of the Venice Marathon as the runners crossed the temporary bridge over the Grand Canal. The position of your Hotel is magnificent, and decore was superb and your staff were most professional and obliging. this is the finest Hotel we have stayed in, in over, 20 years of international travel. We applaud your excellence. From Doctor Ian and Margaret Pope of Flagstaff Hill, Australia 5159. We will certainly stay with you next time we stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dededa80
Reviews.Content: The Europa & Regina is such a beautiful hotel and it is in the perfect location. The hotel is within minutes from San Marco, where all the major transportation are. We had a room on the fifth floor and every morning, I enjoyed waking up and stepping out to the balcony and look out to the grand canal. It was a great way to start the day. We booked a standard room using points and cash and the room itself was beautiful. The room was bigger than your usual european rooms and the bathroom was huge. I felt this was the perfect location and perfect hotel for our visit in Venice. The hotel is ~35 minute water bus ride from the train station and 90 minutes ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Big Let Down!”
Reviews.Author: Aymrz
Reviews.Content: We traveled this fall through Switzerland and Italy. This was my fourth time back to Venice. I wanted to do something special for my fiancÃ©' since he had never been there so I spent the extra money to get a " grand canal view" room. Of all the rooms we had on our trip this was the smallest... the worst view, tiny window, no balcony, small bathroom, water pressure terrible,mediocre service. The canal view was certainly not grand and breakfast was outrageously priced. For less money comparably on this trip we were in two room luxury suites with great views and balconies across the entire front of both rooms. With complimentary champagne , fruit, cookies and chocolate each night. I know Venice is expensive but having stayed there before I know you can do much better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location To Enjoy Venice”
Reviews.Author: lgaynor
Reviews.Content: When in Venice you need a nice hotel to recover from the throngs of tourists and pigeons. The Westin offers such and sports the perfect location on one of the main canals. The 50 minute water taxi ride pulls right up to the Westin (Westin arranges transportation for additional 60 Euro but worth it. Check in is easy with plenty of concierge attendants to assist you. Request a room with a shower or bath dependent on your preference. Surely request a water view. Rooms are small but you have the Westin bed. My shower was the size of a coffin and felt like it so you get in and out fast. Excellent breakfast buffet, good mix of American and European selections. Great cozy bar with live piano music on weekends. Restaurant very good though pricey but everything in Venice is pricey. Location is perfect, 5 minutes from the square. Downside: The gym is tiny and don't plan on doing weights or stretching. I asked the concierge for a yoga mat and they took out a map finding a yogurt store for me. Seems exercise is a word not in the Italian language. Very little meeting room space but good for groups of 30 or less. Service is efficient and plenty of English spoken. Recommend for business and couples. But after dealing with the tourists and pigeons, two nights is plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think that $700 will buy you good service”
Reviews.Author: Tcuherman
Reviews.Content: Pros: hotel is ritzy, well located, great view of canal Cons: service/value Joined trip advisor partly to make this review- was disappointed with our stay here. For all the money you will sink into this place, you would expect top-notch service. Your expectations would be wrong, as the staff is smug and even seem to be annoyed buy your questions. Too frequently you will find nobody behind the front desk and the bellman only offers short answers with no real effort to go above and beyond. Pipe broke on our last night and no hot water from then to checkout. Of course nobody told us and there were no apologies. Hope future travelers will heed the warnings of myself and others, don't come here expecting Ritz service, just Ritz prices.

Reviews.Title: “Just a bit over priced”
Reviews.Author: craigpainter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in town for the Venice Biennale and used points to stay at the Westin. We were stuck in a nice large back room w/ views of the alley and the noise of the hotel workers taking breaks and the loud metal carts moving trash, laundry, supplies all day and all night. Front desk was polite, especially after asking for a "plug-in" to get rid of the mosquitos. Breakfast was an experience w/ outstanding food and lack luster service. The bar had great food too, but of course you had to wait and hour before getting the attention of the waiter and then another to get your drinks and food. We changed hotels and had a much more civilized stay. I will say it was worth it to try it once, but we will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding property”
Reviews.Author: sfdann
Reviews.Content: Not only is the location exceptional and the renovated rooms sumptuous, but the attentive service is a true standout. Every single member of the staff with whom we interacted was eager to please and provide us assistance around every corner. The lovely restaurant deck off of the Regina is worth every penny just to sit in the sun and watch the Grand Canal go by. I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel - and I appreciate that they were anticipating our needs. Service in Italy is hardly a guarantee but I would like to say that at the Westin, they are completely up to the task and it is a most refreshing spot to put up your feet in one of the world's most beautiful cities. Thank you for the professionalism and the absolutely fantastic assistance while on the road. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “A sparkling gem on the Grand Canal, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Beverley W
Reviews.Content: â€œAmazingâ€� and â€œbreath-takingâ€� is how I would describe the Westin Europa & Regina Hotel in Venice â€“ it is certainly is â€œone in a millionâ€� in the hotel world and we have seen a few gems along the way. From a huge selection of beautiful Venetian hotels and palaces, we selected the Europa as THE place for our wedding reception last year. The location is just stunning, set right on the Grand Canal, with San Marco just around the corner, and the beautiful Santa Maria della Salute church opposite â€“ it just couldnâ€™t be better. When you arrive at the hotel jetty, your amazing experience starts â€¦ met by the very helpful and friendly hotel staff you are ushered into the opulent marbled entrance towards reception. This is the shape of things to come. We particularly loved the bar and terrace and just watching the world go by, the Grand Canal never sleeps and once youâ€™re hooked, you just canâ€™t get enough of it. The same applies to La Cusina restaurant at the Europa â€“ with its inside and canal-side seating areas, having breakfast and dinner were an absolute delight. The standard of the breakfast is amazing, I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever seen so much choice, and the food at lunch and dinner was excellent and very well presented. For our wedding reception, we had 80+ guests and the majority all stayed at the Europa and they loved it too. The overall experience of the food, drinks, atmosphere, service, dÃ©cor etc, in fact, the whole package on our wedding day was totally amazing and made this an unforgettable experience for us and our guests. For a very demanding couple (!!), the hotel staff handled every request with a smile â€“ particularly Bjorn who was an absolute star â€“ and the day just went like clockwork. To say that it is still the talking point of all our friends a year on is an understatement! We went back there in August on our first anniversary to â€œourâ€� room (which has a terrace overlooking the Grand Canal) and we're already planning our next visit for 2012. Venice and the Europa are firmly fixed in our hearts and I cannot recommend the Europa highly enough! So please book it and see for yourself â€“ you wonâ€™t be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “would love to come back”
Reviews.Author: michael l
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were amazingly helpful, always patient and courteous. The rooms were nicely decorated and the lobby and grandcanal front were beautiful. My only problem was with the check in staff- they were under pressure as the hotel was booked and not very attentive and very brisk, and a little rude. This would not make me hesitate for a second in coming back though.

Reviews.Title: “Top 10”
Reviews.Author: Graham M
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Europa and Regina. From the moment the proter took our bads off the water taxi to the moment we leaft we found the service impecable. All the staff from the check in to the dining room were freindly helpful and effective at what they did. We had a great room overlooking the Grand Canal and would wake in the morning with the sun coming over the horizon bathing everything in sunlight. Absolutely magnificant. And don't miss the bar with its traditional Italian marble. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Bibbie371
Reviews.Content: Right on the Canal. Water taxi arrival. Lovely, small hotel . Fairly expensive but rooms are clean and bathroom was done in beautiful marble. Attentive, helpful staff that speaks English. Easy walk to San Marcos and great shopping. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and great experience!”
Reviews.Author: TexasRobert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for six nights in October with a conference rate that was much lower than the usual rate and were very pleased with our experience. The hotel location is truly outstanding- very close to San Marco, tons of restaurants close by, and on the Grand Canal. Our doubleroom was very comfortable and large by Italian standards. The housekeeping service kept our room very clean. I used the gym several days and it is by no means fancy but is adequate for cardio (stairmaster, treadmills, ellipticals), had a free weights set, and all worked well. While we never made it to breakfast, the waitstaff were pleased to provide my husband and I two coffees to go each morning, which was great, as in-room coffee makers (and irons) are not allowable in Venice hotel rooms. We absolutely LOVED the outside bar patio and feel the high price of the drinks were well worth watching and listening to the gondoliers serenade everyone. Our only complaint was that there was no air conditioning (only heat at the time) and the only way to cool off was to open the window, which invited a massive amount of mosquitoes. The hotel abliged our request for a fan, but it only helped a little. Finally, we enjoyed the trip to Murano but felt like the visit to Harry's Bar was absolutely NOT worth the 15 euro bellinis. In sum, we enjoyed our time at the Westin and would very likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location but a little difficult to find the first time...”
Reviews.Author: time2share
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I stayed here for 5 nights with the Westin points program. The location was centrally, not too far from San Marco Square and the main vaporetto stops. As members of the Starwood program we received a room upgrade to a partial grand canal view on the 3th floor. Our room had two balcony's. Large bathoom, bathtub, separate shower, bidet etc.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Views- Best Location In Venice. Stay here once in your LIFE!”
Reviews.Author: bexpo
Reviews.Content: This is a special hotel - but you must request & reserve a Grand Canal view. We splurged when we decided to stay here - and it was worth it. Do the same - save somewhere else but do not miss this opportunity to watch Venice from your room window. Our room #250 had four large floor to ceiling windows that opened onto small balconies. We could step out on these balconies and watch Venice at every vantage point. Sunrises, Sunsets, Grand Canal, small canal view, also at the mouth of the Grand Canal allows you to see the Huge Ships as well enter & leave the city. The colors that the city and water turn are different at each time of the day. You see the sunrise over purple water in the morning. In the afternoon there is an orange yellow hue that embraces every boat, building and of course the sky. At night you the Canal sparkles like diamonds as the enormous splendid cruise ships arrive one after another - larger and grander than the one before. -I kid you not - If you are going to Italy - this hotel is where you should put your money - the views are worth every penny. Our room was classical and lovely - a bottle of Italian champagne with beautiful truffle chocolates were delivered on our first night. The bar and breakfast bistro are expensive but again the views are spectacular. The bartender Nicola was so friendly and helpful - he gave us many tips to enjoy the city. The staff is very helpful - especially the restaurant & bar personnel. Very charming. The hotel is also minutes away from San Marco square and has a splendid private entrance that gives you a refuge from the massive crowds that inhabit Venice. This hotel is magical. It is beautifully appointed in the Venetian style with glorious glass chandeliers and marble pillars, gold filagree moldings & details. I do not usually spend this amount of money on a hotel - but do it - you will remember the magic of Venice that few get to experience from this vantage point. There is nothing better than this. Experience it - even if it is just this once! Room 250.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: HarleyMarley
Reviews.Content: Wow what a wonderful place. We considered going to Venice for several years but in order to get exactly what we wanted - a Grand Canal view - we always found it too expensive. However, a 50th birthday came along and we pushed the boat out! The room was very luxurious - tall ceiling, felt very classical without being over the top or too 'old worldy', marble bathroom, comfortable bed, well appointed and had two balconies where we could just sit and watch the world float by. The location is excellent - 2 minutes to St Mark's Square and 2 minutes to a water bus stop. Breakfast was full of choice and because the weather was so good we could sit out on the veranda by the Grand Canal. Staff were helpful and on arrival we were greeted by a bottle of sparkling wine, cake and fruit. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and would stay here again next time we visit Venice. It is an amazing and very special city.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Yoshihiro M
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, no welcome, no smile, no greetings! Expensive but no service. I will not stay at this Westin anymore!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!!”
Reviews.Author: Jmonty26
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the nicest and best located for our entire Italy trip. The rooms were decent size- we had a canal view which was amazing!! The service impeccable and every inch of the hotel sparkling clean. Prices at the restaurant and bar were extreeeeemly expensive, but conducive to the San Marco area. I would absolutely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingfool111
Reviews.Content: The Europa & Regina is in a perfect location! Easy to walk everywhere in Venice. The rooms are lovely. I had an upgrade to a wonderful suite on the 6th floor with views of the grand canal on one side and the mountains of Italy on the other. It certainly made my first trip to Venice memorable. My big complaint is that you turn your room key in to the concierge's desk as you leave the hotel and when you return sometimes you wait in line for a long time to retrieve it while the concierge is helping another guest. However, there is not a doubt that I would stay at The Europa & Regina on my next trip to Venice, it's a wonderful hotel! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOOD OFFERING”
Reviews.Author: TuscanGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Nice Location, nice rooms, nice staff, great food experience: taste the seafood antipasto (4 ways of tasting the local seafood) and a great risotto with black squid ink, raw shrimps and shrimps gelato= to die for! Great breakfast offering as well. Claudio the Maitre D' is a truly professional staff member! The only negative point is the 12 euros per person of cover charge, nowaday this is a out of time supplement charge not needed when you pay a course 34+ euros each!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: happy2bhere_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights October 2011. The beautiful room we stayed in was #150 with a totally gorgeous view of Santa Maria della Salute (double Grand Canal view). They gave us complementary champagne and chocolates. Followed the map to the hotel with no trouble. We could not be more pleased with the room and the staff was very friendly and informative. A special thanks to a lady at the front desk by the name of Sabrina who went out of her way to help us when we needed it. Wonderful breakfast. Thank you Europa and Regina for a most wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value”
Reviews.Author: LeonieshorncliffeQLD
Reviews.Content: We paid the most for this hotel than any of our 7 hotels in Italy. It is a typical 5 star Westin with comfy beds (still with the ridge in the middle as usual) and adequate sized rooms and bathroom, well appointed but no view. The foyer and dining areas are quite palatial. Breakfast has good variety and a view of the canal. Unfortunately this hotel came with a snooty 5 star attitude, we did not feel like it was our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: alexandradf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Europa Regina for a wedding, which was being held on the property. Had a wonderful room with a gigantic terrace overlooking the stunning Santa Maria della Salute church. The location is literally minutes from St. Mark's Square and surrounding high fashion shops. The breakfast in the morning outdoors overlooking the Grand Canal were the most memorable part of my stay. For my complete review of this hotel, with many pictures of my room, please visit my blog post at: http://www.destinationsperfected.com/2011/09/venice-italy-westin-europa-regina.html

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: rc51
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few years ago. Our room was a corner room overlooking the canal and Santa Maria della Salute so the location could not be better in the whole of Venice. The bathroom was the most luxurious I have ever seen in a hotel. Marvellous breakfast served in the dining room, again overlooking the canal. In an overcrowded city at almost any time of the year it's good to have a hotel that is situated in the heart of the city yet tucked away from the madding crowds!! I would not stay at the more famous Danieli as the location is right on the most touristy part. It was great to arrive by water taxi from the airport. All in all, a great stay but agree that a canal view room is probably a must even if you pay a high premium for that priviledge. Highly recommended. (stayed prior to 2010)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DXBDan
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights here on SPG C&P at a very good rate. Hotel is in fantastic location just off Piazza San Marco. Our room was small (as expected) but well appointed and nicely presented. given the excellent location we ate almost exclusively outside of the hotel, save for a room service pizza upon arrival (Euros 50). If you can get a good rate, I would recommend for the location alone. Service was OK. The concierge helped out with a couple of queries but apart from that did not spend that much time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Travelscambuster
Reviews.Content: Tough to beat the location. It is right on the Grand Canal and only a 2 minute walk from St. Mark's Square. Our room was recently renovated, but it was a handicapped accessible room and therefore the bathroom was not great for the non-handicapped. For the price we paid we expected a Grand Canal front room, bur only had a partial view. So before you take out a mortgage for a canal front room make sure you know what you are getting. Overall we had a good stay. My only issue was with the bar. We sat on the deck right on the Grand Canal for a pre-dinner drink (probably one of the best spots in Venice). I ordered a vodka on the rocks for $18 Euros and received the a single measured shot. Not exactly what I would expect as a hotel guest and for nearly $25.00. That seems like nickel and diming. I would expect better at a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, location, and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Irone
Reviews.Content: The Europa & Regina is a splendid hotel in Venice with superb customer service. I must make special mention of Attilio Dalla Mura, the front desk manager who made our stay especially pleasant. There was some confusion about paying with Starwood points and cash which he handled neatly, converting my Starwood points into a free stay. Apparently, I had plenty of points to cover but they hadn't come through at the time I made my reservation in June. The cleanliness, decor, and quiet location in Venice make it a come-back-to hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariettaEdw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on points for one night and got a room overlooking the canal. it was incredible. great location as well. two complaints: not a big fan of the new westin gym, not much to it around weights and machines. wish that westins would offer free wi fi access at least in the lobby area. i know that these are top end hotels but to me, wi fi should not be charged for especially in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “They look after you”
Reviews.Author: divaAthens
Reviews.Content: I m a Spg holder and my wife arranged a nice weekend in Venice for my 50th birthday. The rooms division was excellent by providing a penthouse suite overlooking all Venice. A small birthday cake was also very much appreciated. The professional response from the hotel staff to our occasion made our stay unforgettable. We strongly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Gorgeousgoa
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location for my wife's first visit to Venice! As a regular visitor to Venice (6-8 times per year) I rarely get to see Venice as a tourist. Our water taxi dropped us at the jetty where the concierge greets you warmly, check in was a bit a wait due to an American couple wanting information ;( The suite we were given was huge and very very comfortable. The concierge was a star, multi-lingual and nothing is too much trouble. We didn't eat in the hotel as you are spoilt for choice in Venice, but as a base this is afantastic hotel (if you can't afford the Danielle). Would I stay here again most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to Venice, and our third visit to the Europa and Regina in Venice. The service is excellent, and we were thrilled to have a room overlooking the Grand Canale. One of the things I love most about this hotel is it's easy access to the main stream of shopping and its close proximity to St. Marks Square. Also, I have been there during the high tide experience, and this hotel is one of the last to have water enter the lobby. As we walked to all of the other hotels, we noted that most, if not all, had the traditional "table" entrance into the hotel. The Europa and Regina did not have this issue during our stay, and it was a joy to directly reach the hotel from the Grand Canale via our vaporetto. Food is great, and the scenic view from the bar and restaurant is magnificnet.

Reviews.Title: “Like it but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jan B
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Westin and our expectations were met with a beautiful room. I would say that the front desk and help was low to poor - not really interested in our problems or our needs. This is an expensive hotel and one would think that morning coffee or free wi-fi to your room would be available. We stayed at 3 stars on our journey to Venice and got a lot more for our money. Also they boast being on the Grand Canal but I wonder how many suites they actually have for customers? All the reviews I have read people were all facing that darn courtyard - not a tree or flower anywhere to make it look nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, short walk to shops and St. Marks”
Reviews.Author: Albert S
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 traveled (kids 6 and 10 years old) to Venice in August. Booked connecting rooms because we couldn't have more than 3 people per room.
