I'm Starwoods Gold and I used points. Got two beautiful rooms but with limited view of the canal, which was fine since we spent most of our time outdoors. The hotel is very nice and convenient; close to a gondola station (must do when in Venice) and vaporetto stops. Be sure to get off on the San Marcos vaporetto station when you get in to Venice and it's a short walk to hotel. It's a bit hard to find initially (just be sure to walk left after the San Marcos vaporetto stop)

Reviews.Title: “Not a full experience”
Reviews.Author: Alex O
Reviews.Content: Well located and comfortable room. On the other hand do not expect much for concierge help, and try asking locals for better advice. Teh concierges would follow the path of less resistance when sked to do something for you, so avoid them if you can. Do not eat in the hotel if the meal is not included in your room, a one person breakfast can set you back 45EU each day. A cup of tea is 10 EU. Pubic areas are full of smokers, so if you do not smoke you are better to stay in your room. Turn down service in the evening is inconsistent, so if you want it, call every night and request it. To the credit of the staff, once you bring up an issue, they will do their best to make you happy.

Reviews.Title: “Venice with a View, Spectacular Service”
Reviews.Author: ggtrix
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a Jewel. It is centrally located so getting anywhere in Venice on foot - without use of a water taxi - is not an issue at all. The food is spectacular and served on a lovely terrace overlooking the canal. The concierge is knowledgeable and quite direct - with the clear goal of making whatever excursion you chose a success. The accommodations beautiful decorated and extremely well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Upsetting Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Jessica R
Reviews.Content: I tried to prepare myself for the "old Charm" of Venice but as a honeymooner nearing the end of a dream tour of Italy I was sorely disappointed by the Westin. The main facilities were very nice (particularly if you like excess in marble). The bar, lounge and breakfast patio were all beautifully situated and the breakfast food was good. The shortcomings were in the service received and the accommodations. Upon arrival we received minimal attention in the course of checking in and no service for luggage was offered - even though our room was down 4 halls, across 5 sets of steps and an elevator ride away. The room itself failed to meet basic cleanliness in every area except the bedding. Carpet was threadbare and felt dirty underfoot, the wallcovering had numerous water stains and all furniture showed its excessive wear. In the bathroom water pressure was poor, temp was difficult to control and a lighting fixture was broken. Another room was offered in response to our upset but it was not better in cleanliness, only in proximity to the lobby. Nearly all further attempts to correct the problem had to be initiated by us and no option of refund for some of the nights - which would have allowed us to stay elsewhere - was allowed, even at the protest of our travel agent and booking agency. Although some staff seemed attentive and kind I cannot say that was the overall impressions received during our stay. Not worth the money or experience - if headed to Venice venture away from St. Marks and stay happily at a cheery and clean alternative.

Reviews.Title: “An experience I'll remember with joy for a long time...”
Reviews.Author: Sophie E
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day stay in Venice. Let's face it, Venice is a very special place, but I didn't think the hotel I chose could make my holiday so perfect. An example. Breakfast in 5 stars hotels is expensive. Well I wouldn't be able to think of a price I would not be prepared to pay to have breakfast at the Europa & Regina. How can you put a price on being served a delicious breakfast seating next to the Canal Grande water, overlooking Santa Maria della Salute with a few gondolas gently floating a stone throw from you? I believe you just can't!!! Same goes for the bar and the restaurant, which offer exactly the same amazing experience. And how about getting to your hotel by taking a boat and being received by impeccable and friendly staff directly on the Grand Canal in Venice, which is the address of your hotel? Giuseppe, the hotel director was always kind, resourceful and charming as you would expect a good hotel director to be. My boyfriend got to Venice with a bad foot as he had a sport accident the week before and he was using a stick not to put weight on his foot. Of course after walking around all of Venice the foot got worse! Well, no problem, had a chat with Giuseppe and in a few minutes a pair of crutches were delivered to our room, and my boyfriend could use them for the rest of our stay. Suites or rooms with a view are highly recommended as again, it is hard to put a price on this rare luxury. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but this is Venice”
Reviews.Author: mebiner
Reviews.Content: Very good location on the Grand Canal, although the majority of rooms do not overlook the water at all. Close to San Marco and even a couple of relatively reasonable restaurants, but the rooms are not particularly special despite the descriptions on the Starwood site as "luxurious" and "elegant" furnishings. The front desk staff was mixed: friendly, cheerful at check-in and check-out, but the concierge was less so. We used a combination of Starwood points and cash for a room that cost 345 Euros/night ($500), and this was by far the most expensive room we have ever stayed in. Internet is not free in the hotel, and cost 35 euros per day (!) in the room for 24 hours of internet access and cable TV. I hate when hotels charge extra for internet when they already have such an expensive nightly rate. Location is the best attribute of the hotel, and that essentially triples the price for what the room is actually worth. Tip, to reach the hotel take Vaporetto #2 to San Marco, faster than #1, which has about twice as many stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: MH_Brasil
Reviews.Content: Great location on the Grand Canal, near the Piazza San Marco. Spacious, comfortable and well decorated (Grand Deluxe Double). Huge and well equipped bathroom. Spectacular Breakfast, with the view of the Grand Canal. Helpful and competent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, beautiful hotel but average for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Mick R
Reviews.Content: Perhaps our expectations were a little high and subsequently we were a little disapointed. The canal view rooms are great, good size and clean. The hotel is beautiful and the staff were helpful and friendly. The bar provides a supurb view and a great place to sip cocktails after a day trawling Venice. The restaurant was somewhat disapointing, most expensive meal we had whilst visiting Italy and was completely uninspiring. Overall, we had high expectations for this hotel but in the end were a little uninspired but unable to quite put our finger on why!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for SPG Platinum members.”
Reviews.Author: albutt27
Reviews.Content: Westin Europa â€“ Venice As a SPG Platinum member, I stay at Starwood hotels over 100 nights per year. I booked this hotel 6 months in advanced using my points. I had requested an upgrade that I had to pay for using additional points. The hotel is about a 5-minute walk from the San Marco station. However, if you have suitcases it can be a pain getting up the stairs. Upon arrival, we were told our room wouldnâ€™t be available for another few hours so we decided to get lunch. Coming back, a staff member escorted us to our hotel where my reaction was a big WTF!!! This was one of the worst rooms in the hotel. Our view consisted of construction to the courtyard. I could hear the construction people yelling to each other. Really, as a SPG Platinum member, this was what I was given? I complained and they said another room would be available in another 2 hours. After taking an all nighter, the first thing we wanted to do was shower and not wait until 7 PM for our room. However, they let us use the original room given to shower and relax. I couldnâ€™t believe that they tried to pass of a regular room as an upgrade, and they said they would move me as they had a cancellation (umm sure). The next room given was a 1-bedroom suite that was nice but had no view of the grand canal. I had the same view of the construction overlooking the courtyard. The whole point of spending additional points for an upgrade was for a room overlooking the canal. Not to sound snobby, but when youâ€™re at the top level status youâ€™re usually â€˜thankedâ€™ and I did not feel appreciated. I heard another couple complaining as well, and the hotel said it was due to the Venice Film Festival. Do they stay at SPG hotels over 100 nights per year? I donâ€™t think so, so I guess they take care of their own. The location of the hotel is nice, a short walk to San Marcos and the Rialto bridge. The concierge was pretty helpful, but the map they give use practically useless. Finding a restaurant down in San Polo is like finding a needle in a haystack.. However, the people checking us in were kinda rude and didnâ€™t have a smile on their face. I had to ask about internet service which is usually given to me when I check in. The wifi is pretty bad as I wasnâ€™t able to get a connection in my room unless I manually connected via lan line. Would I stay here again? No, I would not, as there are other SPG/Hilton hotels in the area that treat their top tier status members better. Would NOT recommend to other Platinum members based on my non-upgrade to a view of the canal that I had paid extra points for. Note to hotel â€“ treat platinum members better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - and excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ajm2222
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in June for 3 nights. We had a great experience staying here as it is right on the water and close enought to St. Mark's without it actually being on top of it. The hotel had its own dock, so that you can either take a water taxi right to it, (more costly than the public vaparetto which gives you a 5 minute walk with your luggage) but worth it depending on number of travelers. The concierge hooks us up with the a private taxi, right from the hotel dock, to Murano and back. It was an excellent ride. We did not chose to eat in the hotel, as with Kids, we like to venture out and on vacation and eat as we walk around, especially in cities that there is lots of walking and shops and restaurants around. We found many great places to eat in Venice. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little hard to find, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: We were first time visitors to Venice. Finding things there can be a bit tricky. We knew the general area of the hotel and up just stumbling into it. Inside, everything was as it should be. The hotel was clearly older but well maintained and everything worked. Bathrooms had obviously been updated and were great. Both functionally and by size. Our whole room area was very generous. In short, we were very happy with our stay. PS: The Concierge desk was a huge help.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: KTFam
Reviews.Content: The room was large and clean and very comfortable, with a balcony and large bathroom. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy we chose this property!”
Reviews.Author: PhillyBoyz
Reviews.Content: I was worried that this would be a big, cold Westin, but it turned out to be a nice, intimate-feeling property. The rooms were very nice, the food good and the service very attentive (ok, a couple of the concierges were a bit cold, but otherwise great). One of the best things about this hotel is its bar that is outside right on the Grand Canal. It's intimate and allows you to while away the evening, sipping prosecco and watching the world float by. Truly great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dennisrobertson
Reviews.Content: We had a few days here earlier in the year and it was freezing cold with a little snow but inside this lovely hotel we were made to feel so welcome. We had rooms which had a lounge area in the middle so we could relax and heat up before heading to the bitterly cold weather. The staff were more than willing to help re any tourist queries etc. Breakfast was very good and more than ample choice for all. The location also ideal and easy access for many things.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing-not a westin experience”
Reviews.Author: canadianwarmth
Reviews.Content: Only the location and if lucky, a special rate, are ok at this hotel. The rooms are dirty (we had 4 rooms because the first 2 smelled like an oil tanker), tired, old and musty The breakfast is very average, unless you like birds (not pigeons) flying around you INSIDE and sharing your toast with you The staff alernative between rude and not caring. The concierge, who barely spoke english, consistently gave wrong advice and recommendations. Our local tour guide sadly confirmed our experiences in dealing with the staff Not a westin experience. They didn't even try. There are other hotels nearby that we looked into at the end of our stay. Next time we shall stay at them

Reviews.Title: “The best rooms ever in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sandorambrus
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum member with Starwood Hotels I am supposed to get the best available room in their hotels. I have stayed many times at the Europa e Regina in venice, but never had the incredible experience Front Desk Manager Mr. Dallamura offered to me and my chidren on this particular trip: we had the two Penthouse suites of the hotel with huges rooftop terraces and these unbelievable views of the city - from the 7th floor you can basically see it all; from Marco Polo airport all the way to the San Marco, the Canal Grande and the Santa Maria Della Salute. You don't feel like going down the street - you can see it all from above. It was an experience for life... we still talk about it and would like to be back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dankny
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon in Europe at the Westin Europa, and it is a fabulous hotel. The reception on checkin was excellent, and the staff was very welcoming, efficient and friendly. The room was beautiful, overlooking the canal, perfectly clean and very comfortable. Breakfast buffet was really special, on the canal. And they will make eggs to order, if you request them. The hotel location is ideal. Near San Marco Square, but hidden away and quiet. As for Venice itself, I doubt that I will return any time soon. It is extremely expensive, and ultra-touristy. Too many "tourist traps". The entire city is an outdoor flea market, expensive bad restaurants, and hotels. The Gondolla ride was extremely romantic and special, but $150 for a 40 minute ride is beyond excessive....as they say, once in a lifetime. Being August, it was also hot and smelly too. If you go, just be prepared to open your wallet, and dont expect great food. Stay at the Westin though, as the hotel is fabulous. Thank you Westin Europa !!!

Reviews.Title: “THE FINEST SERVICE & GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LakeofGeneva
Reviews.Content: For all that plan to go to Venice... this is the best place and the best location to stay. You will have no nicer and better view onto the Canale Grande than from the hotel and its waterfront dining terrace. Mr ATTILIO DALLA MURA, the Front Desk Manager is a STAR (!) and has made our stay at The Europa & REGINA a true delight. His personal and continous assistance in arranging all our wishes has made our Venice weekend uniquely memorable.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel. Couldn't stay anywhere else in Venice”
Reviews.Author: B_H829
Reviews.Content: I've been to Venice a number of times and became a regular visitor to the Danieli. A couple of years ago, on an occasion when the Danieli was full, I opted for the Europa & Regina and enjoyed myself so much, I decided to make it my first choice for this visit. I was not disappointed. From the moment we checked in until the moment we left we had nothing but praise for this hotel. The welcome at check-in, the upgrade to a lovely room on the front (to which we were personally escorted by the receptionist) with a fabulous view of la Salute and the Grand Canal, the intimate bar with it's beautiful canal-side terrace and the breakfasts to die for, right down to the smoked salmon and prosecco. This place is a rabbit warren of immaculate marble everywhere with Murano glass lighting, yet it's low ceilings give it an intimacy that I find extremely relaxing. Of course it's expensive, and make sure you book a package that includes breakfast or you will live to regret it; yet I never felt I was being offered poor value. Even the Peroni in the bar at 10 euros a bottle didn't seem expensive when taking into account the fabulous view and the generous supply of 'nibbles' provided. Although listed as 4 star by TripAdvisor, it is in fact, officially a five star hotel and thoroughly deserves it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back! For sure!”
Reviews.Author: Nad02
Reviews.Content: Nice room on the canal. Wonderful service. Champagne upon our arrival for our anniversary. The hotel made a difference and we'll come back.

Reviews.Title: “VEry-NICE”
Reviews.Author: agedbutcool
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, breakfast on terrace is magical, ask for a refurbished room. All this and competitively priced too. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect and extremely expensive”
Reviews.Author: QualiGuidesBelgium
Reviews.Content: Perfect from all standards. Romms very quiet and comfortable. Breakfast room overlooks grand canal. Just a footsteps from san marco. Friendly efficient service. Very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great location with the Grand Canal at the back door”
Reviews.Author: JayandAlly
Reviews.Content: We Love this hotel for many reasons its close to the Piazza San Marco and right on the Grand Canal they have a great staff and its beautifully decorated but the thing we love the most is the little bar on the canal.When we first arrived we jumped in a taxi at the train station which was naturally a neat little boat. Its a 15 minute boat ride from the train station to the hotel and costs 60 euros it is a great way to arrive to the Europa and also see the buildings and the sites on the canals. The Taxi ride is half the price of a gondola ride and serves a purpose at the same time. When we pulled up to the hotel the bellman greeted our taxi at the dock at the Europa and quickly grabbed our bags. We then proceeded to the check in and promptly were checked in. Only problem was we received a accessible room and although it was beautifully furnished with a white marble bath and a view of the canal it had no tub and no where to store our cloths as there was no dresser. The manager came up handled the situation perfectly and moved us the next day to a equal room with a tub which made my wife happy and storage plus a even better view of the Grand Canal. The service thru out our entire stay was excellent and every one was friendly. The room was clean spacious and with a view of the grand canal many nights we sat with a bottle of wine some cheese ,melon and prosciutto and gazed at the gondola's and traffic on the canal. We also had a neat view of the rooftops of Venice and La Salute. If you can get a canal view I suggest you spend the extra doe it is worth it. Ok the little bar on the canal is one of my favorite bars ever, it's open late and they serve pistachios with your drinks the drinks are a little expensive but worth it for the atmosphere and I love pistachios. The patio bar has only 9 tables so its quaint and has awesome views of La Salute the boat traffic on the canal and other unexpected sites and surprises. The concierge were helpful and had a few good suggestions but sometimes we found its best to do some research yourself then get their opinion and have them make the reservation. One of the nice benefits of this hotel is you can get a free ride to the Excelsior Hotel on the Lido Island the boat comes right to the dock and every 30 min and will also drop you back off at the Europa. Its a nice day trip they have a huge beach which is on the Adriatic Sea with lots of cabanas im not sure if you have to be a guest there to rent one for the day but either way its a fun boat ride and a great beach to walk on and swim and there is good people watching too. The vaporetto is the Venice version of a bus on water its a great way to get around and you can get a pass for a few hours up to a week its a fun ride and there are many routes to explore. Also walk outside the main tourist area where the Europa is located Venice has lots of campos and little narrow passages to explore one of which is the Fish and produce market near the Rialto Bridge. Great hotel enjoy a campari and soda night cap at the canal bar and enjoy the views.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - although room not ready until late almost evening”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelergirl29
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! The only complaint I had is our room was not ready until almost evening time, about 5pm. It is classic Venice, great bar, great ambiance. We chatted with the bartender and got great restaurant recommendations from him. The room was large and decadent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarteBlancWine
Reviews.Content: I had a suite on the to floor with an incredible view. It was exactly what I had expected and more. Location is great, within walking distance to several must see sites. Water taxi right out the back door. Fun bar downstairs. Worth the price and more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!! Highly Recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: jschafer11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took a trip to Europe and the second city that we visited was Venice. Throughout the trip we stayed at three different hotels and the Westin Hotel Europa and Regina, Venice was the best one we stayed in by far. We were able to use points towards our stay and so our room was very affordable for the two nights we were there. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff at the front desk were very friendly. We asked the concierge to help us get away from the tourists and into areas with local stores and restaurants. The concierge pointed us in the exact right direction where the food was delicious and the streets were less crowded. The location of the hotel is also excellent. It is just minutes from Saint Mark's square but the hotel can be a bit hard to find the first time as the entrance is a bit off the beaten path and down some windy roads. Excellent hotel, I highly recommend it to anyone and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: loronthego
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The check in people, room service, wait staff etc are all friendly. However, the Hotel Concierge seemed to have a bit of an attitude. He was not friendly at all. He didn't want to be bothered with questions. We just chucked it up to him having a bad day or personal issues. The hotel is on the Grand canal and has a restaurant with an awesome view. The prices are ridiculous so be prepared for a lunch to cost a few hundred dollarsplus for 4. You can't beat the view and that is what you are paying for. We ate there a few times just for the view. The hotel is very close to St Marks. You can't beat this location. Also there is a water taxi right at the hotel which we took a few times also. All in all with the exception of the Concierge with an attitude this is an awesome place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent Service, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: wdy301
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before a cruise from Venice. After a long, overnight flight from the USA, it is great to hop in a water taxi and pull up directly to the dock of this great hotel located on the banks of the Grand Canal, about a 5 minute walk from San Marco Piazza. You don't have to drag your luggage through the crowded streets of Venice with this location. The porters take your luggage directly from your boat while you check in. The front desk staff and Conceirge were very friendly, speak many languages and dressed very neatly. The hotel is large by Venice standards because it is actually 4 or 5 hotels combined. I stayed in a deluxe room for 337 Euros per night. The room was very elegant and spacious. For more $$, you can get a higher room with more of a view. Breakfast/dinner on the waterside restaurant/covered deck was awesome. Great views. You are in the heart of Venice and almost everything is a pleasant walk from where you are staying!

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: 1boy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Hotel Europa & Regina for 2 nights. This was our 25th anniversary trip. When we arrived, we were well received and escorted to our room. In the room, there was a lovely anniversary card along with a bottle of proseco and a dessert. Our room was fabulous. The room was large, nicely decorated and very clean. We had an exceptional view of the Grand Canal. The room was comfortable and well appointed. Our only disappointment was the size of the shower. I'm not a big person, and it was a bit tight for me. We would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Hotel Location”
Reviews.Author: FHANDS
Reviews.Content: Have not been back to the Europa and Regina in some years, and very happy to say, that on our recent trip to Venice in August 2011 our stay at the Hotel was really perfect. The room had been recently renovated, was large, comfortable with all the modern conveniences, and a great bathroom. The front desk personnel was exceedingly helpful. Breakfast, thanks to the low dollar, was expensive, but very good, service was wonderful, and you can't beat the Views! Very peaceful and nice Hotel, great amenities, great people.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: esa81
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed at the Westin Europa & Regina Hotel for two nights in early July. Having read some fantastic reviews on TripAdvisor, I was excited about this location. What we got was not what we expected, however; our experience at the hotel was very disappointing. Our rooms were 148 and 149 on the first floor. Both the hallway in this area and the rooms themselves were unappealing and far below five-star standards. When we checked in we were met with the sight of a dirty linen cart, which remained outside our door for the duration or our visit. Each time we went to our rooms we passed a wash area that had no door. The first floor hallway itself was dark and dingy, not at all like the hallways on the upper floors. Our rooms were tired-looking, mosquito-infested, and decorated with unappealing blood stains on the walls where prior occupants had apparently killed the mosquitoes. The accessory furniture pieces (desks, desk chairs, upholstered chairs) were uncomfortable and worn â€“ they looked like castoffs that had been picked up on the street. On one occasion we had to ask for the room to be vacuumed because it was apparent that this had not been done. The closet in one of the rooms held two cabinets that took up the entire lower level and made it impossible to hang our longer clothing, such as slacks and dresses. My two teenagers liked the bathroom in the room that they shared, saying it was the biggest of our trip, but in the other room the bathroom was small and there was mildew on the tile grout. The hotel has a wonderful setting, right on the Grand Canal, and its common areas are luxurious, not at all like our rooms. The lobby has a lot of interesting features, with large pieces of modern art on display. The day we arrived we had a lovely meal in a courtyard area on the canal - the food was good and the view was excellent. But on the second night of our stay that same courtyard turned into a nightmare as a wedding celebration blared floor-thumping music until midnight - we heard it clearly in our rooms and it was impossible to sleep. We complained to the front desk, as did a number of other hotel guests, but were told that nothing could be done until the function ended. Our room package included buffet breakfast at the hotel restaurant, where the outdoor patio sits right on the canal. The food was good, but mealtimes were very crowded and it was difficult to find seating both days. Since the area is open-air, there were birds everywhere, landing on the food carts and even flying through the large open doorways to the inside of the restaurant. While this is not exactly the fault of the hotel, it was unappetizing and unsettling to see birds landing on the food carts. The restaurant service was mediocre. On the plus side, the hotel is in a very convenient location near St. Mark's Square. Venice is a walking city anyway, and we had no trouble getting to shopping and tourist spots, as well as exploring some of the less busy areas. Clearly, there are nicer rooms at the Europa & Regina, as evidenced by all of the glowing reviews. After our trip I re-read those reviews with some amount of frustration. And I did see a few negative reviews that mentioned complaints similar to ours. I've come to the conclusion that the Europa & Regina is a hotel with two faces. One face is the remodeled and elegant one, which has been the inspiration for many positive comments. The other face is the worn-out part of the hotel that hasn't been renovated and becomes the Regina & Europa experience for a smaller number of unfortunate travelers like ourselves. We aren't the type to make waves, and didn't want to come across as pushy American tourists, but in hindsight I regret not trying to switch rooms while we were at the hotel. We did not get what we paid for or what we expected. For any travelers thinking of staying at the Europa & Regina, I would recommend asking to see your rooms before committing to them, and if possible, avoiding the first floor entirely.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view from canal-front room”
Reviews.Author: mkday
Reviews.Content: Just had a wonderful experience at the Westin Europa & Regina. Tucked away two blocks from the crowds, this really feels like an oasis in the tourist mecca that Venice can be in the summer. As a platinum member, i was upgraded to a canal view room (#306, if anyone's counting), and the room and view were simply spectacular. Would definitely recommend booking here as long as you can get some sort of view. The restaurant is right on the canal, but my one experience there (breakfast) seemed quite overpriced, but it is Venice and a spectacular setting.

Reviews.Title: “What a Magical Place - 5 STAR!”
Reviews.Author: BigWhale
Reviews.Content: When selecting hotels for venice, I had to choose between the Bauer & the Westin Europa-Regina.....I am glad I chose the Westin Europa-Regina....we had a room right on the Grand Canal with four windows looking out.....It was ridiculous how beautiful! The Hotel is VERY VERY OLD......but meticulously maintained and with just the right amount of updating to keep it modern....without overdoing it.....still Old Worlde Gorgeous......Everything was 5 STAR.....They spoil you rotten....the only hotel that is better is in Rome....The Hotel Hassler at the spanish steps.....The Westin Europa-Regina is THE BEST HOTEL IN VENICE! Romantic is an understatement.....

Reviews.Title: “OK, But Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: BobbyinCincinnati
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights last month, and found the hotel to be OK overall. Make sure you receive directions, as their property is a bit hard to find. Addtionally, we were frustrated after paying for internet and being told it would work on our floor, only to have the concierge revise his statement and tell me we had to be in the lobby. Breakfast wasn't included either, which I was surprised about considering the price. The "upgraded" room was quite small, but included a beautiful bathroom. The hotel staff spoke English, though some workers were more friendly than others.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Property”
Reviews.Author: sandratomtom
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Westin Regina and Europa. Our room was incredible, the service outstanding and we would choose to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Princesses my daughter & I”
Reviews.Author: pjhills
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful trip we had & what a wonderful stay @ this hotel. They could not have been any more accomodating. We simply felt like Princesses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Loved being close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: reginafug
Reviews.Content: We came here for our birthdays, the beautiful city of Venezia! We used Starwood points to book this hotel. Even so, we were upgraded to the best available room, a junior suite facing the courtyard. We found the staff very helpful, and the Concierge was definitely very helpful. One note though, the male staffers seem a lot friendlier than the ladies... wonder why? No problems, though, just an observation. Our bathroom was large, well laid out, and of course, got to love those Westin amenities, very nice! The room, was perfect for our needs, a wonderful bed, crisp linens, and great pillows! Also loved the little living room outside the bedroom, and oh, the dressing area, with lots of space for storing clothes, etc. The cleaning ladies were so sweet and took such good care of our room... one lady was very sweet, and was always very eager to help! The hotel is beautiful and we loved the floating pier! The hotel has a very nice gym... used it the first day, but after that, after walking around the city so much, had no energy for the gym! It's well-equipped. For Starwood Platinum members, the wireless internet was free, a very nice bonus! Dislike: what's up with the "one" bottle of water a day, even if there are two guests staying in the room. C'mon, Westin, bottled water is pretty cheap in Venice... we know so, we bought many bottles. In any case, we had a fantastic stay, and would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and the most beautiful breakfast view I have ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: SB_riodejaneiro
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small as usual in historic places and classic hotels in Europe. But the location is perfect and the overall hotel is excellent. Very good hotel. If you are to stay in five star hotels, this is a good cost benefit option. The breakfast view is marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jazzyjeff25
Reviews.Content: We had the most incredible stay here. We had booked a double deluxe grand canal view room but were given a grand canal with a huge terrace with two sunloungers and a table and chairs on overlooking the grand canal. As it was a special occasion we were also given a bottle of prosecco and cake which was really lovely. The room had recently been renovated and was quite luxurious. We loved sitting on our terrace in the evenings listening to the gondoliers singing as they went along the canal. On our last night we ate in the hotel restaurant which was amazing and we would highly recommend. The hotel is in a fantastic position, next to everything. When we were booking we also considered The Bauer, The Danieli and The Baglioni and went into each of these hotels. The Bauer was nice, the Baglioni didn't have great views and the Danieli is completely overrated. You cannot sit outside the hotel on the water, outside is full of crowds and cheap tourist stalls. At the Regina there is a floating terrace on the water for breakfast and dinner which is just beautiful. Do try Antico Martini for dinner it's amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for the Redentore”
Reviews.Author: wilfried_graebert
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin - Europa and Regina. We are coming back year after year and are still discovering new rooms. The canal view rooms have an outstanding view - expecially when something special as the Rendentore with a lot of boat trafic is happening. The soft breeze at the canal makes a big difference to the rest of the city. You will enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: italias
Reviews.Content: Our room was wonderful overlooking the Grand Canal! I loved it! Also enjoyed canal side lunches and cocktails! My complaint with this hotel was the concierge staff. They were not helpful at all and tended to ignore you while you waited to get their attention. The morning breakfast buffet was good but again we were ignored by the staff. This hotel definitely needs some training on being attentive to their guests. Other than that, the place is great and the location is great. Very happy with our canal view room!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: RunerChickie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Europa in July 2011 for 3 nights. We were thrilled with the location- less than 5 minutes to San Marco square, right on the Canal Grande, and easy to use public transport. Some people have complained that it was hard to find upon first arriving in Venice, but we didn't find that at all. Print yourself a map, and when in doubt, ask gondoliers for direction. We found check in and every encounter we had with the front desk staff to be pleasant and efficient. Our room was very nice- it didn't face the canal, but in to the city which was equally fascinating. Rooms here are quite big by european standards, and the bathroom was amazing- dual shower heads, a full tub, and all marble. There was also a/c- a must the week we were in Venice! It was pricey, but find time to have a coffee or glass of wine on the hotel balcony facing the canal, especially in the evening. It is a beautiful location, very relaxing with the water lapping at the deck and boats going by.

Reviews.Title: “Can not be better Â¡Â¡Â¡Â¡Â¡Â¡Â¡”
Reviews.Author: monyh
Reviews.Content: Since my family arrived at The Westin Europa And Regina, the service was superb, starting with the front office staff, My room had an excellent view to the canal, and my children also stayed in very good rooms. Our experience in Venezia was the best because we started with the right foot at the Westin

Reviews.Title: “classic old world hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnt10014
Reviews.Content: My single room was small but pretty and well appointed. The service is professional and competent. Location is smack in the middle of all Venice attractions. Views from restaurant and bar are great. One drawback-the prices for food and drinks are jaw dropping-$66 for breakfast, $60 for a room service burger and $30 for a drink in the bar. Room was well priced though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: 227755d
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in July on cash and points. Arrived at airport, used water taxi arranged via venicelink.com for round trip, worked great, half the price of regular water taxi. I don't know if the route the water taxi took was the normal route but our trip took us under the Rialto Bridge and the entire length of the Grand Canal, a delightful introduction to Venice. Hotel is on the Grand Canal, arrived about noon, room was not ready, not really a big deal. So went off exploring Venice. The location of the hotel is ideal, one block away from Calle Larga XXII Marzo which is the Fifth Avenue or Rodeo Drive of Venice with all the high end shops, and then a few more minutes you are at Piazza San Marco. Walking through Venice is like walking through a maze and there is always a pleasant surprise at every turn. During our three days and two nights we walked everywhere, the only time we took the waterbus was when we went to Murano. Now back to the hotel, when I was making the reservation I was trying to decide between the Westin Europa and the Westin Daneli, I am an SPG member and I had some points to burn and I was looking for value. Room was ready about 5pm, a little late but not a big deal unless you want to make it a big deal, received an upgrade, room was spacious, there was a small alcove with a closet between bedroom and the bathroom. Bathroom equally spacious with hugh bath and separate shower in opposite corner (tiny - i.e. if you dropped your bar of soap it would be tricky to pick it up) hey the shower worked that's the good news. The beds were relatively comfortable they were two beds pushed together to make a king. Room was comfortable, flat screen TV, mini bar, desk and chair with ottoman. The view was of the internal courtyard, when I am on vacation the time I spend in the room is to sleep so what do I care about the view. The room was comfortable and quiet. The concierges were extremely helpful and was the staff, and especially Alex at the front desk, who seemed to want to make sure we were taken care of. Lastly at check out, we able to extend our check out time to 3pm as our flight was not until 6pm and that was appreciated. Overall had a great time, would stay here again. Be polite and you will get the same in return.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Europa-fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Shmutzy
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling around Europe for the past week and the Westin Europa has been the best hotel we have stayed in. It is beautiful here and has a great location. The view from our room is breath taking. The rooms are clean and spacious. The beds are so comfortable that we have been sleeping late every morning. The breakfast buffet is outstanding on the canal. The gym is great for working off all the gelato calories. The staff are wonderful. They are always smiling and helpful. I can not express in words how pleasant our stay has been. The Westin Europa and Regina is AMAZING!!! Thank you Westin staff! Stacy Wallner

Reviews.Title: “wow beautiful”
Reviews.Author: KennedysGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the prime position in Venice right on the grand canal and what can I say except that for my husband and I it was a fantastic experience we were given an upgrade that exceeded our expectation , we were greeted at the reception by a wonderful Lady whose name escapes me who escorted us to our room more like an apartment it was that big where there was a bottle of champagne and a cake awaiting and then to our amazement she then showed us our balcony that could fit a 100 people easily with beautiful outdoor lounge furniture and 270 degree views of Venice we could see every main canal from here . the service was excellent this hotel is definitely a winner cheers to the westin team .

Reviews.Title: “We had food poisoning in the hotel's overpriced restaurant and hotel was greedy.”
Reviews.Author: clainy
Reviews.Content: We had the worst experience in this overpriced hotel with unfriendly reception women and greedy reservation people. We had food poisoning from the restaurant and spoiled the rest of our stay in Venice. I think you can find a better warmer hotel by the Grand Canal. There's nothing exceptional in this hotel. We will never come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - right in San Marco”
Reviews.Author: MillerCorona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights using points. As a SPG platinum I expected some sort of upgrade but I guess the hotel was full and we got a standard room. Nonethless, it was a nice room (small bathroom). We loved that it was so close to everything -right in San Marco. It was the perfect location from our first trip, and arriving from the airport was very easy (we took the public water taxi right to San Marco). We had drinks at the bar overlooking the grand canal - it was nice but the drinks and everything else as you would expect were very expensive. Overall, it was a great stay and i was pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is a fairy tale and the perfect place for our next holiday or conference”
Reviews.Author: Theina
Reviews.Content: I was on a business meeting and upgraded to a wonderful sleeping and living room. From my desk I enjoyed the lovely view to the Canale Grande. That was so inspiring and motivating. We worked more concentrated looking forward to visit Palazzo Ducale. Breakfast on the terrace is a must. Sitting right next to the water watching the condolas, Cruise ships, the Canale life. The Westin Regina is perfect for walking at St. Marcus Square in the morning before the city wakes up. It is perfectly located to indulge in Etro shower and having a relaxing coffee in the Tiepolo bar before going out for dinner. Thank you again to the receptionist and concierge Massimo who made every day a fairy tale.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SeaBright16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really pretty and located in San Marco, which is walking distance to everything. Our room was pretty however the paint was really old and the wallpaper stained, probably because its on water - but it could use some updating. There were little bugs flying around in our room, and we didn't have windows open.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with magnificent views”
Reviews.Author: James944
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with the family using SPG points. This was my first trip to Italy so I had no idea what to expect. Our room was large and airy, with plenty of windows and the most incredible view over the grand canal! We were on the 6th floor and the light, spacious feel of the room combined with great air conditioning made our stay very pleasant. I have no complaints other than it is not at all obvious how to get here from St. Mark's square ... Print out a map if you are not taking a taxi straight to their dock (recommended!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ndm0611
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our honeymoon and we had a great experience with this hotel. We arrived before check-in and our room was not ready, but they gave us complimentary drinks at the bar while our room was being prepared. They also did something special for us in our room for the honeymoon (I don't want to give it away for any other honeymooners). The room was big, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. It was about a five minute walk to San Marcos square and about 15-20 minute walk to the Rialto bridge, which I found to be nice because we weren't in the middle of the really touristy area, but everything was still accessible and there are shops everywhere so it is quite a scenic walk. The concierge was extremely helpful and recommended a fabulous restaurant called Da Carletto. All of the staff was very pleasant and knowledgable, but my favorite part of this hotel was the bar/restaurant on the canal and the amazing Bellinis!

Reviews.Title: “4-Star? Really?”
Reviews.Author: Chocolatenut
Reviews.Content: We were not among the Cruise line guest. My daughter used her points to attain a room upgrade, really? The staff we rude, unfriendly, and we will never go back there. Another woman during check-out was so upset with the security. She was American and told me she had stayed there twice before, they were rude to her also. The room was not what we were told that we would have.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff ruined our holiday.”
Reviews.Author: CraigfromBrighton
Reviews.Content: Bar far the worst hotel staff I have ever encountered, rude and arrogant, really spolt our holiday, very upsetting in fact.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely mod cons in a bustling area”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: DH and I had a lovely few nights here in June. We would definitely consider going back. Excellent location on the Grand Canal, literally just a block from St. Mark's Square. Room was comfortable. Air conditioning was excellent (you cannot underestimate AC for Italian summers), clean bathroom, strong water pressure. Beds were comfortable, but definitely not "heavenly" a la Westin standard. Beware of upgrades - we were "upgraded" to a handicapped accessible room. Suggest asking SPG to call the hotel the day before you check-in to see what they can do. We ended up getting re-upgraded with a view of rooftops and a sliver of the Grand Canal that we really enjoyed. Two notes: First, the concierge was rude and unhelpful. The worst was when he gave us info on the water bus that was just plain wrong and we nearly missed our connection out of town. Second, the location is right in the middle of main tourist attractions, which means it can get pretty crowded. I would stay here again if we could use points and just put up with the crowds, otherwise will likely go back to one of the smaller hotels where you can take a break. Have an amazing time in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable week-end in Westin Venice”
Reviews.Author: tubistico
Reviews.Content: 2 nights, 38 members of the Nestle Music Club, an excellent week-end due to the Westin Europa. Beakfast and diner on the hotel terrace are unforgettable experiences. Rooms are large and clean. Location, 3 mn from San Marco is unvaluable.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: new2traveling4fun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin hotel bec we used points. The hotel was super difficult to find. Note: the Venetians know this hotel as "Europa& Regina" as well as most of the signage reads "Europa& Regina" and not the Westin. So when we were trying to find it, no one could help us. You also have to go through a long alley to get the hotel. Not very easy. The hotel itself was ok nothing special but also not bad. I would stay there again, if I had my points but if not then any other hotel would do.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHamilton_NJ
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and we loved it! It rained during the 2 days that we were there but that did not lessen our enjoyment. The Westin was the perfect location to enjoy everything in Venice and our room was lovely. Most of the sites are easily reached on foot and the vaporetto water buses are quick and easy to use when you need them. We would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “great location, views from hotel”
Reviews.Author: ande2980
Reviews.Content: Can not say enough about location and views from waterfront terrace... We booked using points and were upgraded upon checking in. Room was huge and quite nice. Bed was super comfy. A few downsides: bathroom smelled a bit like an airplane bathroom (we assumed this was a "Venice thing" and didn't complain but if a 5 star hotel smelled that way I can't imagine what others smell like), our minibar/fridge was empty and not working (come on Westin, that's basic), and the restaurant/bar was stupid expensive. The breakfast buffet is certainly not worth it...go for a walk and get a croissant and macchiato for under 3 euro. Ps, I paid 8 euro for a mini coke bottle at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Europa and Regina Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pili11
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Europa and Regina prior to our cruise. This was the second time we stayed at this hotel. We like the hotel because of its location and how lovely it's inside. The rooms are not spacious (ours wasn't) but have been refurbished and it was nice. The breakfast buffet is overpriced (45 euros/p) and is not that good. We ordered from the menu and it was better. I recommend the hotel because of its location, service, cleanliness, and how beautiful is inside.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Staff and Experience”
Reviews.Author: flyforffun
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice Italy twice within the past 12 months and both times I have stayed in this hotel. Its absolutely beautiful. Staff are extremely helpful and the food they serve at their resturants is some of the best in Venice. The rooms are beautiful and this hotel is close to all the top attractions. The front desk is extremely helpful, especially Alberto who helped us with printing our boarding passes. Of all the hotels I have ever stayed at in Italy (including Rome and Florence), this has been my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoTennisbum
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed Venice and staying at the Westin. The two of us arrived by shared-water taxi from airport to hotel dock. (54euros). Easy check-in, helpful concierge, beautiful flowers in common areas, lovely 5th floor renovated room with views of both canals. Loved the location and the service provided by the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: LAT4840
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: We stayed here using Starwood points and thus our review is perhaps colored by the fact that our stay was free (except for meals). If we'd paid exorbitant rates perhaps I might feel differently. But we found the hotel lovely. Having stayed many times at various properties in Venice, this one was perfect for us and our two young children. We had two connecting "partial canal view" rooms - the clerk upon check-in apologized that the view was not a full canal view. When we got to the room we discovered that we had a lovely terrace with an incredible view of Santa Maria della Salute just across the grand canal. Nothing to apologize for there. The rooms were large, lovely and very clean with beautiful bathrooms - nicest rooms we've ever had in Venice. The restaurant was fantastic and our first night there we sat outside at the best table in the house, right on the Grand Canal overlooking Santa Maria across the water. They treated our two rambunctious boys like kings. Granted, the 45 euro a head breakfast buffet in the morning was quite steep, though the buffet was excellent. In Europe you get used to breakfast being included, though again given that we weren't paying for the rooms we could hardly complain. And I do wish the rooms had free wifi - or any wifi. That's a con definitely. But overall we had a lovely stay here - terrific location, helpful staff and beautiful rooms. We'd stay here again, which is the best endorsement I can give.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SavorSluthTraveler
Reviews.Content: Went here to kickoff our Italy vacation. Property and room were great. Had a suite with wonderful terrace right on the water. Great hotel to grab Ana afternoon tea or coffee and just enjoy the scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Staff unhelpful & surly, curtains hanging off window - not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: theflyingpa43
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel for my Boss and his partner for a romantic trip to Venice. They were going to be late arriving so called ahead to alert the Hotel but had great trouble getting through to Reservations. It took about nine tries. Then when they arrived by water taxi there was no Porter to take their luggage and the taxi almost went off with one of their bags on board. They were 2 minutes late for breakfast on the first morning and the restaurant staff did not want to give them anything to eat. They relented after much sighing but practically threw their breakfast at them. My Boss asked Concierge to book a table at a Restaurant and he was told that guests normally do that themselves. What is Concierge for if not for stuff like this? In their E865 a night room the curtains were hanging off the window and would not close properly. If you wanted your bed linen changed you had to request it and there were only 2 towels in the bathroom. People who pay these kind of prices are used to the best Hotels in the world and it looks like this Hotel misses the mark by a long way.

Reviews.Title: “So-so Westin”
Reviews.Author: TruthMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many Westin hotels worldwide, I am a proud Gold Starwood Preferred Guest, and fully support the brand... BUT this Westin made me think why it is actually a Westin... The hotel is very old, so rooms are just OK considering its age. The Heavenly Shower didnt work, and doubt it was a Heavenly Bed, and around the toilet there were some untrusty stains. I heard that renovated rooms are better, but never saw one, my SPG room was not at the level I usually get... Also, It was one of the slowest check-ins I have experienced at a Westin, no staff at the SPG Front Desk, so almost half an hour to check in (One elderly guest refused to make the long line, because he had been a guest at the hotel several times in six years !! , well, yes , he got preference over all the rest , SPG or not, and got taken care of first, and demanded to get the same room has gotten every time , although it was taken !! can you believe this??) Also experienced three conflicts at the front desk with people screaming for bad service and awful rooms, or that they were not honored the room they had reserved and demanded to be relocated, while some of the staff talking to each other in Italian, (assuming no one understood) kept on complaining loudly about these guests right in front of them !! haha .. Internet has a cost, and the keyring is a huge 1900s style, so you have to give it back to the concierge every time.. so, in all, the only reason I would stay again there or recommend it, would be for the location...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, not up to the standard for pricing charged”
Reviews.Author: CarolLeeAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at this hotel in May 2011. It was my mother and I. The hotel is very nice, but NOT up to the standard it charges so make sure you get a good deal! I had a standard room, not with a view, but a nice room. Pros! Rooms are nicely furnished. Beds are VERY comfortable Cons! Service is not up to a Four/Five star standard. When you check in, they expect you to go stand in another line to get the key??? Room service trays left in the hall for 24 hours, no turndown service, room cleaning not very good, no wireless in the rooms. They don't use key cards so you have to leave your key which is a pain as the concerige gives you the keys and is generally busy working with other guests. Plus it gives no security as I saw at least one incident where guests returned and found someone else had "picked up" thier key! If you can get the rate I did ... FREE with Starwood points then it's a good deal. If you are paying cash I think there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: peddle151
Reviews.Content: before my friend and i arrived here we looked at some of the reviews and wondered if we might have made a mistake by booking at the hotel . After the bad start to the holiday with the travel company making a mistake with the flights etc we arrived a day late so we could not have the rooms for the full time we were there the hotel gave us fantastic rooms over looking The Santa Maria dela saluta then we had a small twin room with its own balcony with the same view fantastic .The staff were very helpfull and polite the breakfast really good plenty of choice even a nice cup of tea .Im going to talk my husband in to taking me back hopefully thank you Westin hope to see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel service is slipping”
Reviews.Author: susiQ34683
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a tour of Italy and our last stop (4 nights) was at the Westin Europa & Regina. For a supposed small luxury hotel, I felt that the rooms were a little musty, pillows on bed were actually horrible, no wifi beyond lobby and only a telephone connector for Internet in rooms. For two days someone's room service tray sat on the floor by the elevator and then on the same floor for more than 24 hours another room service tray sat. Wghen we arrived, our room fridge did not work and the light by the bed was not working either. Both were promptly fixed. On our last morning, the 7:00 a.m. breakfast did not open until 7:15 and warm food was still not complete by 7:20. Our luggage was picked up 20 minutes late for departure for the airport. These lapses make this not a five start hotel at all, but more like 3 and a half, for me. Several local guides remarked how the service at this hotel had been cut back by management.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - too expensive for what it really is!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlottes-Travels
Reviews.Content: Went to Venice for a few days, and although at first as you arrive in a boat and enjoy sightseeing - its a very expensive place really for what it is. The breakfast had to be the funniest.....after sitting down birds flying very low everywhere trying to nibble at the buffet laid out....and when my husband got up to go get more food, the pigeons, and smaller birds landed on the plates on the table, amusing at first but not fun trying to fend off birds when trying to eat!! the room was nice but quite small although if you can get a view of the water and canals that would be best..... have a look through the pictures to see the room which was of an ok standard...I wouldn't go back however! particularly beacuse there is no irons aloowed in the room and you have to sepnd a fortune on getting any items cleaned or ironed!! and this service is only at certain points during the day....otherwise you cannot have it ironed and you will end up with creased clothes!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: PtyChirry
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the hotel, the day and night views from the terrace are gorgeous. Location is very good, you could walk everywhere and most attractions are 5 to 10 minute walk. Our room was big (standard), clean, nicely decorated.....not one fault in our 2 nights!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting”
Reviews.Author: nancyfm
Reviews.Content: This was my much longed for first trip to Venice and I was not disappointed in any way! It was absolutely magical helped in no small part by the absolutely enchanting Europa Regina Hotel. We were given such a lovely warm welcome when we arrived that despite it's granduer we immediately felt relaxed. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal which kept us amused for hours after we had walked ourselves silly, and was large and beautifully decorated. The bed was huge and very comfortable. We even found a lovely sunny courtyard area to soak up the sun in sipping the iced tea so thoughtfully provided. We also had the unexpected surprise of prosecco and cake on our anniversay. The breakfasts were gorgeous with nine different sorts of juice to choose from, champagne, hot eggs anyway you wanted them and a sumptious buffet. All in all this beautiful hotel and staff exceeded our expectations and made our stay in Venice very special. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Westin experience”
Reviews.Author: kgosalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our trip to Rome, Venice and Florence. This was one of the worst experiences and nothing like the Westin hotel experience we are used to. As an SPG member with a Gold status, we have stayed in several Westin hotels throughout the US and did so at Florence too. All of those were awesome! This one however, we wish we had stayed somewhere else! The only good thing about this place was how close it is to St. Marks Square. Our room had a partial view of the grand canal. The room was small and dull. We could never get the concierge or anyone on the phone when we called. When we went downstairs to get an opinion on a restaurant or any place, they were of no help. We got short answers that didn't help us at all! This hotel is not worth staying in. I'm sure you can find better service for the price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: Piripi_NZ
Reviews.Content: Having a grand Canal view room obviously spoiled ourselves but what a view. Quite happy just sitting on our balcony with a drink rather than going anywhere. Efficient but unintrusive staff - which is what you want. Dinner spolit by other guests at another table wanting their voices heard by the whole of Venice which even by moving tables didn't help. Fascinating city. Easy to walk - not that you have a choice really. Concierge organised water taxi out to Murano and Burano where you get the best seafood - The Black Cat Restaurant ( in Italian of course). A great Hotel but if you have decided to spend the money to stay here I recommend you pay another 100 Euro and get the water taxi from the airport directly to the Hotel door. We saw many people struggling with bags searching for Hotels looking very hot and bothered! Recommended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic setting with clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: hb200805
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night in Venice. The Westin was very beautifully decorated. Our room was clean and bathroom was a good size with the best shower! My husband claims it was the best night of sleep he has gotten on our Italy trip! I will have to agree.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff needs to be reminded they are suppose to serve the guests”
Reviews.Author: Calially
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and it was just ok. I say just okay becausewe had no problems with the room, it was clean, large, and decent. The problem is with the front staff and trying to get basic hotel services. I swear every time we called to the front desk, the phone would go to an automatic busy, so my boyfriend would have to walk down to the front to make the request in person. They would claim they are busy, but they were not, this was bizarre to me. Also, the conceirge, the big guy, acts like he is doing you a favor, somebody needs to tell him about customer service or Westin needs to fire this guy. I observed him sooo rude to this other American, who was asking questions about claiming merchandise she had purchased. I read the same compliants before I booked with Westin, so I know I am not being overly sensitive, this guys needs to go!! Tips: Use the public water taxi, you will save, for example the ride to the train station for 2pp was 12E, while the conceirge advised me to take a private water taxi at 60E. You also get a mini tour of the city from the canal, it makes alot of stops, but you get to feel the city in a different way. We also saved alot by eating at the Rialto Restaurant, it's a self service place that initally I turned my nose up at, but ended up being good food and decent price. It's near the Rialto Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. A UNBELIEVABLE HOTEL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: hilory_distant
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with my son. Courteous and knowledgeable staff. The concierge were so helpful. Very clean surroundings. Absolutely loved it. We were not able to try the food since we ate outside. Hope to do that next time the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “location and room”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Not like in Milan and Rome, we have to wait few hours for our room be ready.Arrived by taxi to the hotel just like the movie 'The Tourist' , Westin staff showed us to room 105 ( we were upgraded ) a big room which facing the Grand Canel, the view is beautiful and the room decoration and furniture are charm and very European style, we loved it. ( Surely is the best hotel room I ever stay in my life so far ! ) More, the restaurant food is very good and the price is not very exspensive. Compared to Westin hotel in Sydney Australia, the taste is worth one more star -that is a 5 stars quality. Westin Regina is the best hotel for our European Hotels stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Near San Marcos Square”
Reviews.Author: Brian1024
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Hotel Europa & Regina. It is a very beautiful Hotel. The room we had was nice, room 612, but the private terrace attached to the room was probably one of the best views in all of Venice; perhaps in all of Europe. We have attached photos of the terrace and the view of the Grand Canal and the Salute. There were a lot of mosquitoes in the room; however, perhaps from the terrace ... The rate did include breakfast, which was very nice. We did have some issues with the breakfast. First of all, it was exactly the same all three days we were there...Also the hot foods especially the eggs and sausage were cold all three days...they did allow us to order eggs off the menu, but found the consistent cold food to be odd in a hotel of this caliber and price range. The service at the hotel is helpful, but not engaged. The restaurant service was the same; you had to really hunt somebody down after they initially seat you. To be fair, they did always correct everything to our satisfaction; it just felt at times as if we were bothering them. The inside elevator buttons needed replacing as you would have to "pound" them to get your floor or any floor to illuminate. The external restaurants recommended by the staff were so-so (we did much better just finding our own) and the "promotional trip" recommended by the concierge to the Murano Glass Factory was an experience similar to a "Time Share" seminar. Also, Susan ordered a hamburger from Room Service and water and the tab came to over $75 US. We would stay here again, at the right rate and especially if we could get room 612 again, but this time armed with deep woods off... Bottom Line, beautiful hotel, so-so unengaged staff, Room 612 terrace is awesome, rest of room ok, Breakfast Buffet great, but cold hot foods and appears to be the same everyday. oh yeah and lots of mosquitoes!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - gorgeous view, thoughtful staff”
Reviews.Author: CTJwo
Reviews.Content: I hate to base the review on the room upgrade, because I know they simply aren't always possible - but ours really made the trip. We had a spectacular room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. Check in was smooth, the concierge helped us with reservations and our stay in Venice was fabulous. Even without the view - this is a great location to walk to the entire city. There are crowds at St Mark's naturally, but when you stay nearby you can go at sunset or for a drink at night. The hotel's public spaces are well appointed and feel luxurious. Every aspect of the hotel was lovely for us! Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Maribel12
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the staff of the Europa Regina for a most wonderful stay in Venice. I just came back from Venezia with the most memorable memories of my time there, and mostly, thanks to the wonderful service received at your hotel. I want to thank the hotel for sending the bottle of prosecco and the delicious cake to our room in commemoration of our anniversary. It was a special touch that I will always remember. The beauty of the view from the room was spectacular! I am looking forward to my next opportunity to stay at the hotel. I cannot thank the staff enough for making my stay everything I hoped for and more. The hotel is truly a five-star hotel. Grazie e a presto!

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: naveenPhilip
Reviews.Content: amazing location and great service. only hitch was at 10 pm some one came to make the bed which was disturbing but the hotel was very understanding. i travelled alone with my son and we had a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff extremely unpleasant!”
Reviews.Author: Geralyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend after a stay in Milan at the wonderful Sheraton Diana Majestic. The staff was amazing at the Diana so when we arrived at the Westin Europa in Venice, we were extremely disappointed. Not once did they crack a smile nor did they look us in the eye. They actually seemed to be annoyed by us being there. One woman in particular was Elisa Gregori. After telling us to come back in 1/2 our to get keys, we ate lunch on the beautiful waterside restaurant. Lunch was decent, overpriced, but what is expected in hotel restaurants. After lunch, we returned to get our keys. The line was long, so we just went around to ask for our keys as the long check in process was completed. Eliza was annoyed that she couldn't find our check in reservation and after much huffing and puffing gave us the keys to the worst rooms in the hotel. No ventilation and dark alley view. When checking out, she was just as rude (and even spoke about us in Italian to her co-worker under her breath) Concierge was better and other staffers a bit nicer, so have to give hotel a decent rating. Westin beware, your front desk staff is scaring people away! For the money, there are other places where I'm sure you would feel more welcome

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: beatwax
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short break at the Westin Hotel Europa & Regina with my wife. The hotel is perfectly located right in the centre of Venice and offers all you can expect from a luxury international hotel. The staff was very professional and polite. Overall, we were very happy with our choice and will definitely continue to use Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Anniversary Experience”
Reviews.Author: zephyr221
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europa & Regina for 4 nights on a mix of paid and Starpoints award nights to celebrate our anniversary. We had a wonderful experience. The hotel is a collection of 2-3 beautiful old buildings now managed by Westin. Be assured, this is not the Westin US travelers are used to; it's definitely a level above. As Platinum members we were upgraded to a 1-BR Venetian Suite, which was lovely with cathedral ceilings in the living room. I loved the blue fabrics that accented the room, which were rich and luxurious. The hotel is convenient to the Vaporetto at St. Marco (just a few minutes walk) and all of Venice's sights. The hotel bar was outstanding-- great service and an extensive menu of wonderful drinks. The Concierge was most helpful in getting dining reservations. Every person in the hotel was friendlier than the next. My only gripes are very small.... the pillows were very flat as if half of the feathers were missing. The rooms were also very hot and it took a couple of phone calls to Service Express and about 60 minutes to receive a fan, which took care of the problem. The hotel sent us a lovely amenity of Prosecco, cake, and a fruit plate to celebrate our anniversary. I would highly recommend the hotel. It's particularly a great value if you are using Starpoints.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine but beware of rip-off to airport.”
Reviews.Author: 2travel039
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD:This Westin was perfectly fine in many ways. I was travelling with a group of friends and we had a total of 7 rooms. We had all gotten an excellent price for the rooms, but did not get the best rooms over the canal. The rooms were nicely appointed and the bathrooms were all very large and well appointed. The hotel is very close to St Mark's Square which is wonderful. Everything at this Westin is very expensive, from the 5 euro coffee to very expensive food. Breakfast was included in our room price and there was a lot of very good food to satisfy anyone's taste. THE BAD: My only true complaint was with the concierge service for water taxi's to the airport. Our group left at different times for the airport, and therefore requested taxis at those times. We were assured by the head concierge that they would try to combine taxi rides because the taxis were very expensive - 100 euros per boat. There was no attempt to combine rides. I can't help but wonder if the concierge and the staff that help load the taxis get a percentage (or kickback) from the taxi drivers. One woman in our group had to go to the aiport alone (and pay 100 euro) even though a single person was right behind her in a cab and two people were in the cab ahead of her. They requested to be joined for the ride, but the staff said this could not be done because a taxi had been called for each person. My advice is to go to the taxi stand in the hotel a little early and just ask people in line if you can join them. We insisted this be done when it was our turn for the aiport. Another single woman was behind us and they were going to make her pay the 100 euros. This is really a very bad policy and people should be aware of it and insist they not be penalized by greed from concierge and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Gracious”
Reviews.Author: Bingo58
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the lovely Westin Europa and Regina in Venice (coming from Rome and Florence). It is a wonderful hotel and we were lucky enough to have a terrace overlooking the basilica of Santa Maria della Salute. It was absolutely enchanting to wake every morning and see the sun coming up over the Lido and San Giorgio Maggiore. The staff was perfectly gracious - warm and welcoming, and were patient with my halting Italian. We had coffee one morning in the dining room, delivered another morning, and a nightcap one night in the bar. We took our drink outside to sit in the cool evening air canalside. Just a wonderful end to a long day of sightseeing. Those were the only time we used the restaurant part of the hotel and we enjoyed our limited contact. The bathrooms were fine, large and nicely appointed with Etro bath products, plenty of towels, and a comfortable bathtub. The room had a lot of closet space and (important these days with phones and computers) plenty of electrical sockets. We brought our own adapters but the concierge can get them for you, too. We had a king size bed reserved and found two twin beds pushed together and made up separately. That was fine, but my half of the bed moved when I turned in bed, often waking me up. An odd sensation. The room was also very, very warm at all times. The air conditioning did not seem to be working yet, so we had to keep the terrace doors open which then made mosquitoes an irritation, but not massive swarms, just one or two here and there. We did not receive turn-down service (which doesn't bother me) at first and then did, and then on our last night we received slippers and floor mats, but the bed wasn't turned down. This was more confusing than a serious lapse, but it did make us wonder what we should be receiving. Internet access can be purchased, but if you have a laptop that does not have an Ethernet port (like our Mac), you have to use the lobby for the WiFi. I was not happy with this, because it meant dressing and going downstairs just to post to Facebook or check email. It's expensive and you don't really get to use it that much. There is a VeniceConnected deal for â‚¬5 per day. I tried to buy it, but they send you a Username and Password to your email address, and, well, I couldn't get access to my email without the Internet, so that was a waste. The hotel, for the first three nights of our stay, had a wine merchant meeting going on so things were always hopping. The hotel quited down once that group left. There was no less service because of it, the hotel always seemed well-staffed. The location is fine, and every morning you start by seeing the gondoliers getting their boats ready for the day's business. A wonderful place to stay with a great location, professional and courteous staff, and an expertly maintained property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mjc61
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. I'm a meeting planner and have seen plenty of 'nice' hotels. This one is in my top 5, ever. Was upgraded to a suite which blew us away. Would stay again. Google Maps are NOT accurate anywhere in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: YPSSanAntonio_Texas
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Westin Europa. The room was beautiful and very clean. The front desk personnel was courteous, but not particularly friendly. The restaurant staff was extremely accomodating and personable, and the food was excellent.
