Our view from the room was at an angle, which gave us a nice glimpse of the canal and the architectural structures across the way. We spent time in the hotel bar which was cozy and inviting. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again if we ever return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Starwood Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Doyle61
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this hotel the same way i have with other Starwood Hotels - on-line. I booked two rooms for my wife, 12-yr old & 13-yr old. Your drop down window from your website ask two questions - Number of Rooms & Adults in Room. I booked two rooms in my name and selected 1-adult per room. There were no other options for children. When we arrived at the hotel our first day in Italy, after flying from DFW thru JFK to Milan and then traveling by Train to Venice, the front desk clerk said the reservation was for only 1-person per room. I presented my confirmation which said "2-Rooms, 1-Adult per Room, Queen bed. She wouldn't honor the reservation and said that i would have to pay 250 euros per night and not the 160 that my confirmation indicated. Initially i was so mad that i told her to cancel my reservation and i would find rooms elsewhere but my family was exhausted from the travel an i took the room at the "new" rate. Rather than stay the two-nights that we booked, we left the next day and found other lodging. I then went to my room and called the SPG # and spoke to a customer service rep. The rep said that it was the fault of the hotel and not Starwood as Starwood only reflects the information that the hotel provides on the website. I found this to be a stupid comment by your customer service rep. The rep also said someone would call me within five days and that never happened. My recommendation to friends and family is don't use the Starwood website and that "confirmations" mean nothing as at least not at all of your hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PP81Augusta
Reviews.Content: We went there as a combined Paris/Venice trip during a spring break. There are quite a lot of cheap flights between different cities in Europe that can be found via edreams and Ryan air that can be as low as 20 euro. We used "cash and point" for our stay that provided us with a huge discount in exchange for a reasonable points. The hotel is just stunning. It was quite a walk from water taxi with the luggages up and down several stairs but was worth it. The location is convenient to several shops and restaurant. We have wonderful meals outside the hotel which was much cheaper. The rooms were gorgeous with beautiful view of the canal ( we ended up with 2 rooms since European hotels typically won't allow 1 room for 2 adults and 2 children). The lobby and the little garden area were just beautiful. We like it better than Westin Paris which we also stayed during this trip. We certainly would stay here again using cash and point with SPG.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: drdave60
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location - hard to get to unless taking water taxi (then it is very easy, but expensive 60 euro from train station) If you take the vaparetto - make sure you print off walking directions on hotel website otherwise you will get lost - 5 minute walk from San Marco. Front desk check in and check out service was below expectations for a high end Westin property. As a starwood platinum member, I expect much more than a rude disinterested desk clerk with a really condescending attitude. My junior suite was satisfactory but nothing special for the money paid. For a short stay, the hotel is fine, but there are likely better options at better prices nearby. It is unlikely that I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing views”
Reviews.Author: bouji
Reviews.Content: Hotel offers one of the best locactions and views on Venice. However, service tends to be a bit slow, on more than one occassion staff simply forgot our requests. Rooms appear to be clean, but when we opened the minibar, some bottles of water and snacks were opened and half eaten. We asked to change that, but it was never done. I suppose the hotel was full during the carnival, but such things are unexcusable in any hotel. Just one very old computer in the business centre, no free wifi, very slow internet. connection.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel located on Grand Canal with an excellent concierge desk!”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Europa and Regina during the first weekend of Carnevale. It was located on the Grand Canal and an easy 15 minute walk from the main San Marco water taxi stop. If you have luggage and are walking from San Marco Square, be sure to note that you will have to cross over a bridge with stairs and immediately after crossing that bridge, you need to take a left down some winding alleyways to reach the Westin. There are no signs for the Westin so I imagine a lot of people (including us) get lost trying to find it for the the first time. The Westin was decorated in an ornate style with richly hued plush sofas, lots of marble and Venetian glass chandeliers. Our room was small but overlooked the Grand Canal which felt like something out of a movie. It was well appointed with the usual flat screen tv, mini bar, safe, bathrobes, desk, etc... Our marble clad bathroom had Murano glass sconces, heated floors and Westin's White Tea toiletries. I also want to mention the Westin's Concierge staff which helped us immensely with advance dinner reservations and general directions/advice. I began emailing with them about 2 weeks prior to our arrival and they were extremely responsive to emails. For example, our flight to Venice arrived late and as a result, we wouldn't have made our Friday night 8 pm dinner reservation on time but I emailed the Westin's Concierge from the Venice Airport about the delay and they immediately changed our reservation for us and wrote me back. I loved my stay at the Westin and would happily return!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location for a magical week in Venice”
Reviews.Author: crivellino
Reviews.Content: We have just spent the most idyllic week in January in this wonderful hotel. It is impossible to exaggerate the splendid location it enjoys and equally impossible to overstate how well we were treated from the moment we arrived. We spent a week pretending we lived there and it was a long and magical dream. The location of the Europa is fabulous â€“ right on the Grand Canal but with entrances so discreet you wouldnâ€™t know it was there. The room we were given exceeded all our expectations and filled us with delight. The views from our terrace were stupendous, whether by day or by night and we had to keep pinching ourselves. It was so remearkable that we consciously built time into each day just to enjoy being in the hotel. With a B&O CD player we could have Vivaldi and Monteverdi to our heart's content and stepping out on to the terrace with a glass of something whilst gazing at the view was unforgettable. The hotel has a unique vantage point from which you can take in the island of San Giorgio, the Dogana and the magnificent Salute. The view from the dining room is equally enchanting and it was incredible to sit each morning at breakfast straight opposite the Salute church as Grand Canal rippled with the constant passing of vaporetti, water taxis, gondolasâ€¦ Being January we had both sunny days and also some days of authentic mist which were equally delightful and impossibly romantic. The other perfect component of this elegant and comfortable hotel is the staff. Everyone, from management to maid, was unfailingly courteous and kind and nothing is too much trouble. We felt thoroughly well looked after and totally at home. The purpose of our stay was to celebrate a special birthday (for which we were very kindly sent a bottle of champagne in our room) but frankly, everything here is so perfect it feels as though each day is a birthday in itself. We hope to return to a place which has created for us some magical memories. I have never written a review before but it seems unfair not to share thess wonderful experiences. I cannot recommend it too highly. Do get the hotel to organise your water taxi â€“ they will meet you at the airport and drive you straight to the dock. From that moment on the magic unfoldsâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mchud
Reviews.Content: Venice was our third stop on our Italy trip, and once we figured the place out it became one of our favorites. We followed the hotels on-line instrucitons to get to them, but it would have helped if they give which direction to take the Vaporrato - take the "1" towards "Lido". By doing this and getting off at the first San Marco stop you are a super easy, one little bridge walk from the hotel. As stated everywhere - the hotel is in a terrific location - minutes from everyhting. Reality in Venice is if you aren't dragging suitcases, walking is the fastest and easiest mode of transportation. Venice was the most expensive city we stayed in due to the fact that delivery is that much more expensive and labor intensive than anywhere else. There are ways to control costs, but expect to pay more period. We were given a large comfortable room facing into the alley on a higher floor - it was not a problem for us. Everything was ship shape updated and well maintained. Hotel staff was excellent - we got very good dinner recommendations at a couple of nice places. Seafood is king in Venice - so if you would like to enjoy a variety of fish and shellfish, this is the place for it. Being that this was our third stop, we learned how to economize by having breakfast at a bakery and eating standing up at a counter looking out the window - just like real italians. If you sit down you are looking at a heftry add on. On almost every street and alley we walked through there were opportunities to find something reasonably priced to eat. - pizza, panini's etc... We did not do pre-planned tours in Venice proper. Venice was just fun walking and exploring and getting lost.in. We spent most of our days enjoying the spectacle that is Venice. We did a short boat ride/tour to Murano, Burano and Torcello. You can purchase tickets right at the pier near where you got off to get to the hotel. The ticket booth can't be missed. You won't get alot of exploring time - especially in Murano, where they take you right to a glass works to see a short demo followed by an opportunity to purchase some of the beautiful glassware. You had a bit more time to wander in Torcello and Burano. The boat did include a narration by a multi-lingual guide, but due to the heavy fog there wasn't much to see. Do go to the bathroom before you leave on your trip - public WC's were scarce and those available were charging userous rates since they effectively had a monopoly. You can take Vaporrato's on your own to these islands if you don't want to be controlled by the "guided tour". Bottom line - The Westin Regina Europa was a terrific home base for us in Venice. Terrific staff, well maintained and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: RCSNY
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. The location was perfect. The room was incredible. The staff was AMAZING! If you can afford it - this is the place to stay when in Venice. Steps away from San Marco, in one direction an easy walk to Peggy Guggenheim and in the another to the Rialto Bridge. Our room overlooked the Santa Maria della Salute church and it was hard NOT to just stare at the beauty of the view.

Reviews.Title: “Terrace with a View to Kill For in a Romantic Stately Palazzo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brownbadger
Reviews.Content: As a treat for my wife's nth birthday I decided to pull the stops out for a change and go for a room overlooking the Grand Canal. The comfortable room not only had a view directly across the Grand Canal to Santa Maria della Saluta but also a huge private terrace from which to quaff Prosecco and watch the world float by. The staff had been pre-warned that it was a special trip and were very courteous, friendly and helpful- they all helped to make it a truly memorable stay. January is off season so it was pleasantly quiet in Venice. The other guests concurred with our opinions on the hotel and Venice in general. We'll definitely be back to enjoy the splendour and kind service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kedcali
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Venice for 3 nights in January for our honeymoon. We used spg points then paid to upgrade our room to a suite on the Grand Canal. It was a beautiful room and we loved our visit to Venice. The convenience of the water taxi in front of the hotel is very useful especially if you are traveling with a lot of heavy luggage. The staff was very friendly, helpful and thoughtful. Prior to arriving, the staff contacted us by email and asked if there was anything they could do to make our trip more enjoyable and helped accommodate our requests. We would highly recommend the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Location and Service - but Venice Pricing is Extortionate”
Reviews.Author: ColonelHathiLondon
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Venice in January 2011. We found the staff to be very helpful, the suite impressive and the location excellent. Our only minor complaint is that there are no tea and coffee facilities in the rooms. Our only major complaint - and it is a major one - is the pricing of drinks and food in Venice. Pretty much everywhere we visited in Venice, the prices of drinks and food bore no relation whatever to the cost of providing them - or to the quality offered. For example, perhaps Harrys Bar nearby is trading on its reputation when it charges 19 euros for a bellini - "buono ma non cosa buono" - perhaps. How though can a hotel (the Europa) justify asking 10 euros for a tin of Coca Cola that can be bought for 60 cents in the nearby supermarket? This was not at the bar or from room service - it was just from the minibar. Other in house dining and minibar prices were similarly inflated. We did not eat at the Europa - but I have to say that none of the 6 or so Venice restaurants we visited provided us with a meal of he quality we could easily prepare at home in our own kitchen. All charged extortionate prices regardless. The only exception were the little coffee bars that locals frequent - where good expresso and cicchietti can be had at reasonable prices. I am afraid that we were put off Venice by the pure profiteering of so many establishments we visited. It is so extreme as to be insulting. I should say clearly though that we are glad we visited Venice and that we enjoyed our stay at the Europa and Regina. The hotel even thoughtfully provided a (free) bottle of champagne on ice as a gift for my wife's birthday! A very kind gesture that was much appreciated. I would certainly be happy to stay at the Europa and Regina if visiting Venice again. The problem is that there are so many other wonderful places in the world to visit that I doubt that Venice will rise again to the top of our list due to its profiteering prices. My final plea to Venice (and Rome) is why not do something about those street hawkers pestering people to buy roses and those damn silly luminous helicopter things? They are a complete nuisance - and I have seen them actually pretending to give a rose to an elderly couple and then harass them to pay. Similarly the (apparently) Roma beggar women that drape themselves over the pavements begging made their appearance also. Not as annoying as the flower sellers but after you have seen your first 100 or so "identi-beggars" you realise that it is no less a scam than the rose sellers and the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: sisisisisisi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for three nights during November and had a great time. It was a fairly difficult hotel to find initially especially when we arrived at night and in heavy rain, but it was a good job that we didn't arrive a few hours later as Venice was literally underwater by then! The room was spacious and well decorated and the bed was wonderful and gave a great nights sleep. The service in the hotel wasn't up to the standard of some we've stayed at, but it wasn't unpleasant. Similarly the breakfast was nice, but not the best. If we ever go back to Venice we wouldn't hesitate to stop here again, but the hotel is advertised as 5 star while I would rate it at a more realistic 4-4.5 stars. On a side note Venice had what appeared to be pretty bad flooding while we were there. If you ever go in November take a pair of welly boots along with you or you'll end up having to buy some from the street vendors!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Europa Regina is the only place I'd stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ReviewingQueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned our trip to Venice for 6 days which turned into 9 days because of the snowstorm of Dec 27 shutting down the airports. The staff at the Westin Europa helped us enormously. They called the airline, called our travel agent, rebooked the water taxi, and found another waterfront room for us as our original room had been booked. The concierage, the manager, the desk clerks were patient and warm and helpful. The manager showed us 2 rooms and let us select the one we felt more comfortable in. I am so glad we chose to stay at the Westin. This hotel should be rated 10 stars!! It is incredibly beautiful, in a perfect location, and very client-oriented. We will never stay anywhere else except the Westin Europa Regina. Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “We never wanted to leave!”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerTom
Reviews.Content: After taking the VeniceLink shared launch from the airport directly to the E&R, we were delighted by the staff and beautiful lobby and central location! The room we were "upgraded" to the first night was average at best, but good enough to sleep off our jet lag for one night...so when I went to the helpful front desk staff the next morning, they were kind enough top show me several other rooms. The one we chose required a paid upgrade, but it was soooo beautiful that we thought twice about even leaving the hotel to enjoy beautiful Venice! Thank you Europa & Regina for making our last anniversary celebration so very special!! We are already planning a trip back this September to celebrate another anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Great location -enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: hiltonheaddan
Reviews.Content: First of all we we staying on SPG points and Cash program. When we first arrived we were welcomed by the helpful check in staff . The manager also greeted us, and asked her to "upgrade" us to a renovated room. We laughed a bit about that thinking that really wasnt an "upgrade". The room wasn't ready but were we told to return at 3. We returned and the room was ready as promised. Our room was on the 3rd floor overlooking a side street. When we were shown to the room, the staff realized the beds had not been converted to a king and immediatelly sent for housekeeping to change the beds. She arrived quickly and was very efficient. The room was very spacious, clean,comfortable and quiet . Nice flat screen TV, marble bath. The location was great just a short walk to San Marco,Rialto and the San Marco Vaporetto stop. Since we arrived early we had decided to take the water bus from the airport. We had contacted the hotel in advance for walking directions from the stop and it was easy to find. Would not have found it without their help. There are a lot of comments about the concierge. We found one to be extremely helpful, the other just as described in other reviews- grumpy and unhelpful. We did not use any of the hotel bars or restaurant. We anticipated that the food/drinks would be ridiculously expensive and that there would be better options elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - Spacious Rooms (SPG Gold)”
Reviews.Author: Kevman123
Reviews.Content: General Hotel: The Westin Venice is a beautiful hotel situated right on the Grand Canal. It can be a little hard to find, so be sure you have a decent map of the area. Additionally, the locals do not know of it as a Westin, rather the Europa and Regina. Room: Our room was huge for European standards. The desk has a comfortable chair with plenty of room to spread out. It is beautifully decorated with great art and furniture. Tech: Large Flat Panel TV A few English channels Corded Phone Wireless Internet (Coverage is spotty and not cheap) Bedding: Bed was very comfortable. A king room has four feather pillows on the bed and one in the closet, along with a blanket. Bath: The bathroom is beautiful with solid marble counters and marble floor. The tub is porcelain and has a nice strong shower. Location: Great location. Easy walk to Piazza San Marco and many other tourist spots. Staff: Average front desk staff. The wait can be a bit long if you need anything. Also â€“ you have to check your key in and out when you leave/return. Or â€“ just do as we did and remove the large tassel from the key and stick it in your pocket. Extras: Free umbrellas are available on request. SPG Gold Amenities None really - a "partial" canal view room was the best we could do for an upgrade. **A note on how I rate: I rate based on expectations. Therefore it would be possible for me to rate a La Quinta and a Ritz Carlton with 5 stars; meaning they far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly not up to Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: DS-World-Wide
Reviews.Content: We were very much looking forward to staying here and had heard very good things about the hotel. I am not sure whether it was because the hotel was quite empty, or whether it's just the norm, but the service was definitely not what i have have come to expect from Westin hotels or from the Starwoods brand. I felt like i was staying at a Holiday Inn - the staff were rude, too busy to help - the only reason they got a 3 for service was because of the concierge - very helpful. The rooms are cosy to say the least. They have apparently been renovated, and if this is the case, i would not have liked to see them when they were "old". Out bathroom was so old and dated - the toilet leaked around the floor, shower barely worked and the overall ambiance was... dated. The food (both restaurant and buffet) were 6/10 - decent choice but as with everything in Venice, VERY EXPENSIVE. The beds were comfortable, however the room did get very warm as in winter they do not have any a/c - which may sound silly, but you will want! The concierge managed to get us a pedestal fan which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money. You're paying for 5-stars and getting 3!”
Reviews.Author: SFOtotheworld
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at plenty of Westins all over the world and I have to say this was a pretty disappointing experience. While the location was excellent, the hotel rooms and staff left a lot to be desired. I would say you are better off booking a 3-star hotel with the same experience and saving yourself some dough. 1. Despite being told that our room had been recently renovated, our room felt old and dingy. The room smelled of mothballs. In addition, despite being in a non-smoking room, the room smelled like smoke all night long (I don't know if it was just bad ventilation?). We did mention this problem to the front desk and they said nothing. 2. While the front desk staff was really friendly and helpful, the Concierge staff was rude and unhelpful. They seemed annoyed any time you asked them a question. They were unwilling to help us figure out alternatives when our flight was canceled due to weather. And finally, one of the Concierges was actually drunk when we went to speak to him about dinner options. He smelled of alcohol. Despite asking him for a quaint and intimate non-touristy dinner option, he sent us to a huge, brightly lit tourist trap less than a block from the Rialto. 3. We were never offered Wellies to deal with the flood waters. After staying for 2 days, we happened to hear the concierge offer them to someone else...as we were leaving! 4. The hotel was unwilling to help us when the passageway to the hotel flooded. We definitely understand that the streets can flood in Venice in November/December. That being said, many of the other hotels we passed provided a walking platform for their guests to connect to the main platform. When the flood waters prevented us from accessing the street to get to the airport ferry, the hotel's only option was to book us a 100 euro taxi boat. In the end, we made them book us a boat to get to the ferry, which still cost us 40 euro (for a 3 minute ride). Since flooding is an ongoing problem, I would expect a hotel of that caliber and price point to provide assistance and options for their guests. While the location was great and the lobby was nice, the most important factors in choosing a hotel for me are rooms and staff. This hotel fell short in both of those categories.

Reviews.Title: “why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: ukman50
Reviews.Content: I suppose it depends what you want from a hotel. Comfort, location, service are high on my list and you could not fault any of these here. Basically the hotel delivers, in spades. Just stay here and enjoy. p.s. best to take wellies in Nov/Dec due to high tide.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FLcruiselover
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights at this lovely hotel which is right on the Grand Canal. I used Starwood points to pay for my room and was glad I had them because hotel prices in Venice were very high.This hotel had the feel of Venice even though it's part of the Westin chain with a gorgeous lobby and fixtures, and you could tell it used to be an old palazzo. As a Starwood member, and because I was paying cash for an extra third bed for my 11 year old, I was upgraded to a beautiful family suite which was extremely spacious with a pull out couch instead of the cot we had planned on having to use. Check in was a breeze for us, though we checked in on a Thursday. When we left on Saturday morning, there was a huge group in the lobby and it was a madhouse....was so glad I was not checking in at that time! All the staff we dealt with was extremely pleasant and friendly. Concierge was very helpful and went out of their way to give recommendations to make our stay extra special. As others have said, this location is amazing, as it is only a few turns around corners and you are right at San Marco, and an easy 10 minute walk to Rialto. Vaparetto and Alilaguna stops are very close by if you need to wheel your luggage to get to/from the airport/cruise port. Water taxi stop leaves you right at the door of the hotel with an amazing view of the Santa Maria della Salute church across the canal. We did not eat at the hotel as the prices were exorbitant. $35 euro each for breafast buffet, no matter how good it may be, was just not in my budget. I would definitely recommend this hotel but if you are checking in on a weekend do it early in the morning to avoid the rush of guests!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant choice on location and service.”
Reviews.Author: BeachFunTampa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europa for my birthday. It was wonderful to pull up in the taxi right to the resort. Our rooms were first class and had an attentive staff. I use to work and train Marriott staff for many years and it was refreshing to not feel a sense of lacking at a hotel. The hotel is close to everything and in a safe area. I was able to walk around while my family was relaxing. Fabulous location. The rooms were wonderful, clean and classy and a great size for Europe. Had a great craft women there one night that I wish I would have bought more from. The bar/restaurant overlooking the canal was fun and staff was friendly. Management was also helpful and curteous. I would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JMNN
Reviews.Content: Group was 2 couples. Took water taxi from airport to the private dock at the back of the hotel - perfect! No walking pulling luggage or wondering where it could be. Hotel georgeous. Reservations were for SPG award rooms - upgraded us to executive rooms - perfect! Room and bathroom very nice, lots of space. Location of the hotel is wonderful, close to everything but within easy walking distance. Overall a truly wonderful experience. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is not a 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: alkhaled
Reviews.Content: I travel every other year to Venice to visit the Venice Biennale of Architecture. This year I traveled with my wife and my little girl (3 months) we stayed at the westin for 3 nights. I booked the room with the best view of the canal. The room had a stunning view outside, inside however the carpet had a big patch ripped off. At night the heating was not adequate, all furniture next to the window was quit cold. In the morning load noises were all over the room as it was exactly on top of the canal delivery door. The sound of trolleys pushed on wooden plank was the daily wake up call. There was Ethernet cable available inside the room, strangely however it was located next to the TV and not on the work desk. The bathroom was clean but most drains were clogging. The staff on the other hand were very friendly and helpful. I don't think this hotel deserves to be a 5 star hotel as it really needs major upgrades. I've been to much better hotels in Venice, and all were 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BigChao
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin Europa and Regina for part of our honeymoon in Italy. I was able to book a basic room using my SPG cash and points feature. Here are the highlights: 1) Ideally located at the back end of the grand canal, only about 3 minutes walking from the San Marco Valeroso waterbus stop, 4 minutes walking to St. Marks Square, and 10 min from Rialto bridge. 2) This is not like other Westin resorts (many of which look very similiar to each other). I believe that Westin bought 2 hotels (the Europa and the Regina) and re-badged them as a Westin hotel. For those worried that you won't get a true feel of Italy by staying in a "chain" hotel, don't worry. You walk in and it's simply breath-taking, from the marble walkways and walls to the glass chandeliers and the decor -- all very classic Italian. The property is beautiful, and the waterfront entrance allows for some great views and photo-ops along the Grand Canal. 3) Because we were on our honeymoon, we were given a very generous upgrade to a "partial grand canal room." Upon arrival, we had cake and champagne awaiting us, along with a personalized note from the manager -- what a great touch! The room was beautiful though small -- but the couch at the foot of the bed made the room seem bigger because it offered a place to sit and utilize the space you had. The bathroom was very spacious and had beautiful granite countertops I believer. The "partial" view was actually a fantastic view of the Grand Canal, though it was looking at it from the side of a building, not from a grand canal front terrace -- but hey for a "partial" view it was a very very great view! 4) The staff was extremely courteous and helpful -- answering all questions we had. Check-in was speedy and although we did not utilized the bar, restaurant, or room services, they looked amazing. 5) Overall, I would say that our stay was amazing. We loved our room, the location, and especially the hospitality that was extended to us. We would definitely stay here again if we are lucky enough to go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Grand Canal Location Views and Price at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: qwovadis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several days in may as a www.spg.com member.Paid cash/points 90 euro/nt plus 4500 points great value.Was upgraded to a great partial Grand Canal view suite which was AMAZING for this price.Room was perfect the Hotel is actually 2 hotels put together some of the halls are poorly decorated in older areas of the hotel but common areas were beautiful in the renovated areas. Food prices were quite high staff could kindly be described as lacadaisical but friendly.A bit of a wait to check in like an hour after appointed check in time with no early check in allowed.But all things considered for Venice a GREAT experience for price.

Reviews.Title: “Three wonderful days in Venice”
Reviews.Author: dmk3975
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel.. The hotel is lovely and well located,, near shopping and attractions. The staff was great- especially the concierge, Carlon Massimo. He directed us to the most interesting sites, and gave great advice about restaurants and sightseeing activities. The combination of a great hotwl adn great staff made our stay in Venice truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Would stay there a million times!”
Reviews.Author: SimKyalami
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the main canal with gorgeous views of the water and magical Venice! The finishes are beautiful and the rooms are fit for Kings! A real suite to relax and enjoy! The location is very good, right near to San Marco's square and the gondola's. We didn't eat from the hotel as we found the prices absolutely astronomical and the Spa even more so but we ventured rather into Venice and found a tratorria that was charming and amongst the 'people' which we loved!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you like shoe box rooms & louzy breakfast....”
Reviews.Author: CatBxl
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful location is you want to be on the Grand Canal & walking distance to St. Markâ€™s square but thatâ€™s about it. Our room did have a partial view of a central courtyard above kitchens or something of the sort and the adjoining buildings walls which we enjoyed very much. Its size was that of a shoebox with big chunky furniture, not the place if you are claustrophobic as ceilings and extra low. You hardly had enough space to move around the bed and I had to store the spare blanket & our travel bags under the bed in order to hang our clothes in the closet. Do note we were only there for a week-end so itâ€™s not like I packed my wardrobe. Some reviews mention a bottle of water, candy or slippers, lucky them! We did not receive any of these and turndown was inexistent. It was all rather very disappointing to not a pleasant experience. The only aspect of a 5 star hotel being its rates. Definitely not Starwood quality. As Gold Preferred members, I had asked for an upgrade when making the reservation, cannot imagine the room we would have had being regular customers. We hardly saw any staff beside at check-in and check-out, which took forever. They are totally disorganized and do not expect them to get your bags in a reasonable amount of time. We actually after a long wait brought them down to the lobby ourselves. They then were taken by staff and stacked on a huge pile of more waiting luggage unattended while you wait to that someone feels like making the effort to get you a boat the leave this enchanting place! Cannot comment on the food beside the Breakfast buffet was lousy and cold, certainly not a 5 star quality or service, which discouraged us from having any other meals at the hotel. The only highlight of our Venetian holiday was our lunches at the â€œBuon Ricordoâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in magical Venice”
Reviews.Author: GoodTraveller95
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for a perfect stay in Venice. Looking at the location of other 5 star hotels, I feel the Europa has the prime location in Venice on the Grand Canale with the Santa Maria della Salute Basilica and Punta della Dogana da Mar directly opposite, plus the Chiesa San Giorgio Maggiore on the island of island of San Giorgio Maggiore in the distance towards the Lagoon. May be this is why Anthony Mingella chose the Hotel as one of the locations in his film The Talented Mr Ripley and Monet chose to paint one of his pieces of the Grand Canale. Our room was extremely spacious and very comfortable and gave us spectacular views of the above both during the day and at night when these sites were floodlit --- perfect !!! The staff of the hotel were very friendly and attentive to every detail. The concierge staff of Ilario, Roberto, Alberto and Marco were all extremely helpful and I was made to feel that any request was no problem whatsoever. The buffet breakfast was the perfect start for the day with hot chocolate just how I like it and a unhindered view of the Grand Canale across to Dorsoduro Sestiere. I just hope I donâ€™t become addicted to spumante in the mornings. Iâ€™d like to thank the Westin for such a memorable stay and I will endeavour to make my next visit to Venice very soon and it goes without saying I will chose and recommend the Hotel Westin Europa and Regina every time !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PVillela
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near Piazza San Marco, The room we stayed in was very clean, well-furnished, with a very comfortable bed. It wasn't very large but wasn't cramped either. The bathroom was quite nice, very spacious. Service was very good, as I would expect from a Westin -- it was courteous and efficient, but I wouldn't consider it warm. The hotel has a dock at the Canal Grande, from which you can take water taxis (which are very expensive) or the hotel's free shuttle to/from Lido island (we used the shuttle for a pleasant visit to Lido). The hotel is close to two vaporetto (water bus) stops, which we used frequently to visit parts of the city that were not within walking distance. We paid for our stay with Starwood points -- a great deal. Cash rates are quite high, though probably in line with other luxury hotels in Venice. Our comfortable stay in this hotel greatly enhanced our enjoyment of the city. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: 60713Pat
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location which is right on the Grand Canal. Our room did have a partial view which we enjoyed very much. The room itself was large but pretty shabby. There were dents in the furniture, one of the drapes was hanging off of broken hooks, the bench was missing one of the decorative knobs and there was just one miserable chair. The small single bottle of water labelled with "our compliments" was a joke. Later in the week a box of candy did show up and a cheap bottle of Bellini. The turndown consisted of closing the drapes and tossing a pair of slippers in a plastic bag on the side of the bed. The staff couldn't have been less friendly. We stopped saying Buon Giorno in the mornings since we either got no response or a half-hearted one. Particular note to the congierge staff. You could stand in front of the desk for quite awhile before they would acknowledge you. We have stayed at the Danieli which is a marked contrast to this Westin property. We won't be back, we would have complained at the Starwood desk if anyone had ever been there.

Reviews.Title: “best westin hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: rockyfjc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at the Westin Europa and Regina. As a president of a software company, I travel extensively. This was the best stay of any hotel that I have ever experienced. The staff made me feel special, especially the room maid and the lounge bartender. The room was magnificent with a view from the 6th floor overlooking Venice. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Singlelady18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and just loved it. Staff were helpful and friendly. Bar was gorgeous and in a great spot to sit and watch the world go by on the canal. The room was spacious and elegant and I slept really well. A few irritations. If we are paying a fortune to stay we don't then expect to have to pay to use the internet. Likewise, why so much to watch a film in your room? I only had the breakfast once and although the location next to the canal is just fabulous the breakfast itself was a bit disorganised (hot food goes cold quickly because not kept on hotplates; draught comes through open door onto terrace; sparrows hopping about indoors).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was far better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: tedattard
Reviews.Content: Only a stone's throw from St.Mark's Square this hotel caters to your needs.Awsesome service,food and hospitality.The terrace on the Grand Canal is awesome as you sip a drink and watch Venice go by with a backdrop of the church os Santa Maria della Salute. Friendly staff especially the concierges.We left by watertaxi to go to the airport and Irealised I left my favourite sweater on the terrace.Just called and gave them my home address.Sure enough my sweater arrived at home the next day.Wonderful !!

Reviews.Title: “amazing in every sense”
Reviews.Author: pew70
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four day trip in Venice. I was celebrating my 40th. On arrival we were upgraded to the most beautiful suite by a very courteous and charming receptionist, this could also be said of the concierge. We were a five minute walk away from San Marco, when we returned a bottle of prosecco and cake was delivered to the room with a personal note from the manager wishing me happy birthday. All these small things made my holiday and my husband who is very hard to please couldn't fault anything. We will definitely return to Venice and absolutely stay in this hotel. It is charming and i cannot praise the hotel or staff enough, anybody going to Venice I strongly reccommend this hotel. Thankyou for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service from the concierge”
Reviews.Author: tough08
Reviews.Content: I don't normally rate a hotel based on the concierge but I will this time. I had booked transportation to the Marco Polo airport with Venice Link before leaving home (this is a shared water taxi). Of course they must have payment up front. Their contract states that they will contact you 24hours before your departure to give you the final details of the pickup location and time. This did not happen. It took 5 phone calls from ALBERTO - the concierge at the Westin - over a span of 4 hours (until 8:30pm) and I needed to leave by 7am the next morning -to finally get a satisfactory time and pickup location from Venice Link. ALBERTO was fantastic and I don't think I would have made it to the airport on time without his help. He was also prepared to book me an alternate way to the airport right up until midnight! Thank you ALBERTO!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room, fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: JZL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin on our recent weekend trip to Venice. It was our first visit to Venice so we wanted to stay in a nice hotel in a good location. The Westin is about 3 minutes walk from St Mark's Square and overlooks the Grand Canal - so it was perfect! Our room was excellent - spacious, very comfortable, and had amazing views over the Grand Canal. Staff were very helpful and friendly, although service at breakfast was a little chaotic at times. The hotel also has a good little bar with excellent views so a nice place to sit and watch the sun go down. This is a great hotel for a luxurious weekend break. Prices are expensive but Venice prices are generally high and there is a good choice of decent cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelWhenYouCan
Reviews.Content: Having just completed our second stay at the Westin Europa & Regina, we're already planning our next visit. The hotel has old-world charm and beauty with modern conveniences as well as a primo location. Beautifully appointed rooms including Murano chandeliers, marble bathrooms, classical decor, and fine-quality linens. The bed was quite comfortable, and we both slept great there! Business center is less than cutting edge (one computer with slow printer), but staff does their best to accommodate your needs. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not Even Close to Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: LuckyEn0ugh
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Westin Europa Regina in Venice in October 2010. In one sentence all I can say is that Westin should be ashamed of itself to even rent out a room as horrible as we had. Yes, I know that Venice is a desirable travel destination and maybe hotels think that they don't have to keep their "luxury" properties up but when a high end expensive tour ends up with a guest room like we had, it is clearly unacceptable. Room 442: threadbare carpet (and not just a little threadbare or in one spot), dinged up dirty walls, multi-painted furniture that I guess someone judged shabby chic, when it was really just multiple badly painted coats that equal just shabby. Add to that an elevator that skipped floors repeatedly and was finally taken out of service and you have to ask what are the Westin folks thinking? It's not enough to have beautiful public rooms and then put your guests in rooms that are less than what we'd accept in the states as a Motel 6. If you're looking for luxury folks, pick the Cipriania, Danieli, Gritti or Bauer but avoid this one unless they remodel or give you a pillow and blanket and let you sleep in the public rooms, which are not representative of what is upstairs. Would love to have Westin "explain" this one away, and NO, we had other guests within our tour that had similar rooms. Your bad, Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jessica21Atlanta
Reviews.Content: The Westin Europa is centrally located in Venice between the main sights and the small neighborhoods. The food is quite overpriced, but that is usually to be expected from a Westin. The decor was nice. We requested a room with a nice view. The room was very nice, but the view could have been much better for a Platinum Starwood guest. They do ask that you turn in your room key every time you leave the hotel. That is a bit annoying, so I would prefer to not have to deal with that.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable experience at the Westin Europa-Rgeina”
Reviews.Author: lmkalamchi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 30th Anniversary with a trip to Venice staying at the Westin Europa-Regina.The staff went out of their way to be sure it was a special occasion. Our room was magnificent, on the top floor, with a beautiful terrace affording us an unmatched view of the city and Grand Canal. This was our third stay at the Europa-Regina and we have never been dissappointed with our accomodations or attentiveness of the staff. We look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: michygirl
Reviews.Content: This trip was for our 25th wedding anniversary. We had booked a canal view room and was pleasantly surprised with a suite, also the best room in the house! Thank you Westin!!! The balcony view was great also the champagne and cake. The hotel is expensive, as are all the top hotels in europe.Thank you for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced with too much attitude”
Reviews.Author: mgold040
Reviews.Content: My room was very small and faced a brick wall - even though prices at this hotel are sky high. My biggest complaint, however was with the concierge staff who were curt and arrogant. When asked a question they seemed bothered and not terribly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: memwal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous, the service is excellent (though not perfect) and the location cannot be beat. The rooms are nice, but not amazing. I stayed in a "superior" room, but saw several others friends stayed in. I think this is a hotel in which the experience you have will depend largely on which room you get. When the hotel is busy, you seem less likely to be able to get one of the nicest rooms (same as everywhere really).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, if you know how to find it. Very old world feeling.”
Reviews.Author: aquila19
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwoods Gold member so I almost always try to stay at a Starwoods property when I can. This was our 3rd stop on our European trip and the two previous hotels were Le Meridiens. After getting off the public shuttle boat, we spent maybe 30 minutes wandering around trying to find this hotel. The main doors are located in a very small alleyway, and there were definitely times when I felt it was just odd/awkward to be walking through that area later at nighttime. I can't even remember how to get back to the hotel now, but my husband was the navigator anyways. All I can say is to look for Prada, and once you see that, you are 5 minutes from the hotel. Look on the floor for signs pointing to "Europa" or "Regina" hotel. The reason why its called the Europa & Regina is because it used to be two hotels an after the Westin took over, it is now one bigger hotel. You can absolutely see the difference from the canal view. The room keys are extremely old school and you have to return them to the lobby before you leave for the day. I understand that this is probably a historical building so many things within the rooms would seem quite odd. We had a partial canal view which was absolutely lovely, especially at night. The room is divided a bit awkwardly: there is a small "hallway" where the closet and the safe are, and also where you can store your suit case. The bathroom is unusually large, although the shower stall was teensy (as is the norm for European hotels, apparently). It was clad in all beautiful marble and felt very luxurious. The bedroom itself just fit one bed, a small mini bar and a small TV. Nothing else. The room itself is decorated with very old world feeling wallpaper and the furniture matched this decor as well. I would have to say that the location, once you can find it, is not to be beat, however I would not pay the $400+/night it asks as I don't think we received any special service whatsoever, even as a Gold Starwoods member. It was just a nice place to sleep and that was about it.

Reviews.Title: “Would havr been a 5.0 If the bed was better”
Reviews.Author: wordsyouwant
Reviews.Content: Customer service was great and the hotel itself was breathtaking. However, the bed was very hard and very disappointing for a 5 star hotel and the hotel restaurant was WAY OVERPRICED for the food we revived.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, but seriously lacking in service.”
Reviews.Author: antipest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a large group on a sales reward and although the situation was great, the hotel let itself down on the very poor level of service provided. I imagine they run at nearly 100% occupancy and so therefore do not have to worry about poor reports on sites such as these. On arrival I had to collect my key from reception, there was no-one there. I waited and then gently 'requested' for assistance several times, after being totally ignored I then shouted for some help. Eventually someone appeared and did not even apologise for the delay. We went for a drink in the bar and decided to sit outside on the covered decking, after a long wait for service I went inside and asked the barmen for some drinks and was told "Its raining I do not go outside when its raining". When you are charged Euro 9 for a 33cl beer and 16 for a glass of wine I sort of expect him to swim the Grand Canal if necessary! We had a corporate cocktail meeting in the evening and the bar waiter was putting wine into 'tooth mugs' so as not to have to worry about going to the other end of the bar to get wine glasses. On asking why he was doing this I just got a shrug and told "its easier". The rooms were fine with good beds, clean bathrooms etc. However, the maid did just wander into the room to leave something without using the bell or knocking, could have been embarrassing. They had a real problem serving hot food for breakfast in the morning, I don't know why but it was a problem in another Westin hotel in Florence as well. If you want the 'reassurance' of a Worldwide brand stay here by all means, but I am convinced there are far better hotels in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Perfect Location Perfect Holiday”
Reviews.Author: 187055Mary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on the evening of the 21st September 2010 having travelled with Venice Simplon-Orient-Express. Despite the hotel being extremely busy, due to a conference or function we were accommodated for dinner without hesitation. The meal would easily surpass that of any other hotel in Venice. It was superb. The following morning, at breakfast, the restaurant manager greeted us by name. The accommodation was as requested - canal view on a low level floor, due to my disability. The room was spacious and relaxing, the bathroom exquisite and the maids/housekeepers conscientious in their duties. The hotel's location with its own jetty - close proximity to gondolas for hire, away from the hoards of crowds other hotels have to contend with, made it a very peaceful place. All this and still only a stone's throw from St Mark's Square. Reception can be a little overwhelmed at extremely busy times, but the high occupancy only confirms the popularity of this hotel. I have already recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Rooms. Four Star (Not five)”
Reviews.Author: DGTraveler123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a honeymoon in early September. The hotel is right in the middle of the action, which is usually good, but if you don't want tobe in the middle of all that touristy than I would not recommend this hotel for you. I should also note that you must walk down a series of narrow alleyways to get into and out of the hotel. While we always felt safe, the alleys do seem a little ominous at night. The lobby is beautiful, and the staff are very friendly and eager to help. Not pretentious like at other Westin's in Europe. The rooms are clean and nicely appointed, although certainly not five star by any standard. They are 3.5 - 4 stars, and I had an upgraded room. The beds are comfy and the bathrooms modern, the room is just small and bland. Overall it was a great base to explore from and the truth is you spend very little time in the room in Venezia. Recommended if you can stay on points, probably not worth paying an exhorbitant amount for.

Reviews.Title: “Fits the Westin standard”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker03
Reviews.Content: Walk a few minutes from San Marco Square, turn a corner, and you'll be surprised to see the Westin. It may not look impressive on the exterior, but there's a fair touch of Old Europe opulence inside. I stayed 3 nights. The first night I was given a standard double room and it fit what I expected -- not glamorous, but plenty of space, clean, and comfortable. For the typical business class hotel prices in Venice around San Marco, I think it's a good deal. Westin upgraded me to a suite for my next two nights and it was spectacular. The suite carried Etro bath products. I got a small view of the grand canal. And of course, the heavenly Westin king bed let me sleep like a baby. There's a gym on the ground floor past the restaurant which was serviceable for light exercise. The free WiFi service signal that's available to SPG Platinum members was very weak from my suite. But I'll trade a suite upgrade over free WiFi anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DBSEA
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent 3 night stay at the Westin Europa Regina. We were extremely pleased with our very spacious room and amenities. The service and staff were very polite and accommodating. What we LOVED the most, was the fabulous terrace bar and restaurant. It is right on the grand canal with amazing views. It was really special to have breakfast out there every morning. We did think that buffet price was a bit steep, as it came to almost $100. USD for 2 people! I guess you have to expect that when youâ€™re staying in nice hotels in Europe. You pay for the location and the views. It was all worth it. This was our 2nd visit to Venice and when we plan to return, we will definitely consider staying at the Europa Regina again.

Reviews.Title: “Wery plasent stay, Westin is the best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: flavia078
Reviews.Content: Recently we returned from Venice, we stayed at the Westin and it was perfect for us except the weather has not kept with us, it raind and Friday and Saturday. We had reserved a standard room for two nights but we got a large and very nice high. It was the 3 time that we stayed at the Westin, we like very much, we stayed in Venice and at other hotels but we believe the Westin is the most elegant of all. In 17.09. was also my birthday, in the room we found a bottle of champagne from the hotel management and a greeting. My and may husband had a wonderful surprise , we won to thank the hotel management for this and want to tell all those who choose Venice as a holiday destination not consider the negative impressions about this hotel and stay with confidence at the Westin. Breakfast is very varied and something for everyone, very friendly staff at reception (we want to welcome this way Laura she been very kind to us), the bar is very nice with a prompt service, everything is great at the Westin. I hope to return soon to Venice and of course at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in heart of Venice graciously aims to please.”
Reviews.Author: cld28
Reviews.Content: As an SPG Preferred Guest, I used a combination of points and Euros for my 2 night reservation for a standard room for two . Was first escorted to a room in dire need of renovation. It reeked of cigarette smoke and was disgustingly stained on drapes, carpeting and dust ruffle. I was offended that they tried to slough off this room on me and probably because I was paying with points and a female from the U.S. After realizing the scope of the issue, I confronted the staff that the room was unacceptable and I had requested a non-smoking room. After a 2 1/2 hr. wait and complimentary cocktail on the terrace fronting the Grand Canal, I was upgraded to a newly renovated and beautifully appointed Executive Suite. Check-in was delayed for other guests, as well. Hotel was wonderfully located on Grand Canal and close to everything with 5 min. walk to Piazza San Marco. Staff graciously accommodated us. Hotel was magnifico and everything we expected! Private water taxi transfers are the best choice and arrive directly at hotel from airport or marine terminal. It's worth the extra expense if you have heavy or extra luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Westin Europa and Regina was truly spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: ak19
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin Europa and Regina was truly spectacular! From the moment we arrived at the hotel we knew we were someplace special. We were immediately greeted warmly and attended to immediately. Further, our charming reception manager had arranged a wonderful upgrade from the room we had originally booked which was much appreciated after a long journey particularly since we had arrived late in the evening. Also, knowing this trip was quite special for us, he sent us a lovely bottle of presecco for us to toast our special occasion. We could not have chosen a better hotel to celebrate our anniversary. We make this statement in the context of being frequent travelers to luxury hotels around the world. Quite simply every aspect of the service we received was excellent, from room service to housekeeping to the superb front desk reception. On a final note the hotel is located on the grand canal and is as beautiful as Venice itself. Therefore, the Westin Europa and Regina receives our highest recommendation and accolades.

Reviews.Title: “location location location - perfetto”
Reviews.Author: Sam7506
Reviews.Content: Well, sometimes it's all about location. And in Venice it certainly is. Having had huge doubts about booking a "chain hotel" in this particular city, we were amazed. Finding the way to the hotel is challenging, as the signage around the city is like a wild-goose-chase. Once there, the reception staff & concierge are - honestly - as rude and unfriendly as you kind of expect in Venice. But the location of the hotel, with a bar & breakfast restaurant literally sitting ON the Grand Canal, was amazing. The room size is incredibly big and the bathroom is - again, for Venitian relations - huge. seperate shower & bathtub and loads of space everywhere. The only downside was the floor we were on. - it had an inner-courtyard roof right at the window-sill, so we didn't dare to sleep with open windows. We might have seen too many horror movies, i guess. So avoid the 1st floor if you can influence your room allocation. (Hotel part Regina). The fittings of the room were gorgeous, and housekeeping was very clean. the aircondition is poor, and with the window closed, that was not a very nice sleeping experience. Service in general...well...it's Venice and maybe you need to take it with a pinch of salt. on our arrival night, there was a big wedding going on and that's the downside of big hotels like that - events & corporates like them. the breakfast quality is very average and by far not worth the money. Reduce it to a cup of cappucino & a glass of bubbly and enjoy the view and hustle & bustle as the grand Canal awakes, and than, make a move and get a proper cornetto con crema or whatever you desire at one of the little coffee shops off the main streets. Much better! all in all, a great place. Beat the grumpy concierge(s) with a smile and move on. - god knows, why they can't be happy working there. it's a gorgeous place and many would enjoy working at it.

Reviews.Title: “A place not to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1907
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Westin Hotel on my last stay in Venice. The Hotel is very disorganized. They do not allow anyone to check in before 3:00pm even if the room is ready. This keeps 100 or so guests in the lobby waiting all day for their room. They offer to hold your bags but don't let them do that. They place your bags in a hallway where anyone can steal from them. During my vist, there were over a 100 bags sitting in hallways and an open room for anyone to take. The rooms were average and not very clean. I complained to Starwood propertys and they did not care about any of these problems. They do not have a customer service policy so I would not recommend this overpriced hotel or any Starwood property.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Heynnow
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was poor except the location. The general Westin menu, was completely ridiculous with a bottle water priced around 10-12 euro, basic breakfast priced around 25-35 euro. The Staff at the reception was rude, and not very helpful. Be sure not to spend hard earned money at this hotel. I always felt that that I was not welcome here. Decor felt very generic and predictable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anne4768
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, a few blocks from St. Marks Square, the lobby and public areas are pleasant, but our room was quite small and nothing special. We were using Starwood points. The front desk staff were pleasant and helpful when we checked in, they do seem to be under staffed, waiting time for questions and checkout was long. The conceiege was not rude, but neither was he very helpful. We arrived via private water taxi on a rainy day, expensive but worth it after a long flight. The houskeeping staff were fine and the beds featured heavenly linens but not quite the heavenly mattress I expect from Westin. If you are using points, I would say go ahead and book, if not find another less expenisive alternative

Reviews.Title: “A true hospitable (Italian) experience!”
Reviews.Author: travellerLucy
Reviews.Content: We arrived at a Sunday where the hotel staff surely wasn't understaffed. We were kindly welcomed in the hotel. The room was enormous for only two persons, which made us feel like royals! The beds were pretty hard, the pillows a bit too soft. The F&B outlets were nice, likewise was the service. We sometimes experienced the service a bit too laid back, but than again we are on holiday! The free watertaxi service to the glass-art island Murano was EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: joannlynn76
Reviews.Content: The free breakfast that comes along with the room you better plan to not have a waiter or waitress with no service although it was a fairly decent buffet. The concierge recommended a dinner at Do Fino which was a tourist trap and we had a bad experience when the bill arrived. We felt completely taken advantage of by the waiter charging way too much for the dinner. Would not recommend staying at the Westin but to have a drink on the canal instead.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, hard to find”
Reviews.Author: skywalkerjedimaster
Reviews.Content: Beautiful but had difficulty finding it. The only hotel that's ever made us wait until 3pm to check in. They did not even offer to check if the room was ready early. When you're hot, tired, and unaccustomed to walking through a maze to find a hotel, that gesture would have been much appreciated. Venice was absolutely gorgeous, a wonderful experience, but I will choose a different hotel when I return.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a view.......six stars+”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite star wood property. From the lobby, you can pickup the hotel's wifi as well as another free wifi. Ihave been traveling to Venice for several years (40 plus) and the Hotel Regina and Europa is my favorite. They recently acquired and renovated the neighboring Casa Borlozzi and legend has it that the countess still lives there and has all of the front rooms facing the Grand Canal. It is rumored that the countess still lives there and has an apartment at the Excelsior Lido hotel (no longer a Westin). In any case, my favorite pastime in Venice is sitting outside at Tiepolo, the hotel's terrace bar, for a glimpse of the infamous 90 year old countess to show up as well as use my SLR camera to take thousands of pictures of gondolas and S Maria Della Salute. If you are driving, I recommend you leave your car at piazza Roma. This hotel only has gondola parking and I doubt you will be arriving in one. .late breaking news. Aldo from the bar whom has been working here for 33 years indicated the Countess has died and that a Baroness lives next door. Just think, you too can be living like royalty at this hotel or more like casanova. Iprefer Casanova and so does my wife. :) this hotel was recently renovated and everything is new and tvs are large flat screens. If traveling from the train station to this hotel, take vaporetto number 1 or 2 and get off at the first st. Mark's stop. When you get off, you will see Harry's Bar. Go straight to the major walkway and turn left and walk straight. You will see a baroque church to your left. This is your clue that you will need to pickup your bags and cross the bridge where the gondoliers are. You should see a small gold sign for the hotel above and to the left I dictating that you are to go down the alley and follow the signs for the hotel. The hotel is on the Grand Canal and perhaps you are fortunate to get a room with a view. Ask for Roberta when checking in. She is efficient and very nice and I really enjoyed talking to her when checking in. Please experience two things when coming here. One is the Tiepolo terrace bar. The drink menu is extensive and if you do not drink, you have to try their iced coffee, cafe shakerato. It is better than anything you will have in Italy and it is the best. My favorite drinks are the Venetian Spritz or Champagne cocktail. the champagne cocktail comes in champagne glasses modeled after Marie Antoinette's breasts and I o ly wish she were a 42EEE. :) when going to the bar, be sure Luianna serves you or Aldo whom has defined bar service. The second thing to try here is the breakfast buffet. Go back and change your reservation to have breakfast included. You have everything from omelets made to order to salmon, prosciutto, ham, French fries, stewed tomatoes, pastries, cappuccino, teas, yogurts, cereal, fresh squeezed orange juice and an assortment of juices and bacon and sausage and many more things including cereal. You cannot go wrong and breakfast is one of the most important meals of the day....What I did not mention is that the breakfast area is also outside on the Grand Canal and you can partake of gondolas and other boat traffic whilethesun rises on Santa Maria. Della Salute. What better way to start your day. I think that when you get here, you will not want to leave the beauty of the hotel. I only wish I discovered this hidden gem earlier. I also like the Danieli and Gritti Palace but find the terrace bar and breakfast area the best. I also thi k your kids will enjoy feeding the little finches (birds) At both locations. :)

Reviews.Title: “Fairy tale experience”
Reviews.Author: jackandmary1
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice after a long journey for a three night stay prior to embarking on a cruise. The team working in the hotel welcomed us warmly. They were both friendly and efficient, anticipating our every need. The breakfast was the best we have ever experienced in a luxury hotel. There is a wide variety of fresh fruit smoothies and you actually see the chef baking all throughout the moring the most incredibly delicious breakfast pastry. Breakfast on that spectacular terrace with such fine table linens, crystal and silver, overlooking the Grand Canal and the salute church with the quiet boats and gondolas going by is an inspiring way to start the day in this magnificent city. We reserved a suite in order to accommodate all four of us, which had a large terrace and a bird's eye view of all Venice. The children's eyes were sparkling with excitement to see this sight and quite frankly so were ours. On our arrival day, we decided to have dinner on the hotel's retaurant terrace with a full moon reflecting on the water. The food and service were excellent and they were truly atttentive to the children. There was a special menu for them and a coloring book for the 5-year old, which between the sighting of gondolas and coloring kept her quiet enough so that everyone enjoyed what turned out to be a very romantic evening. We just cannot say enough about the staff...they were wonderful. We were sorry to have to leave, even though we were all very excited about the cruise, we would have stayed on forever at the luxurious Westin Europa.

Reviews.Title: “Character and Charm, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JuddsJeddah
Reviews.Content: We had a brief stay at the Westin Europa and Regina. The hotel location is great, the buildings are full of character, and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location; Great Relative Value”
Reviews.Author: SoCalDoug
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the Westin Europa & Regina and truly enjoyed ourselves. The staff was excellent and the room had a wonderful canal view (honeymoon coupled with Starwood Platinum status may have been the reason for the view). A few comments on the hotel and Venice in general: * We arrived in Venice after traveling from the US all night. We paid 100 Euro for a private water taxi and would DEFINITELY do that again. Another couple on our flight tried public transportation and they arrived at the hotel nearly 90 minutes after us (tired and frustrated) * The train station is much more manageable via public transport (Vaparetto) * I can't speak to the hotel food. It was VERY expensive and there are PLENTY of alternatives within walking distance. * San Marco is a 5 minute walk; Rialto is about 15 minutes (plenty of signs guiding you to both locations) * The city takes on a different personality after dark when the massive cruise ships leave; save some energy for an evening stroll * Rick Steves had some great food recommendations in his book. * Also consult TripAdvisor for restaurant ideas; I had the TA app on my iPhone and it proved useful

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment - with a capital "D"”
Reviews.Author: boxty10
Reviews.Content: It was a double celebration on the day we arrived at the Westin.... my birthday and the 1st day of our honeymoon. I was really looking forward to it. Well my excitement was quickly dashed by the time I arrived at the check-in desk. We had to wait a few hours for our room. Didn't really mind that as we went to the bar and were served by nice pleasent staff and sat outside overlooking the canal. When we got to the room it was a big dissapointment... it was spacious but dark and looked out on a building covered in scaffolding. I didn't want to spend the next 4 days stuck in this dungeon with the lights turned on. So I went down to reception to be met by a rude, unfriendly, unhelpful and uninterested staff. I asked could we be changed to another room, even if the room was smaller or we had to pay for another upgrade. Without even looking up to make eye-contact I was informed that it wasn't possible at all to change. I then contacted my nice, friendly, helpful travel agent back in Ireland and within minutes she rang back and had our room changed at an extra charge. Amazing miracles do happen...! The complimentary wine and fruit that they brought up to our room hadn't even got the corrected name to welcome us, another little touch from the Westin to make us feel right at home..... At that stage I wished I'd stayed at home.....! On a positive note... breakfast was lovely and staff there were very nice....

Reviews.Title: “Read for an honest review”
Reviews.Author: Haynezey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin in Venice the last 3 nights of our honeymoon. This was a splurge so we would feel comfortable in Venice. The hotel is in one of the BEST locations. A 2 minute walk from St Marc's Square and 3 minutes from the Hardrock Cafe! If you are used to 5 star hotel expenses than this hotel will not surprise you. Venice is an expensive city as it is but the food at this hotel is not worth the cost, dinner that is. Breakfast was fabulous! Our room was great, we stayed in a grand canal view room but it is much smaller than the pictures on the website lead on. Some staff was very helpful, there was one man at the conceirge who was very grumpy and not helpful at all. The staff at the bar was very nice and when we took a private boat tour of the grand canal they had our bottle of champagne chilled with plastic glasses ready for us when it arrived. We liked this hotel but for the money we paid what you would get in the USA for this money would be so much more. It was very comfortable but VERY expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok service, typical chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: hewoallan
Reviews.Content: This is your typical Westin. The location is great right off the water and St. Marks Sq. The rooms are a good size and large bathrooms. Some mornings there were apples and water in the lobby other mornings it was not there. Concierge is not the most helpful. As you expect with these hotels, nothing is included. No free wifi, no breakfast. Booked with SPG points so can't comment on price.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: rimen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights during our trip to Italy at this hotel.When walking into the hotel, I thought it was beautiful and very elegant, i was sure this would be a good Westin experience. (We stayed at all Westin hotels whle we traveled through Italy). As gold preferred members, I requested an upgrade and the hotel stated that they would give us one. So I expected something wonderful, but what a disappointment. We walked into our room, the room was rather large as there was a hallway leading into the room, with a closet, bathroom, and then a room w/ the bed. Expecting a beautiful view of the canal, or something similar, I opened the window to find another building about 4 feet away. There was no view at all. Further, the room was rundown. The paint was chipping off the walls, the decor was extremely dated, and the bed was no "heavenly bed" as Westin advertises. Further, our room smelled like mold. It was awful, so we told the hotel staff. They said they would take care of it. When we returned to the room, it appeared that they just sprayed something minty in the room to cover the awful odor. We attempted to open the window to perhaps neutralize the odor, but there were people smoking outside and the smoke smell came into our room. We went to the bar one evening and ordered a bottle of wine. There was a lot of flies in the room, and a fly landed in my husband's full glass. When we told the waiter, he took the glass of win and gave my husband a new empty glass. This happened once again, and this time, the waiter just drained the fly out and gave my husband the glass of wine back. I was completely appalled. They never offered to provide us with a new bottle or let alone a glass of wine. It was a complete disappointment and Westin should be ashamed of this hotel. The only positive of this hotel was that it was less than 5 minutes from St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: EXgeMMy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin during the 2nd week of July. I thought I would address what a few other posters have mentioned. In one below post the guest stated that the hotel was only talking about water taxi's. On the day of my check out July 9th there was a strike by ACTV the public transportation company so indeed the only way to the train station was by water taxi unless you walked. Another guest complained about the entrance being hard to find. I e-mailed the hotel before hand and had no problems finding the hotel. As it was Venice I suspected it would be difficult to find without directions. Now for my own experiences. I found the location to be excellent. It is located about 2mins from the square and also 2 mins from a water bus stop. The staff I had no issues with and they answered all my questions. The room although the carpet could have been updated was a good size and I had a very clean washroom. My only complaint was our bed was 2 doubles beside each other instead of a single king. It didn't bother me that much so I didn't mention it to the hotel. Now I don't know if this is a Venice thing or a hotel thing, but the restaurant / bar prices were ridiculous. $42 Euros for American breakfast buffet is absurd. I don't care if the table faces the grand canal. that is a lof of money for some eggs and bacon. The bar averaged about $16 Euros for a drink. A coke I believe was $8. I found the price to be expensive but again I believe this is a Venice thing.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment; unhelpful, dishonest staff.”
Reviews.Author: holidayrd
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel and it's rooms are pretty, the misinformation, snobby attitude and rude treatment by the front desk staff made this hotel a huge disappointment. The major problem with this hotel is the front desk's dishonesty. We heard them misinform guests that the only possible way to get to the cruise terminal was by private water taxi (E100) which they would arrange.
