[There is public water bus service available.] When we asked about transport to the airport, we were told that the only way to get there was private water taxi (E100) which they would arrange. When I asked about the vaporetto (public water bus), they told me they had no idea about it. [There is water bus and land bus service to the airport.] When I asked for a restaurant suggestion, they told me the only open one was the in-house restaurant (way too expensive). So, if you expect honest answers or advice from your hotel, stay elsewhere. In addition to this, we had to wait on a long line to check in, only to be told to return several hours later for our room. Upon our return, we were told to return in another hour. Upon that return, only one of our two rooms was available. We took that and they promised to tell us when the other room was ready. They never contacted us and when we asked at 11 p.m., we were given a key to the room. Throughout our stay, the front desk was rude, snobby and dishonest. There are lots of other pretty hotels in Venice; most less expensive and all probably more honest and pleasant. This hotel was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “definitely avoid, 2 stars is generous rating for this five star hotel !”
Reviews.Author: mdny27
Reviews.Content: Hotel entrance is very hard to find, reception is slow, they gave me a room that was disgusting ( a motel room would definitely be cleaner ) the carpet was dirty and full of spots, the room smelled of mold and the furniture is the kind that you would through at the curbside as trash. I complained to the receptionist immediately and she stated that "you need to appreciate the historic value of the hotel" I then asked her to point me to where the 5 stars rating is showing in the room I got, and she said they were sold out and she will consider changing the room next day. when I showed her how disappointed I am, suddenly a "slightly" nicer room became avaiable, the second room was renovated recently but still wouldn't pass for more than 2 stars. I think other reviewers who gave them 4 or 5 points rating don't definitely know what 5 star is. overall, avoid, avoid , avoid, and avoid more.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: beamkay
Reviews.Content: Had a most enjoyable 4 days at above hotel B & B. A bit pricey but on the other hand we gather this is the going rates for Venice. The only complaint was the food generally in Venice, very, very bland and far too expensive along with poor service

Reviews.Title: “Great location - fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobAtSea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel before taking a Mediterranean cruise. We found it to be a very nice hotel close to Piazza San Marco and away from the crowds a wee bit (not isolated at all). Once we found the hotel we were greeted well and taken to our room by a member of the front desk staff (do we tip these people?). The giant key fob was cute but a lot to carry around. We enjoyed drinks and snacks on the bar deck each evening, but did not eat in the restaurant. The concierge and bell staff were both helpful whenever we needed them. The room was nicely appointed and the bed was comfortable. I've certainly had smaller rooms in New York. The tub was very handy after the long trans-Atlantic flight. Being American I may never know what to do with a bidet, I remember hearing on the Queen Mary they used them to chill the champagne, but we didn't have enough ice. I might advise anybody not arriving by water taxi to go ahead and hire a porter. You will find the hotel more quickly and not have to lug your bags over at least one bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Just spoile Westin brand”
Reviews.Author: yadavggn
Reviews.Content: I had stayed with my family in westin venice on 23rd & 24th june 2010, i booked rooms under family pkg. the rooms are not more 10X10 feet, hotel management not hounour online rates confirmation they have to give me 50% discount on 2nd room for children.they charge full rates even after online confirmation and misbehave with me.They simply damage WESTIN brand.

Reviews.Title: “Well-Situated and Well-Appointed. A Good Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: brytpa
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Westin Europa & Regina in Venice in November of 2010, and very much enjoyed our stay there. While nothing really blew us away about the hotel or stood out as particular remarkable, there were likewise no disappointments or crises and no reason to leave this stay anything but satisfied and pleased. The hotel has a great location, just a very short yet very pleasant stroll from St. Mark's Square. It's also right on the Grand Canal, directly across from the Basilica di Santa Maria della Salute. Great views can be had from the hotel cafe's seating areas right on the canal, or canal facing rooms, of the Basilica, Venetian architecture, the Grand Canal, passing boats and gondolas, etc! Venice's walkways are quite narrow and maze-like (which is a big part of their charm), but it can make finding this hotel difficult were you to attempt to find it on foot after getting a water bus from the train station. We took a water taxi, though, which dropped us off right at the hotel's dock and so that was not an issue. There is some signage out and about to direct you to the hotel if you're walking (bronze plaques they've placed in the surrounding area to send you in the right direction) but familiarizing oneself with google maps or even asking directions would probably be a good idea if you were to attempt to walk from a bus stop to the hotel's entry (in a small, quiet and cute square) when first arriving. As the name of the hotel suggests, it's actually 2 different palaces joined together in to a single hotel. You can still detect this in the facade and some of the interior layout, but they've done quite a nice job making common areas spacious and quite opulent and combining what used to be two structures in to one large hotel. Venice is not cheap, and the same goes for this hotel. While pricey, though, I gathered it was comparable to other similar hotels nearby (if not even better priced in many respects). Our room was very spacious, had a canal view, though was somewhat sparsely appointed. No real work station or area, limited storage to unpack in to, but a comfy bed and a very nice bathroom. By all means, a pleasant room to stay in. A chilled Bellini bottle, complements of the hotel, welcomed us to our room upon arrival, along with fresh fruit and a friendly note from the manager. Throughout the stay, service was good. We did use the concierge a couple of times for suggestions and advice and they were quite helpful (it did seem that their first instinct was to suggest tours and activities for which the hotel would get a kickback or would make a little money on as well, but they were by no means pushy about this and whenever I inquired about alternates to those first suggestions, they were more than happy to oblige). We spent many a quiet moment out along the Grand Canal, sipping espresso at the hotel's cafe. Service there was great and very friendly, food was good, and the view could not be beat. Again, the hotel is very well-situated. It does not open directly up on to a busy walkway or crowded area, and the front door is in a quiet, small, quaint little piazza you must go down a couple winding and narrow walkways to get to. This was perfectly fine by us, though, as it felt like a nice respite and escape, yet no more than a very short (literally a minute or two, if even) stroll to more hustle and bustle (whatever hustle and bustle exists in Venice, that is!). St. Mark's is a very short stroll away, passing by tons of great shops and restaurants along the way. You can walk out of the hotel's front doors and go any direction, strolling down any walkway you choose, and be treated to beautiful sights and images. It was convenient to everything we wanted to see and do. I did use Starwood points to pay for our stay, so can't really comment on room pricing beyond saying that initial research suggested it was a great option, price-wise, for the location. Incidentals (food, drink, room service, and even laundry) were priced as expected. All in all, a very satisfying stay.l

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHill_9
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! The service in this hotel is exceptional! The food unbelieveable! and the location breathtaking! My congratulations to the hotel staff for ensuring our wedding celebrations in Venice was unforgettable I do not hesitate in recommending this hotel to travellers wanting to experience 5 star Venitian service!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Example of a Perfect Westin”
Reviews.Author: katesjourneys
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location, minutes away from San Marco, but in a quiet area on the canal. We made the reservation based on a special rate but wanted a room with a canal view. Westin instantly found not just a room, but a room with a huge balcony and breathtaking view, granted for more than we planned but well worth the price. The service was always available and helpful. the linens and bed nothing but the best. This hotel was so wonderful that we moved Westin to the top of our list as a hotel we will, cost allowing, stay in much more often. We did not see a business center but the first 15 minutes (often extended to 30) are free of charge on a computer in a small private room off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Same Old Story”
Reviews.Author: NoKidsWillTravel
Reviews.Content: If only they would fix their customer service! My review will likely perpetuate what seems to be a common occurrence in this forum over the past several years. I will complain about the attitude and poor service received at the front desk, the hotel management will reply to this review by apologizing, assuring me that this is not normal practice and that my valuable input will help them improve service and then many more reviews after mine will probably make the same comments, because based on my recent visit, the hotel has done nothing to improve service. This is really too bad, because the hotel's location can't be beat, right on the Grand Canal, a stones throw from San Marco and yet in an out of the way quiet spot. It would be hard to beat the bar and breakfast restaurant location, literally floating on the Grand Canal and the breakfast buffet was the best we had in Italy, you have to try the mango smoothie. We booked a Grand Canal View room for almost $900 CDN a night and received a small, but nice room but in a partial alcove with a full wall on one side of the window and a partial wall on the other which resulted in little more than a straight ahead view of the canal, there was no view up and down the canal, which was the greatest disappointment of the entire trip, especially since my travel agent tried several times to contact the hotel to ensure a view, but received no cooperation. From the moment we arrived, even before complaining about the room we were treated with disinterest and an underlying attitude that because we booked through a travel agent and not directly with the hotel, we were second-class citizens and our Starwood membership meant nothing. When we asked to be moved, I even offered to pay extra, a 5-minute discussion in Italian in the back room resulted in the hotel being suddenly and miraculously full. Itâ€™s really too bad they won't subject themselves to a much needed attitude adjustment because this is a great facility in a great location that could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great room”
Reviews.Author: sanjali22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to venice, vienna and prague. We stayed at the Westin Europa and were very very happy with the room. Our bags did not arrive with us and the hotel provided us with tooth paste, tooth brush and saving neccessities for the day. The next 2 days they followed up with the airline to get our bags to us. The bags finally arrived 2 days later. The room itself was very very nice. The bed was huge and could fit both of us and our 8 year old on it. The hotel is very very central and though pricey is toally worth it. We took a private taxi to go back to the airport and it picked us up form the hotel doorstep - - very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel But Could Use Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: SurfTwiceDaily
Reviews.Content: Best thing about the hotel is the location! Lobby and deck are amazing, rooms need some updating, definitely not upto a 5 star rating. More like a very nice 4 star. Used Starwood points and cash program, so great deal!!! Don't think the rack rate would be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Braindrain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We arrived by train and took the water buses. Unfortunately, there was some sort of competition going on so the water bus service was severely disrupted. We finally arrived at the San Marco Vallaresso station (the closest to the hotel) and found our hotel. The hotel is beside Hotel Bauer but you have to walk down the corridor towards Hotel Lisbona, take a right and then left. The signage to find the hotel was non-existent so we were lucky the gondola folks were quite helpful. Check-in was tortuous. There were about 3 people in line but the front desk people were severely understaffed. There is an overabundance of paper they need to fill out and then they usually personally escort you to your room. Problem is, that left a period of about 15 min where there was nobody at front desk. The lobby is incredibly luxurious and expansive. While walking towards the private boat dock, there's a huge sitting area to the right. My biggest surprise was that there were no shops in the hotel. I guess with all the high-end shops just outside, there probably isn't a need. As a SPG Platinum, I was upgraded to an unbelievable suite. Yes, we were personally shown the room by front desk. The E&R complex is made of several buildings so I got a room in the back building on the 7th (highest) floor. On this floor, there are only 3 suites that divide a 360 degree view. Luckily, I got the view facing the canal. The outdoor patio was large and had a sofa and table. We spent some time outside on the patio and it was great. Our sitting area was large and had 2 sofas with a coffee table. There was also a good-sized working desk. There was plenty of storage space for clothes. We had a large and comfy bed. The bathroom was large and luckily had a shower curtain. The shower head seems to have heavy hard water build-up so we couldn't get good water pressure. One funny thing is that both myself and my wife almost slipped in the bathtub. We never do that. Perhaps the type of enamel? The bathroom had Etro products which really seemed to matter to my wife. The towel rack was heated - nice touch. Given the nature of the rooms on my floor, noise was never a problem. For the TV, it states there's a Japanese channel but it never worked. It's small and not LCD so I was a little surprised. Internet was either 6 EUR/hr or 12 EUR/day, which is reasonable for Europe. The internet speeds were very decent. There was a free bottle of water every day but no bottle opener in the room. I had to call Service Express for it. On the topic of Service Express, I had to call them on 2 occasions. On the 2nd occasion, I had to call 4 times as nobody was answering the phone. The concierges were pretty good and asked what sites we had seen. Once known, they offered other suggestions. We did approach them for a free water taxi service to Murano. Of course, nothing is really free and we did pick up a piece at one of the glass factories. However, that piece was really nice and we were glad we went. We did go to Tiepolo Cafe - the hotel cafe that has the covered patio onto the Grand canal and beside the private boat dock. Yes, prices are expensive but service was excellent. Also, the view is priceless. Around the area, if you take a left once you hit the main drag, there was a nice little cafe that we went to most mornings. It's called "Snack - Gi Bar" and it had very decent prices with a good selection of pastries and sandwiches. There are 2 banks just across from the cafe - Banca Intesa and Deutsche Bank. For some unknown reason, my bank card wouldn't work with Deutsche Bank but worked fine with Banca Intesa. Around the San Marco Piazza area, just behind and to the left of the Basilica, we found a resto called Falciano. Prices were ok but food was superb. Honestly, we ate all over Venice but this was probably the best resto we found. Leaving for the airport, we decided to take the Alilaguna. It was pretty convenient as it was pretty close to the San Marco Vallaresso station. I strongly suggest to pay for the Linea Oro. It costs a bit more but there's only 1 stop at San Marco Zaccaria and it's straight to the airport. Because it costs a bit more, most people don't pay for it so there were only 3 couples on the entire boat! There was plenty of room for everyone. I mention this because it was just as fast as a water taxi. In fact, for most of the trip, there was a water taxi beside us who was going at the same speed. Lastly, I should mention Venice is a shopping paradise. It seems 99.9% of folks are there for sight-seeing. We found the stores had stocks for stuff that we couldn't find in Singapore, Vienna, Milan, and Paris. Overall, it seems one's experience highly depends on the room you get. This is my 2nd time to Venice and my previous hotel had tiny rooms. However, considering the experience I received, I was more than satisfied with my stay - even with the few glitches encountered. The service offered by front desk and the concierges cannot be faulted. I will definitely return the next time I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Traveler_100
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this Westin is the location -- it's just a few blocks off of St. Mark's Square in an upscale shopping district (Tod's, Ferragamo, Bottega Veneta, LV, etc all outside your door - my husband was less than thrilled about that!). Other than that, it's an average hotel. The room we got was very small - the bed took up most of the room, and I could barely open the closet door, which swung out. The bathroom was very large and luxurious by comparison, with it's own window, large marble countertop and towel warmer! As with all Westin's, the bed itself was great. We had a room tucked away from the hallway, so no sound issues, but as with all older hotels, I don't think the soundproofing is great. One thing to note is that they provide a large physical key (it's electronic, but made to look like an old-fashioned key), which you leave with the concierge each time you go out, and pick-up as you come in. Overall, it didn't really bother us, but it was a little annoying on days when we came in and out a lot. The service was okay -- the concierges answered all of our questions, but they gave the collective impression that we were disturbing them. One nice service touch was that they left a bottle of sparkling wine for us as a welcome gift, as we booked under my mother's name, who has stayed here in the past before. Definitely have a drink at the waterfront bar -- it's pricey, but great view and very relaxing. Overall the hotel was okay -- I realize European hotels are generally smaller, pricier, and older than American ones, so this one may be very representative. We used points to book the room, but if had to I pay on my own, I would still probably look for something for better value.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, nice hotel, not too friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Tomas N
Reviews.Content: Great location for Venice and the hotel building is very nice and Venice style. As we got particial canal view room, the room was great, airy, very relaxing and nicely designed. Recommend to have a drink at the bar, even the drinks are expensive, nice to watch the boats go by. As with any chain hotel, the staff was not very friendly and made me feel I bother them for any questions I might have. With all the training big hotel chains have at disposal it is sad to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Arrival by Water Taxi”
Reviews.Author: Familyof4MN
Reviews.Content: We stayed with cash and points. The rooms had views overlooking the rooftops of Venice. The location near St. Mark's Square was ideal for us since it rained all three days we were there. The hotel was able to accomdate our request for non-smoking rooms (all rooms at these hotels are non-smoking) that were advacent to one another. We were not surpirsed by the faint sewer smell as others rating this hotel mentioned it. The smell in one room was worse than the other - we opened the window and weren't bothered by it. The best part of the hotel was the location (since it rained) and the ability to arrive by water taxi - expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “gosh spoiled we were, amazing location for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rach68
Reviews.Content: My husband received our long weekend as a reward from our company. We stayed at this hotel with around 20 other winners and their partners. Arriving on a private taxi bus to the hotel jetty stepping onto the terrace, sun shining, champagne reception awaiting us. What a start. The hotel itself was fab, very expensive but all free for us so we relaxed and enjoyed taking in the sites of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: aar74
Reviews.Content: Although I have read a couple of bad reviews, I think its good location worths it as well as the service offered, which was excellent. Our room was more than big enough to add an extra-bed for a child. But do not expect a low price in Venice. Having a drink in its terrace facing the Canal Grande or just walking 2 minutes to Piazza San Marco was superb! I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “returning again”
Reviews.Author: scottsaz
Reviews.Content: On our last visit to Venice, we stayed at the Westin Europa and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We are SPG gold and were given a room overlooking the canal. What a wonderful sight! This hotel is beautiful and that's why we are returning in July. Our cruise ends there and this time we're bringing friends with us and using Cash & Points for both rooms. Maybe we'll get lucky again and get a room overlooking the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, Snobby and avoidable”
Reviews.Author: parag_parekh
Reviews.Content: Good Location and Rooms However was pricey as compared to others, quite snobbish on assistance and can be avoided as in venice you are hardly in the room and always on the canal.. also looks a bit old. many other better priced hotels in similar locations can be chosen.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for SPG”
Reviews.Author: MichiganPartyof5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin using cash and points. As others have said this is a good deal if not great. ($99US and 4500 points/night) As an SPG member our family was upgraded to a large room with a pull out sofa and king bed. The in-laws had a standard room next door with a shared entry way. This was an ideal set up. The girls thought our room was a castle with high ceilings, thick draperies, a bejeweled mirror and decorated headboards. The lobby was ornate and the front desk helpful on check in, each child received a Westin Kids travel pack. Although the water taxi is expensive (110Euro to/from the airport) I would recommend for a family as a way to make a memorable entrance from the Grand Canal. We arrived by Vaparetto and although the hotel is a short walk from the landing, kids/luggage/crowd/steps added complication. Location is great, get out early or late as tourist foot traffic peaks 10-4 and donâ€™t miss Piazza San Marco at night.

Reviews.Title: “A first class historic five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: marymont
Reviews.Content: We used Starwood points to book this hotel and found, to our delight that we were able to upgrade to a partial canal view with a surprisingly modest additional point charge. A sumptuous breakfast buffet served in the canal side restaurant is available for 1500 extra points per person. Our room was spacious, beautifully decorated with antiques and offered an almost direct view of Santa Maria Salute across the Canal. The bathroom was very large with a separate bath tub and double headed shower stall. The bed which was huge and incredibly comfortable came with a selection of down and foam pillows. The staff is universally gracious, helpful and friendly. Our check in took seconds and we were personally escorted to the room by a member of the front desk staff. The hotel itself is centrally located near St Marks but tucked away on a very quiet lovely square amazingly apart from all the tourist hubbub. It is hard to find, the first time so make sure that you have directions if you are coming to the hotel on foot. We booked Luisella Romeo as a private guide for a three hour tour of Venice's back streets which was the highlight of our visit. Luisella, a charming Venice native is a delight with an encyclopedic knowledge of the city. (:l.romeo@seevenice.it] I would also recommend a private water tour of Venice's canals with Penzo Gianluca penzo.gianluca@libero.it..

Reviews.Title: “Central location, elegant surroundings, decent rooms, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: wlfmn77
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed feelings on this hotel. I loved the location right on the Grand Canal and thought the little piazza the entrance opened up to was really quaint. The service was also incredibly friendly and attentive. The lobby was traditional and elegant, not my style, but very nice. We were given a room that was recently renovated and it was fine. The room size was adequate, bathroom was nice, and the bed was comfortable. We had a pretty terrible view, but at least it was quiet. The bar had a great view, but drinks were expensive. My biggest issue was the value. The only reason we booked this particular hotel was because I was able to get a decent concession on the room rate. Otherwise, I thought the hotel was very overpriced. I know that Venice is generally an expensive market, but the fact that this hotel is run more like an American chain than an independent Italian hotel hurts it in some ways. For instance, the fact that breakfast wasn't included in the rate, free internet wasn't offered, etc. Perhaps it's that the hotel is more geared towards the well-heeled clients, but charging for internet when you are already spending so much on the room seems petty. Either way, if you are looking for value, I would look elsewhere. If you're looking for elegance, other properties on the Grand Canal would be more worth the high cost.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: nycfashionlover
Reviews.Content: my first time in venice. nice shower, great location, spacious!!

Reviews.Title: “Viaggio eccellente”
Reviews.Author: FlyBird10
Reviews.Content: A perfect location and the room upgrade offered on arrival was worth every Euro. Room 612 made the holiday for us with a large terrace area on the sixth floor overlooking the Grande Canal and Salute (the sun shone every day). Our package was for three days plus an extra day, all inclusive of breakfast. We arrived by private taxi from Marco Polo - a superb way to arrive in Venice, via San Marco. Reception staff were courteous and friendly, showing both our original room (6th floor) and the upgrade option. The room was spacious with a comfortable and very large bed, all amenities you needed (tea and coffee making facilities are not allowed because of fire regulations in Venice), a large bathroom with double headed shower and twin dressing rooms. We had easy access to three lifts with no problems. Buffet breakfast provided plenty of choice with good quality service and wonderful location by the Grand canal. Staff were polite, helpful and efficient. Even better at the evening meal on the first night, though expensive the food was well presented, original and most enjoyable. Giving a rose at the end of the meal was a nice touch to round off a special meal. The ground floor shows the elegance of former palaces, carefully converted. The hotel is located close to San Marco but is quiet within, apart from the occasional singing of the gondoliers!!! Two Vaporetto stops are within 8 minutes (San Marco and Giglio) to whisk you around. Take time to visit different areas of Venice if you are there for a few days. We found Castello really authentic, quiet and a sense of Venetian life where very few tourists make time for this area. The trip to San Giorgio Maggiore is short and well worth the visit, where spectacular views of Venice await. Finally there are some great restaurants around Venice away from the tourist trails. Be prepared to spend time locating these along the complexity of the "calle" network. The concierge service was good and very helpful in plotting the locations of restaurants we were interested in. This was a wonderful short holiday and the memory of Venice will stay with us for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building -------poor customer service----I SLEPT ON THE SOFA”
Reviews.Author: ginanditaway
Reviews.Content: Arrived to check in at 12 noon ( early I know) was given a receipt for luggage and the porter came , We followed him to a storage room ( Silly me I thought that we were being shown to our room). Returned to reception to be told that the room would not be ready until 3pm so went off to do some sightseeing. Reurned to find the room still not ready so we sat on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. Eventualy got into the room around 4pm . NO COMMUNICATION ! We reached our 2nd floor room via the starirs --THE LIFT IS BROKEN (and has been for a long time ) Room was elegant, hallway, lounge area, bedroom and nice marble in the bathroom. THE BED WAS SO UNCOMPFORTABLE THAT I SLEPT ON THE SOFA IN THE LOUNGE FOR 3 NIGHTS! There were functions/conventions every day of our stay which meant that in the morning the terrace outside was reserved for the corporate guests, afternoon and evening these guests had a reception which dominated the bar/lounge area. The breakfast buffet is good , except for the dry pastries .The staff like to seat you ( not necesarily where you would like ). We also went to get more fruit juce and came back to find OUR TABLE HAD BEEN CLEARED. Reception staff and concierge are courtiously indifferent UNLESS YOU ARE A CORPORATE GUEST it seems. Summary is ; BAD COMMUNICATION, SERVICE, UNCOMPFORTABLE BED, BROKEN LIFTS NO TEA/COFFEE IN ROOM GOOD LOCATION DONT STAY THERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: HonestJohnUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a British Airways minibreak to Venice. The deal included 3 nights for the price of 2, and frankly I didn't expect much in terms of the room from this deal, expecting to be at the 'bottom end' of the E&R experience. We are familiar with Venice, and arrived at the hotel via Vaporetto without too much searching, although the entrance is a little off the beaten track (but signed). Check-in was easy and our BA voucher was accepted without a problem. We were shown to our 6th floor room by the check-in receptionist, a nice touch. Our room was superb - one of the best we've stayed in anywhere in the world. The main room was huge and sumptious, with tasteful furnishings, flat screen TV, sofa and chairs, mini-bar and huge bed. I was pleased to see that a big comfy Z bed for our 9 year old daughter had been installed and made up ( I've known hotels to fail that particular test). The room had a large balcony with table and chairs overlooking the Venice skyline. We had a partial view of the Grand Canal. The room had a separate dressing room and a massive marble bathroom, with twin sinks, snazzy double headed shower, robes and plentiful toiletries. Breakfast was included in our rate, and was a superb extensive buffet, taken each morning looking over the Grand Canal. Perfect. The communal areas of the hotel are beautiful, marbled affairs, and it well worth a look around the ground floor. Staff were at all times extremely polite and attentive. The hotel is convenient for San Marco and a couple of Vaporetto stops - Giglio and San Marco Valloressa. Don't be put off by the proximity to the crowds - they disappear as soon as you turn down the side alleys for the hotel. The only downside to the E&R is the staggering price of additional items. We paid 10 Euros for each minibar beer, and a staggering 149 Euros for room service the first night which apart from a bottle of wine, was a simple affair (but beautifully presented on a wheeled table brought to our room). We had lunch on the terrace on our departure day; 2 sandwiches, a couple of beers and coffees - 100 Euros!! Sure, we knew the cost, but I've never experienced prices like these! However, the stay was so special that the withering prices were soon forgotten. If you can stay here, do so. It is memorable. And if you can afford to arrive/depart by water taxi, at the E&R's own jetty, do that as well. It is all part of the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, average room”
Reviews.Author: CA_Jayhawk
Reviews.Content: With such a perfect central location, who cares that the rooms aren't as nice as you might expect from a Westin? There's really nothing wrong with the rooms, just a little run down. I took the water taxi directly from the airport to the hotel's dock â€“ what a treat. It's wonderful to sit in the hotel's Grand Canal bar, and watch the world go by. One thing to note: On the Starwood website, only some of the rooms are listed as non-smoking. When I looked, the non-smoking room was over 100 euro more. I gambled, and booked the lower cost room, hoping for an upgrade. When I arrived, I discovered that ALL the rooms are non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location on the Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: etshih
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband for 3 nights at the Westin. The location is the best feature of this hotel, on the water with nice outdoor seating. We enjoyed a drink there watching the boats and gondolas better than on the Square, which is only a five minute walk away. We took the vaporetto in from the train station and only walked 2 blocks to the hotel. When we left, we took the vaporetto that goes to the airport, it was only a short distance as well. We stayed using Starwood points and the room was standard, but they upgraded to us so that we had a view of the canal if we stepped outside on the very small balcony. My husband used the fitness center every day which was nicer than the other hotels we had stayed at so far. There was a charge for internet, but the concierge let guests use their computer for free for a fifteen minute slot to print airline boarding passes, etc . which was very helpful. The staff and concierge were excellent and the location perfect, a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: LyricJen
Reviews.Content: We were torn between Danieli vs. this hotel... We had a bit of a tough time finding it after getting off the Airport waterboat. The hotel was tucked in from the main street. I love this hotel! It's literally on Grand Canal overlooking the other side of the canal and it was just most romantic. The bar had yummy drinks... Overall, everything was on the upscale side. Our room was quite big with downstairs bathroom. Our bathroom was covered with marble slabs.... it was quite exquisite! This is what I expected of this hotel and it met my need. The only issue (funny that others mention it also) is that concierge staff were somewhat uptight and not as friendly and accommodating. Other than that, you get what you pay for.... amazing hotel, amazing location, and amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING terrace....great hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: SG77
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at the Westin Europa and Regina - we paid for a Grand Canal view room and use "points and cash" for the other room. Our room in the Regina building had a terrace almost as large as the room directly on the grand canal - it was absolutely gorgeous! It had a table with four chairs and two lounge chairs. Other than the suite next door, no other room facing the grand canal (in any hotel, as far as we could tell) had a terrace this beautiful and large. Our son's room which was next to ours, was a standard double and was very nice although it didn't have a view. Overall our experience at the hotel was perfect - I can't imagine anything better at the Danieli or the Gritti Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Westin with old world charm in a great location”
Reviews.Author: uvagrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europa and Regina during the first week of March 2010. We had adjoining rooms in the Tiepolo building. We got a very good rate, so I'm assuming that these were the least expensive rooms at the hotel, but they were still very nice. The rooms weren't huge, but they were pretty close to a standard American size hotel room at a Westin or similar chain. Since the buildings are old, the rooms aren't exactly uniform in size, which adds to the charm. Lovely murano glass chandeliers, great view of the Grand Canal, very nice marble bathrooms with separate bath and shower, all the standard Westin amenities. The hotel was a nice blend of Westin standards and the uniqueness associated with the location in older Venetian buildings as opposed to new construction. Lovely public areas, workout room, nice staff, 5 minutes from St. Mark's square, great location on the Grand Canal- all in all a great experience! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Venice at its best, IF you get a good room”
Reviews.Author: GreenMermaid
Reviews.Content: It is interesting that many hotels, when you pay with points, try to stick you with a lesser quality room. As I see again and again in these reviews, the lesson is that you must prevail and (courteously) request a different room. This experience was no exception, as we used Starwood points to book. The desk clerk personally showed us to our room, which â€“ though we had booked an upgraded partial canal view â€“ had a view of a flat tar-paper roof and a strongly stale, wet carpet smell. We were surprised that she did not seem to notice the smell of the room. I asked if there was another option, with a view of something other than a roof, since we had after all booked a partial canal view. After bringing us back to the lobby and checking, she found another room for us. This one was a huge improvement over the first, and we were quite pleased. It evidently was a handicapped-accessible room, as it had a second shower in the very huge bathroom, and had more open area in the bedroom area. We thought that they must keep this room available in the event someone needed it; but we were staying only 2 nights and it was not the height of the season (late April). We were glad that they gave us use of it for our time here. That said, it had a straight-on view of the grand canal, but from a building set back between two other buildings, sort of a corridor-type view. There were two small step-out balconies in the main room, and two in the bathroom that faced into a courtyard with views of pretty terra-cotta roofs. There was also a small separate room upon entrance that was a dressing area with closet and cabinets. The bathroom really was huge, with an accessible shower (curtain around an open area), as well as a regular tub shower with dual shower heads, and twin sinks. We printed the directions to the hotel from the website and had no problems finding it. If you take the regular Alilaguna ferry from the airport, you will have to hoist your luggage over one small bridge before you get to the hotel. There is also a private dock for water taxi arrival that looked like a very nice way to arrive at the hotel. It was sunny weather so we didnâ€™t mind the 1 hour 20 minute regular ferry ride. The reception and common areas of the hotel are full of lavish baroque elegance, which was a lovely way to imagine Venice in its heyday.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: k1w1brad
Reviews.Content: Great Location Great views and Easy to get to. Walk in to the room and we had our own little hallway with table and chair. I so didnâ€™t expect this in Venice as a lot of places we have stayed at when there were quite small. One room was nice and big with coffee tables and chairs, the other was half the size but ok for one person. A separate lounge area and large bathroom. As usual with the starwood hotels we have stayed at, brilliant service, great sleep, very easy check in and great staff. Price â€“ you get what you pay for and that was loads of space and great views across the canal. Short walking distance to Piazza San Marco. This would be the second best if not equal Number 1 hotel I have stayed at in Venice. The other one we stayed at we had our own roof top terrace with a view of the Basilica and Tower. Happy to stay here again but will probably check out some other hotels around the square to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, shame about the Concierge staff”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTracey
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as I used tripadvisor to check on hotels and restaurants, thanks the reviews were spot on. We stayed at the Westin Regina Europa for four nights from 24th of Dec till the 27th 2009 and would not hestitate to recommend the hotel, if you are looking for a romantic time in this beautiful city. We had a room on the Grand Canal and the room was beautiful and the view perfect, we had 2 small balconies and my husband would get coffee sent up each morning and would stand on the balcony watching the Gondolier's get ready for the day. It was like living someone elses life! We booked the room well in advance on a deal with Starwood "pay 3 get 4 nights". Breakfast however was not in the tariff, but we had breakfast most days in the hotel as the restaurant was beautiful and again a view of the Grand Canal, this was an extravagance but the staff only charged us for what we had, so instead 60 euro it was generally about 35 euros each. It is a great experience if you can run to it. The staff in hotel were all very good, of course there is always an exception and the Concierge staff were the exception "useless". I emailed prior to our arrival in Venice and asked them to give me some suggestions and what was on over christmas. I would have thought that they had a standard email with links for different sites, events,tours and customised it to the time of year....oooohhh no... I got an email back aking me to email them closer to the date and they may have something for me, to add insult to injury i booked a musical evening "an opera in a plazzo" and when we asked for direction they told us they could have booked for us. They were really second rate at this first class hotel. I did find and book a guide with no thanks to the hotel and I would highly recommend her she is fourth generation Venetian Luisella Romeo her email is [--] ..she tailored the tour to our requirements and we were both delighted this really added to our experience of the Venice. Each night we had a drink in the bar and the staff were really good also free WIFI in the bar. So in summing up booked it , it is great but do your homework and you will have a fantastic stay in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “the renovated section is up to par, not the old one”
Reviews.Author: luaidahlan
Reviews.Content: we wanted a room over looking the canal for our honeymoon, we got a room with no view but the room was nice.. (what you expect from westin) lets start from below. service people at the front desk were friendly, it was hard for me to comunicate with some of them and tell them what i want in English (English is my second language) Check in was fast, the concierge is ok.. though i felt that as if the hotel had some deals with local restaurants... the hotel recomended Ristorante Do Forni for our first dinner in Venice but the restaurant was poor, and couldnt find a single person dining there at 8pm while nearby restaurants are busy and it looked shady so we did not go... (the hotel was very pushy about this restaurant) We stayed in the renovated section for the first day but with no view (junior suite). The room quality and cleanliness was great but the view was 0 out of 10. then we were transfered to the hotel old section with old elevators and extreme classic room design (which was not what i was looking for during my honey moon) but the view was a killer (amazing) and the balcony is huge enough to seat 4-6 people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Epicurian_Monaco
Reviews.Content: During a romantic escapade, we stayed two nights in this trully excellent Hotel. The room was very large and comfortable, large marble bathroom with shower and bathtub, and with a great view on the Grand Canal, San Giorgio Maggiore and the new modern art museum of the Punta della Dogana. Service was impecable, and the different Concierge taking shifts were all of them a great help to secure tickets for Opera, advice for non-tourists restaurants, provide water taxi transportation negotiating prices on our behalf, etc. etc. Room service was very fast and efficient. Will go back. They were great to ensure that we had a fantastic stay there.

Reviews.Title: “the palace of palaces!”
Reviews.Author: telis
Reviews.Content: wonderful,amazing,marvellous,grand,beautiful,atmospheric,venician splendour,elegant,fantastic,once in a lifetime experience...i could written even more but let me tell you our unique experience in this magnificent hotel. we arrived by water taxi and imediatelly two porters came to help us with our luggages and the concierge to welcome us.we felt like royalty to tell you the truth!inside the lobby is very grand like a fairytale.it is large all marble with exquisit furnitures.check-in was welcoming and professional.we used starwood program cash and points for our stay and even though we had booked the standard room we were upgraded without asking to a grand deluxe room in the regina part of the hotel.the room was fantastic.we could not ask for more!pure elegance and style.it had a large hall before entering the room where the closet was located.the bathroom was marble, very large and luxurious with very stylish taps, fluffy towels,bathrobes ,hair dryer,and the usual bathroom amenities.the heavenly shower was trully heavenly.the water power was very good.the lights were murano and had practically mirrors everywhere.the room was like you were in a palace and not in a hotel.it had tapestry all over the walls, rich fabrics for curtains and thick beautiful and very clean carpet.there was a mini bar, a lcd-tft t.v. set with internet connection and many amenities(t.v. channels ,music, films on demand etc).the bed was very comfortable-one bed pushed to the other to form a king but you could not understand where was the gap between them cause there was not a gap!i don't know how they managed to do so but they did!the lightning in the room was plenty and everyday it was very good cleaned. we had a view to the europa part of the hotel and also you could see a bit of the grand canal.it was a very quiet room -you were feeling as the only guest in the hotel!room service was excellent.when we returned from our first day in venice in the room a chilled bellini bottle was waiting for us along with fruits complimentary! the only not so good was that there was no complimentary coffee and tea making facilities where usually in most 5 star hotels in europe you can find such service.the corridors were again with tapestry and thick carpet.the elevator which we used had beautiful painted doors. the bar was an experience by itself.very attentive staff and impecable service.we had a club sandwich with our drinks and it was very tasty.it had live piano music and a very relaxing and stylish ambience.the concierges were always very polite and with the best of information about everything.the front desk staff was excellent and in general everybody in the hotel tried to do their best to please you.the location is the best. definatelly THIS IS THE PLACE to stay in venice if you want a trully memorable experience.if in venice again this hotel will be our home away from home! surely the manager knows his job and do wonders.

Reviews.Title: “Disapponting Westin in Venice”
Reviews.Author: rwingate
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Europa & Regina in Venice for 3 nights. Overall I was disappointed. The only good thing about this hotel was the location. The hotel is actually 3 hotels haphazardly put together. Every hallway we walked was very run down. I mean marks on the walls and uneven floors - very strange for a Westin. In fact this was unlike any Westin I have ever stayed in. And I stay at Westins at least 40 nights a year. The staff (front desk) were pretty rude but overall Italy is not know for customer service- so this was not surprising I guess. The first room we were shown was a one bedroom suite. We were upgraded because I am a Platinum Starwood member. This room was a joke. It was hot pink and green. It was so bad I told the desk I couldnt stay there. In fact we asked for a regular room with no upgrade. It was that bad. The service in the bar was below par. In fact it was right up there with most of the sub standard service we received while in Venice. I would not stay here again. The only thing that reminded me it was supposed to be a Westin was the green leaf hand soap and the regular Westin bathroom amenities. Other than that it was such a disappointment !!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel, Gracious Staff”
Reviews.Author: Graces
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five night stay and can't say enough good things about this hotel. Travelling alone and in the winterseason, I wanted to be in a hotel with beautiful public areas so, if it was rainy or cold in the evenings, I could enjoy being "out" but in! The desk staff greeted me very warmly and while they gave me a single room as I'd booked, it had a fantastic view of the Grand Canal - which I don't really think was in my price level. They sent up a bottle of Bellini and bowl of fruit and made me feel totally welcome. The room was small but with a large bed and every convenience. All the heavenly bed features - and a shower with incredible water pressure. I was surprised at the quietness. Because it is down a side street and right on the canal, there just isn't the sound of foot traffic at night. Usually in Venice, in those very quiet late hours, I could hear people walking, whistling and talking all night. Here so removed from foot traffic, I only heard the gondola covers snapping in the wind. The staff helped me see the possibilities to use my Starwood points for special things like drinks in the Tiepolo Bar and the gorgeous breakfast buffet that I might not have considered. Can't recommend highly enough ending day of sightseeing in this cozy bar. Wood-paneled, wonderful jazz on the sound system, and right on the Canal, little bowls of olives and nuts - wrote in my journal every late afternoon here and it was perfect. Also extremely impressed with how the staff handles the high water - no inconvenience for guests. It was very high for a few hours on Monday but marvelously handled. Twice, the desk sent someone to walk me to my room at alternate way to avoid the water. This is a gorgeous place with caring and creative staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: chisistas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of many grand old European hotels. The lobby and public spaces (restaurant) are BEAUTIFUL, very grand and elegant. The hotel is actually 5 buildings, and I believe we were in the Regina building, which definitley needs a facelife. The decor was outdated and showed major signs of wear and tear, although the room was spacious with a large closet (we were told we were given "very nice rooms" so not sure if it was the standard we booked for or what") They still have the old, hard key system you leave at the concierge desk on the way out, and this was just handed back to us without any id check at return, which concerned me a little (since the concierge was always changing). With the dollar so low the bar and food prices were outrageous (they're already expensive) although we did enjoy the bar for a few drinks. I didn't get to check out any amenties. The location is very good for Venice, although Venice is small anyway and it's not hard to be close to everything, but a bit difficult to find if you're not looking. We didn't get a view but the hotel is right on the water. We took the public water bus in (13 euro) and walked to the hotel (about 5 minutes) Very easy to navigate but know where you're going! We did need assistance last minute as our plans changed, and the desk was VERY helpful with calling another hotel in a different Italian city to change our accomadations, which would have been very difficult for us. Internet is not free anywhere in the hotel and not cheap, and there are no obvious internet cafes in the area so plan for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: dannycarlucci
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and have basically have only nice things to say about it. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is right on the Grand Canal and very close to Piazza San Marco. The hotel itself is beautiful, but a bit frayed at the edges in some spots. There were some marks on the wall in the room, and scratches on the woodwork in parts of the hotel. However, the layout of the room was great. There is a separate little room with a sit down vanity attached to the bathroom. Very roomy. My only complaint about the room was that it was very warm. The weather was warm for November and the air-conditioning had been shut off, not uncommon for Europe. The staff, for the most part, were attentive and helpful. The front desk, key desk, bellmen, and concierge were all excellent. The only place that the service was lacking was at breakfast. It took several tries and too much time just to get a cup of coffee. However, the breakfast buffet itself was amazing. So much good food. Overall, I thought that the hotel was great and would highly recommend it to others. I would also stay here again on a return trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Europa & Regina is truly as beautiful as it looks!”
Reviews.Author: MarieTess
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Italy for our 2 year anniversary with Venice being our last stop. After the long train ride from Florence to Venice we were a little worse for the wear and wanting to take a quick rest before we dove into the beautiful sites of Venice. Immediately upon arrival to the Venice train station we hopped onto the vaporetto for the 45 minute scenic cruise to the the San Marco stop. **TIP: If you're looking for a leisurely and inexpensive cruise down the grand canal, I definitely recommend hopping onto the vaporetto. For just 6.5 euros per person you're able to avoid the expensive commute to the hotel and relax and take in your first glimpse of Venice's mysticism.** After hopping off at San Marco (last stop) you're just a 4 minute walk to the back entrance to the hotel. You may feel a little leary at first since you're walking through dark alleys and narrow passageways but once you enter the hotel and arrive in your HUGE and luxurious suite any of those concerns fade away. Checking into the hotel was fabulous and quick. Although their keys aren't meant for the ladies wearing slim jeans. (Keys are attached to a tassle versus the electronic cards). **TIP: the exchange rate from US to Euro was actually the best we could find in town, so consider changing your dollars there. ** Going into our hotel room we were pleasantly surprised of how spacious our suite was. King sized bed, flat screen, dual vanities, separate changing room, heated towel rack, etc ... all the comforts of home! The location for the hotel was great! As I mentioned earlier we were only a short 4 minute walk from the San Marco stop for the Vaparetto. The front entrance looks out directly into the Grand Canal making it for a scenic and easy pick up for your private transfers or taxis. 5 minutes away from San Marco Piazza and their cafes and stores, and 10 minutes away from your customary Rialto Bridge photo. I highly recommend this fabulous hotel to any and all looking for a comfortable, luxurious and romantic getaway in Italy's most Romantic city. Enjoy! ... As my final TIP ... make sure you book the breakfast with them it was a wonderful buffet!

Reviews.Title: “It's Where You Want to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mkg623
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! It's on the Grand Canal. We got upgraded from a partial view room to full view room. We were able to walk on a little platform (smaller than balcony) in front of our window and watch the Canal. Incredible!! The room was big, the bathroom was all marble. The location was a few blocks from St. Mark's Square. It's right where you want to be. Keep in mind that an advantage to hotel chains like Westin over Inns in Europe is that the chains have more American TV, American movies on pay per view, etc. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: riskfrea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay if you are single or a couple but not with children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; Excellent partial view”
Reviews.Author: ccheezee
Reviews.Content: The Good Less than 5 minutes walking distance from Piazza San Marco (St. Mark's Square). That alone is worth a lot. Our room had a partial view of the Grand Canal which is priceless in itself. The room was a large size compared to European hotels. Our room had a double bed fused together. Unfortunately we weren't staying too long. Wall to wall carpet with a tapestry type of fabric on the walls. No detail spared for the crown molding in the room. Gives you the feel of an upper end hotel. You pay a hefty sum for hotel accomodations in Venice but this place helps to justify what you are paying. The entryway and hallways to the restaurant are adorned with paintings, sculptures and other artwork that describes Venice and the glasswork from nearby Murano. Architecture is excellent throughout the hotel. I would love to come back here. Bathroom in room is spacious, adorned with granite and more shower and bath spiquets than us Americans are use to. A safe was in the room as well. Great service as well. Banquet room were available and in use. The Not So Good Although near Piazza San Marco, it is not the easiest place to find. Near the Vaparetto (Water Bus) stop next to the main Vaparetto stop for Piazza San Marco. Gondola are parked nearby and the hotel can arrange a water taxi if needed. Take the Vaparetto, it's cheaper. If I didn't see the sign pointing to the alleyway, I wouldn't have found the place. However most places in Venice for the first time traveller is not easy to find. Easy to get lost in the Hotel. Make sure you pay attention when they are showing you the room. Also noticed some mildew in the bathroom just above the shower (not much, just a little). It is average to pay at least $300 a night in Venice so factor that in your budget and this place is no exception. Fortunately our travel points took care of our stay. Not to many negatives overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with unmatchable breakfast terrace”
Reviews.Author: ChristianK
Reviews.Content: After a long weekend stay with perfect weather and visits I have left this hotel with some mixed feelings. The room was definetely not worth the money, it was outdated and had a very, very humid smell....prices from the mini bar were even high for Italy (â‚¬10 a bottle of water), we had a direct view on a wall. Nevertheless the hotel is in a wonderful location and has one of the nicest terraces for breakfast (â‚¬50!)I have experienced so far, really stunning. The facilities of the hotel are great, arriving from the airport with a water taxi is really worth it. From what I have seen in Venice the hotel standard is not very high compared to other places. But, I would go back to this place asking for a nicer room and it would be for sure a unique stay.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Mostly Bad”
Reviews.Author: bhmermaid
Reviews.Content: The good first. The room was lovely with a view of the canal. The only problem with the room is it was a handicap room, which we didn't realize until using the bathroom. The toilet was so high that my feet couldn't touch the ground. The floor level open shower spilled water all over the marble floors consequently it was very slippery. The beds were extremely hard. The reason we chose the Westin was because of the reliable beds. I complained and they told me the room had just been renovated and this is the new "Heavenly Bed". We had to pile quilts on top of the mattress to sleep. Even then my body hurt every time I would roll over. When we checked into the room there were only hand towels and no bath towels or wash clothes. We thought they would be provided at turn down service. However, they did not do a turn down service that particular night in our room. Called housekeeping and they delivered towels around 11:00 pm and said couldn't deliver wash clothes as they were locked up. The buffet breakfast included in our package was poor. The pre-cooked scrambled eggs were cold, the bacon and sausage were sitting in about an inch of grease and a slim bakery selection. The rooms where they served breakfast were charming with a canal view. The waiters were not very friendly but also not rude. The concierge were not very helpful. They seemed very bothered when you asked a question. The desk clerks and bell men were friendly and helpful. The manager sent a small fruit plate to the room with his apologies for the problems we encountered. The public spaces in the hotel are lovely and well decorated. The location is good. However could not recommend this hotel until it is better managed.

Reviews.Title: “Location great...Service needs improvement...”
Reviews.Author: Armorstud
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with some of the previous reviews about the staff.Â Â Yes, it is a great location plus the hotel itself is very elegant with all the marble floors.Â Â We are starwood members also. We were upgraded to a King room. I had originally booked the room with a single bed online (first time in Italy) and when I checked out they wanted to charge me an extra $465 Euro for my wife staying with me since I originally booked a single bed but yet was upgraded to a King for two.Â Â Anyway, I had to argue with the staff about this upon checkout.Â Â Put that aside, I do agree that the staff was sub-par when dealing with requests.Â Â If you need anything to the room, it takes a while for it to get there (unlike the Fabulous Park-Hyatt in Milan).Â Â The shower has no pressure, the temp control system did not work, and the toilet was broke. Besides that, the room was fine and beds were comfty. The staff at the front desk and concierge were not that friendly or overly helpful. Tip: If you are looking for a SPG hotel, I don't know if it is good but Hotel Danieli is near this hotel (5 min walk) but in front of the water-bus location which is cheaper than the water taxi (70-90 Euro).Â Â Also if you go off the popular main drags, the restaurants are cheaper with the same menu.

Reviews.Title: “A nice option for pricey Venice”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFast
Reviews.Content: Ciao! I booked a single room (4-foot double can fit a couple if needed). Room was teeny & not as sleek as U.S. Westins--however the bed was comfy and the room is decorated in traditional Venetian style with striped fabric walls and a Murano glass chandelier. Bathroom is large with a full-size tub and great shower. Weather was hot and humid--when I arrived in my room the AC was already on and it was nice and cool, which I greatly appreciated after 14 hours of traveling! The check-in staff were great and showed me to my room. Be sure to bring directions to the hotel from other Trip Advisor reviewers or the hotel. I got a terrific travel industry discount, but the hotel was full due to cruise ship crowds so sadly I had to change hotels after my first night. I highly recommend this hotel for its location and comfort, especially if you get a good rate (< $300 USD) or have points for a free night. I wouldn't pay $600 per night since it's not luxurious, but at the right price it's a lovely, quiet hotel with a very nice staff. (My only complaint is the internet computer in the business center/lobby was very slow and quite expensive.) **Also look for AAA or Senior Discounts, which offered the lowest rates.** Enjoy a glass of wine or bellini from the deck of the small bar overlooking the Grand Canal at night (again, pricey but enjoy the experience.) I've been to Venice 5+ times and would definitely recommend this hotel if you can get a decent price (Venice hotels are very expensive and often have worn old-world decor). In Venice I also recommend the Italian hotel brand "Starhotels Spendid Venice", which has a contemporary-meets-Venetian flair and is my favorite (very pricey too depending on season--September is particularly popular/pricey..) Enjoy Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Comfortable Room, Somewhat Neglected”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveler007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in October toward the end of a 2 week vacation in Eastern Europe. The hotel is very nice, in an excellent location a few blocks from Piazza San Marco. It took a little searching to find the hotel, but with the help of some friendly shop owners we managed. Our check-in experience was sub-par, but we suspect that's because those managing the reception desk were more interested in chatting with the suit wearing business travelers and shuffling papers than assisting us jean-wearing travelers. We we expected high quality service at this hotel, but the receptionists at the SPG desk basically ignored us for several minutes while shuffling papers around the desk. Once they decided to greet us they were somewhat friendly but definitely did not provide the level of service we would receive at other Starwood properties, such as a St. Regis, for example. Our room was nice, large, had a comfortable bed with good quality sheets, had a nice view of the canal, and had everything we needed for our short visit. The room had fun photographs and a Venetian glass chandelier. The bathroom, while very nice, was definitely warn and in need of attention. The wallpaper was peeling off the bathroom walls and the wall chandeliers were sort of falling off the wall. Overall, this is a nice, fairly large, hotel in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “great location,worst continental beakfast ever and i HAVE travelled”
Reviews.Author: julai1
Reviews.Content: it really was a tale of two halves,the room was spacious but without a canal view but there is no point paying top dollar for a canal view room when the hotel has such a lovely terrace bar.We found the concierge very helpful and most staff but we had a nightmare experience with a waiter at breakfast,never before have i had a waiter turn his back on me and pretend that i don't exist,so i continued to talk to him and he answered me with his back turned to me and then walked off, now i am a seasoned traveller and have NEVER been so insulted in a top hotel .. and on top of that they charge 30 euros per person for the worst Continental breakfast that i have ever had,52 euros if u fancy a fry up ???!!! Apart from that we had a good time,be prepared to get your cash out,shops close to the hotel are very upmarket,shop assistants will love you and then hate you if you don't pay exorbitant prices,we just laughed and said arrivederci.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lddelmar
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The location was perfect- just a stone's throw away from Piazza St. Marcos. Our room was huge and had a terrific view overlooking the Grand Canal. The breakfast is quite expensive, but had a great view of the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grand Canal view”
Reviews.Author: Abbie129
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our Med. cruise. My husband, brother and sister-in-law were sharing some wine on our canal-front balcony when we saw the Ruby Princess going past on her way to dock. Our cruise started the next day. Our hotel was the perfect place to spend a night before our cruise. The staff was wonderful, the view was outstanding and the room was almost perfect. We had a small problem with the air conditioning but we were in Venice so who cared!!!! We had the buffet breakfast the next morning. Juice, wonderful Italian coffee, breads, eggs, fruits, yogurt, everything you can imagine. It was great and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Hard to Find from the Street”
Reviews.Author: happycamper7058
Reviews.Content: The first time we arrived at the hotel was via water taxi which was easy. Trying to find it from the street sides was confusing - at least the first few times. That's about the only negative thing we can say about this lovely hotel very close to Piazza San Marco and everything else you want to walk to. Having breakfast on the Grand Canal on a sunny day starts your day on a positive note. Our room was upgraded from a street view to a canal view because we used Starwood points to pay for one night. Room was lovely, service great.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room 269”
Reviews.Author: s.h.
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last October to celebrate our Silver Wedding anniversary on 22/9/2009 and we stayed for 6 nights from the 18th to the 24th. I think our big mistake was not booking with the hotel direct as we were punished with room 269 which had squashed bugs on the walls,broken furniture and best of all, a wall only 12 inches from the window which covered 3/4 of the glass! I haven't ever broken the law but I felt like a convict in that room! Apparantly it was not possible to move us to another room until the Monday, despite the fact that people checked in after us and on Saturday too. On Monday we were moved to a very nice room, but the whole thing left a very nasty feeling. I'm incredibly envious of those reviews that talk of flowers, chocolates and Prosecco. Despite being assured by email before arrival that they would "take very special note" of our anniversary, we received nada. Perhaps they felt liberation from the dundgeon was enough! Yes, breakfast on the Grand Canal was wonderful but quite a few hotels offer that too. We can't usually afford 5 star hotels and had saved hard for our trip. I wish we hadn't stayed here and returned to the Monaco and Grand instead. To conclude, not only would I not recomend room 269, but I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in venice, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during a trip to France and Italy. I booked the room using points plus cash for a great rate so I was kind of preparing for a bad room- I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived to be upgraded to a suite! The hotel is very nice and they show you around at check in, which is great since it is large. Our room was very nice- very clean and spacious. my only complaint is that we could not see the TV from the bed, but that wasn't a big deal. The bathroom was heavenly as expected of westin baths. We used the gym and found the equipment good. The concierge was great- he gave us great tips for dinners, train tickets, etc and booked our early morning water taxi. Check out was simple. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you can get the great starwood deal!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Kakes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Hotel Europa & Regina for 3 nights using Starwood points. From the train station, we took the #2 water bus to the San Marco stop. The water bus was the perfect introduction to Venice. We saw a lot of sights along the way. We arrived @ the San Marco stop approx. 30 mins later. I got directions to the hotel from a review here on TripAdvisor and it was perfect! (see below) We arrived at the hotel and checked in. We were supposed to have a partial canal view room but was immediately upgraded to an executive room without us having to ask. The receptionist was gracious, and even walked us to our room and did a walkthrough with us, where we had a bottle of champagne and a tray of grapes waiting. The room was perfect! It had a huge heavenly bed, lots of space, a small balcony overlooking the courtyard, sofa, desk, flat screen tv, spacious bathroom with double headed shower, 2 sinks, etc., and the ac worked great. The staff was always courteous and helpful. The hotel is fabulous and the location is great...only a 5 minute walk to St. Mark's square. I would definitely stay there again on my next visit to Venice! Directions from San Marco water bus stop (as given by a previous tripadvisor user that I can't seem to find on here now): As you leave the stop, turn left slightly into Calle Vallaresso. Walk to the end of the Calle Vallaresson and turn left. Keep walking until you pass the church of St. Moise on your left where you will see a bridge and many gondolas. Cross over the bridge, turn left immediately and walk straight into what looks like a dark archway to Hotel Lisbona (the canal is now on your left). There is a sign to Anastasia Hotel above you, follow that sign, make a short right turn then left turn and you will see a sign for Europa. Follow that sign to the courtyard of a faded pinkish drape looking building which is the hotel. Alternatively, just after you cross the bridge, 2 blocks on your left , look up and you will see a faded brass sign that says Regina and Europa. Follow that sign.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Comfort”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldGem
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the other reviews, I was worried that as a Starwood member, I would be treated less than a "regular" customer. I was surprised to learn that is not the case. Nicola, the hotel agent, treated me really nicely. He even gave me a personal tour of the hotel facilities before sending me on my way to my room. He was also nice and offered me one of the newly remodeled rooms. The room is small, but for Venice, I think it is appropriate. The king-sized bed was "heavenly" and luxurious to say the least. There was an in-room safe and the bathroom was oppulent, with two generous bath robes (most places I have been only offer one despite the number of guests in the room). The room key to the hotel room is a tribute to old world with its unique key chain and tassle (see photo). I did not have a view from my room (430), but that did not bother me. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. it is 5 mins walk to the St Mark's Piazza, and 2 mins walk to major shopping areas. If you have never been to Venice, finding the place can be daunting. The directions on their web site (http://europa.hotelinvenice.com/location.html) is actually the much longer route. If you are taking the Alilaguna public water transportation, Instead of "San Zaccaria" boat stop, take the "San Marco" stop. when you get off the boat, walk straight through the path (on your left as you get off the boat) until you hit an intersection and turn left. Walk straight (pass Prada and other such shops) until you come to a Piazza. Cross the bridge and immediate turn left and walk straight. You will see Hotel Lisbona, take a right and then left until you come to the end of the path. Take a right and you will see the hotel. Don't expect to find street signs in Venice. I have attached a map for you to find it easier.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TwoInParadise
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay, however we felt that the hotel was overpriced compared to comparable hotels. For the price, a complementary airport shuttle would have been nice. We skipped the breakfast buffet due to the 50 euro per person price tag. The hotel was however in an excellent location and we were able to walk to a nice cafe on the other side of St. Mark's. The room was nice and big, and the bathroom was great. The staff was helpful and recommended an excellent and quite reasonable restaurant for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: watty77
Reviews.Content: Arrived by speed boat from the airport to the superb Westin ( what a way to travel) It was our 25th wedding anniversary treat & we couldnt have asked for more. The hotel was stunning & the staff were the best. Our room over looked the Grand Canal & we had complimentary chilled prosecco & sweets delivered to our room on arrival ! The hotel is a stunning Italian Palace & is just breath taking. We had a lovely breakast with champayne on the balcony with all the sights & sounds of the Grand Canal & Venice next to us . Simply a magical place to be !!!!!!!! I cant reccomened this place too strongly ~~ Dont hesitate just go ! I The hotel & the exprience I will remember all my life . The hotel is well placed not far from St Marks sq & a visit to all the tiny shops bars & eateries is a most. Behind the hotel is a shop that sells all sorts of gloves ~ I am now the very proud owner of some beautiful kid leather ones they are so soft they feel like silk. Thanks go to all the staff ~ they gave us a magical stay XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Thankyou to all the lovely & helpful staff at the hotel XXXXXXXXXXXXX

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL WONDERFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Dalsemer
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Venice is quite a unique experience. After driving from Florence and finally ditching our Rent-A-Car (more on that later), we took a private water taxi from the Venice Rail station (the central dropping off point) to the beautiful Westin Europa and Regina at a cost of 60 Euro. This is a jaw dropping ride, as no matter what image you had in your mind as to what the canals would be like, actually being in the canals is an experience unto itself. The 15 minute ride led us to the Canal entrance of the hotel, which is equally jaw-dropping. The entire staff including housekeeping, front desk, concierge, waiters and bell-hops all were first class. There seemed to be marble everywhere, and were incredibly pleased when our room was upgraded to a canal-view. Our room window was literally a few feet from the canal, and was absolutely wonderful. It was a marvel gazing at the commerce that goes on in the canal. The room itself was relatively tight, but sufficient, as we were usually strolling the alleys of Venice, when we werenâ€™t enjoying breakfast, drinks or snacks on the Canal-front porch of our hotel. Breakfast and Drinks were great, and unfortunately, it is impossible to replicate the experience. St. Marks square is only a block or two from the hotel, where we enjoyed several museums and people watching. The hotel also has a complimentary water taxi to the Excelsior Hotel (which used to be part of the Starwood Hotel family), which is located beachfront on a nearby Venice island about 15 minutes from the Westin. At the Excelsior, my wife and I enjoyed beachfront dining and was a fun and delicious excursion. The private water taxi from the hotel to the airport was 95 euro, and again was an enjoyable ride. By the way, this Westin has some great Starwood Point offers (such as two drinks at the bar for 1500 points) which apparently vary, so if you are a member, be sure to ask at the front desk upon check-in so you can enjoy the promotions.
