A suggestion if you are renting a car to travel to Venice, do not rent from Alamo/National/Maggiore, as the reservation indicated the drop-off was in Venice, but was actually in a town a few miles West of the island of Venice itself. This location was difficult to find, was in a questionable area, and was a 25 euro taxi ride just to get us back to the rail station.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the renovated rooms!”
Reviews.Author: travelman90210
Reviews.Content: Background: SPG Platinum guest staying on award stay. Arrived for my several day stay and they claimed no suite/room upgrade available. Checked the website and it showed plenty of nice rooms available. Went to our room and it was pretty disgusting. Worn carpet, old pink and green furniture, etc. Had a big bug crawling on the wall...not too nice. Went to the front desk and was told they'd change our room the next day. Next day comes and what a difference. Beautiful renovated suite, great furniture, amazing view, and fantastic service (a fruit tray and champagne + note from the hotel manager apologizing for the previous room). Don't expect traditional Westin here (no White Tea scent in the lobby, different furniture, etc.) and the lobby and other public areas are nothing fancy, but the renovated rooms are beautiful and the location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Escellent 5-Start Choice for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: rsekeres
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the 5-star Westin Europa & Regina. hotel, on the Grand Canal in Venice. The hotel has a beautiful water-front entrance, but from the street, its teeny-tiny entrance opens onto an obscure square off the beaten path, making it difficult for us to initially find. However, once through the door, visitors are welcomed by expansive marble and old-world architectures. We enjoyed the peace and quiet it offered, plus our room had recently been refurbished, so the carpet smelled new and the furnishings (including the king-sized bed) were all top-notch. Located walking distance from St. Marks Square, the hotel features one of the best little spots for lunch on the water (quiet, delicious, and not all that expensive â€“ especially for a 5-star hotel), plus their restaurant and banquet facilities appear quite popular for weddings, we noticed. Overall, weâ€™d highly recommend the Westin Europa & Regina. for both the quality of the stay, the solitude of the room, and the proximity to everything Venice has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - especially for Starwood Platinum”
Reviews.Author: Muntz73
Reviews.Content: I was here over Labor Day weekend and had an amazing stay. The water taxi's were not running the day I arrived due a special event which created a 45 minute walk to the hotel through the streets which was AMAZING! I was very surprised that upon my check in they greeted me as a Platinum guest and told me I had one of the best rooms in the house, room 671. This top floor room (actually on the 7th floor) has a large living room, large bedroom, large kitchen, and an amazing 180 degree terrace that is about 800 s.f. Beautiful views!

Reviews.Title: “Classic European Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdmiralP
Reviews.Content: Our family (two parents, three kids ages 4-13) stayed at this hotel 8/21 and again 8/29-31. We had two rooms and used our Starwood points for most of the room/nights. The first stay we had adjoining "renovated" rooms which overlooked the hotel's interior front entrance. These rooms were very nice - bathrooms were excellent, beds very comfortable. Second stay we were upgraded to a suite and connecting room, both with full Grand Canal views (albeit from the building that is set back from the canal edge, so the view is a tunnel type view of the GC, not 180 degrees). These rooms were also excellent - bathrooms good, beds comfortable. Not sure how these rooms differed from the "renovated" rooms. We loved the hotel's location; service and staff were top notch, concierge very helpful. Our only caveat was the hotel restaurant - we ate there upon arrival as we were too tired to go looking outside the hotel. The food was good, service excellent, view of the canal great - but the pricing was ridiculous (10 Euros for a diet coke, 23 Euros for a small dish of pasta for our 4-yr old). With that exception, we truly enjoyed our stay and found this hotel to be a comfortable oasis in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugBellevue_Wa
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a great location. Shopping and St Mark's Square is a few steps away. Rooms were large and the heavenly bed was very comfortable. Staff was friendly and the concierge was very helpful

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL - ONE OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELSALOT522
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times. It is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at. Huge, beautiful rooms. Clean, great location near St. Marks Square. Expensive, but good value. Terrific staff. Nice exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaChoolhun
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this fabulous hotel. I can highly recommend it. Its location is superb, only a couple of minutes walk away from St. Marks square but tucked out of the way. We sat for almost 2 hours each morning eating our breakfast and watching the world go by on the canal-side terrace. Our room had a wonderful view over the Grand canal. The service at the hotel was superb. I would recommend the water taxi transfer from the airport, pricey but worth it ! We will definately return !!!!

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vitta”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLuc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great experience. The staff and serice was excellent. The hotel had a patio over looking a canal where you could just sit and take in Venice with all its splendor. The rooms were comfortable and the hotel is right around the corner from Saint Mark's square and great shops if your looking to shop. Worth every penny spent and an awesome experience in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A little hard to find but well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: raven1nyc
Reviews.Content: I used Starwood points for a one-night stay as we were coming to a close of a long trip and wanted to ensure a good night's sleep in a great hotel. The Europa & Regina is hard to find and, as other reviews have suggested, isn't right in the San Marco Square. In fact, it's in a little square tucked away from a main road. We walked from the train station and it's really fun to explore and try to find it on foot, though it's not the easiest when it's hot and you're carrying large luggage around. Hotel itself is what you would expect in a Westin - impeccably clean, air conditioned, Heavenly Bed, etc. Once settled in, it's quite easy to figure out where you are and navigate back to the hotel. Only downside is the somewhat high charge for internet access (â‚¬13 for 24 hours) which is just annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Will_NottingHill
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located, right on the Grand Canal, with a bar and restaurant with fantastic views (where Anthony Minghella shot parts of 'The Talented Mr Ripley' starring Matt Damon and Gwyneth Paltrow). Finding the hotel was easy, and the room was beautiful, with hand blown glass light fittings in the bathroom. The shops around the hotel are high-end (Gucci, Chanel, Vuitton) so staying here is rather like staying near Londonâ€™s Bond Street. And St Mark's Square is close by. The staff were very welcoming and the boat that took us across the lagoon to the sister hotel The Excelsior to use the pool was fantastic and well worth doing to see the Lido (fantastic beach). And there is the possibility of taking a water taxi straight to the hotel from the airport - the hotel has its own 'water entrance'. At 100 Euros, very expensive. We didn't, but what a James Bond entrance that would have been. All in all a great trip. No view from the room, but apart from that, lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Old Place”
Reviews.Author: Feimui
Reviews.Content: My Husband spent our honeymoon in Venice a few years ago. It was a disappointment. I was so looking forward to it as we have booked a superior room with view using our starwood points. It turned out when we got there, we were given a stinky room looking out pipes and and building next door. We went back to the reception and complained and said it was crap. Later we were given the same size room but without any smell, condition was slightly better and were told that the hotel is fully booked and no other room available! I will never forget this bad experience we have with Westin in Venice. We have stayed in starwood hotel for the whole of our honeymoon trip in Europe for 5 weeks and we have been treated nicely by starwood staff in other cities except Venice and will never go back there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel”
Reviews.Author: aj_stl
Reviews.Content: Location - There was another review (can't find it now) that gave perfect directions. I'd agree that it's hard to find if you don't take the water taxi or have the directions. Basically, get off at the San Marco "bus" stop, take the first left that you can over the side canal, and stay left (close to the canal). You'll weave in and out of some stuff, but you will find it. Once you get there, the location is superb and the view of the Grand Canal from the bar is stunning. Rooms - Our rooms (we had two) were newly refurbished (could still smell fresh paint). They were very, very nice. New bedding, drapes, carpet, bathroom fixtures, etc. They overlooked the courtyard, which was fine with us as it was a little quieter there. Service/Bar - The bar is well worth the expensive drinks. Sitting on the water sipping wine and watching the traffic go by was a treat. The people that work there were extraordinarily nice. I'm a little befuddled at several other reviewers that found otherwise. I can only speculate that perhaps some guests have expectations that are so high (based on very high prices) that their attitudes and manners get negatively impacted. I dunno, it may sound odd, but I find if you are nice and respectful to people, they will treat you the same way. But enough of that. As others have stated, the concierge arranged "complimentary" transport to Murano, which was awesome. Please note, however, the "tour" of a glass factory is actually a little bit of a sales job from a very high-end studio there. I'm not complaining a bit because we loved it. Just be aware that there is (presumably) a relationship between the hotel and the studio. We enjoyed ourselves immensely and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: A few things worth mentioning: ***The hotel is difficult to find unless you know exactly where you are going. I suppose I should have been better prepared... Hearing it's address is "San Marco," I assumed it was at the San Marco plaza. And you all know what happens when we assume... Just FYI, the hotel is definitely NEAR the plaza, and I understand their addressing system now, but the hotel is down a bit, over a bridge, behind a bank, and down some back streets. Definitely the San Marco area - and very nice area - but not right on the plaza. *** I didn't have trouble while checking in, but both the people in front of me as well as people behind me did. I heard some pretty irritated people speak their minds! *** My room was terrible! Not at all what you'd expect for this quality hotel. The room was tiny, little room to walk. I ordered one meal in my room and the table didn't fit until we moved the bedside table over... Nice things to mention: *** The lady checking me in was super friendly - to me, at least. *** The food I ordered was absolutely delicious - good job, chefs! *** The building itself was really neat to walk around. Apparently it used to be five different houses before it was converted to the hotel. *** Although it was difficult to find, it was nice being a little off the beaten path so there weren't loud street walkers waking you up. Overall, nice hotel - just not what I expected for the star level and the SPG legacy.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bigjmc
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Westin Europa regina and it couldn't have been a better experience. I was celebrating my wedding anniversary with my wife and 3 year old Daughter. Every detail was attended with no problems at all. It was a vacation we will never forget! The only thing I would say shocked us was the lack of an iron in the room. We called housekeeping and they came up and took care of it but we had to pay for it. Like I said that was really the only down point to the whole trip. The location is great if you are travelling with young children because when the weather gets hot or the kids get tired, it's a very easy trip back to the hotel for a nap. Once again thank you so much for a wonderful vacation and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tripsAAA
Reviews.Content: After researching several hotels for our honeymoon, we finally decided on this one. It was unbelievable! The hotel has its own water taxi stop, and if you're willing to pay 60 Euros you will get dropped off right at the front door on the Grand Canal. Right at check-in the staff was courteous and friendly. We were given an upgrade to an Executive Suite with a nice side view of the canal. If you want a full view, you're going to have to pay for it obviously, but this room was just fine. When we arrived at our room, we were surprised to find fresh fruit and a bottle of champagne waiting for us, which was a very nice gesture. The hotel is situated just one canal over from St. Mark's Square, less than a five minute walk away. It was a great location and we enjoyed walking everywhere during the course of our trip. Much like our hotel in Rome, the concierge desk at the Westin Europa and Regina was a valuable asset to our trip, always ready and willing to help with advice, directions or reservations. Marco, Mirko and the rest of the crew were so nice and helpful with every request we had. I could not be more grateful to them. They certainly made our trip a better one. The only negative I can think of is that both the hotel restaurant and the restaurant at the hotel bar are overpriced and, frankly, not that good compared to the offerings out in the city. Do yourself a favor, go out and experience the restaurants in the city and skip the food at the hotel. Both places overlook the Grand Canal, and you are obviously paying for the view, because the prices are outrageous. Other than that, the Westin Europa and Regina is an amazing place to stay while in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor service”
Reviews.Author: dSmithDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Westin Europa for 2 nights a few weeks ago to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and our daughterâ€™s graduation. We had 2 rooms. I have been a Starwood Platinum member for many years. My check-in experience was the worst ever! She made me feel unwelcome, a nuisance and was unhelpful. I have never been treated that way ever before. Several times at the concierge desk we received that same attitude.

Reviews.Title: “A good, clean, well-located option in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: spep4
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Venice, June 2009. Drove down from Bellagio for the night with three teenagers and a 7-year old. Chose the Westin for the location and because I trust the brand. It wasn't cheap (350EU per room), but it was really well located (right next to St. Marks Square), clean, easy, and friendly. The restaurant in the morning was good and very nice, sitting on the grand canal. Overall, a good experience -- just what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Venezia Perfection”
Reviews.Author: jandm89
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the highlight of our trip. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal and was more than we hoped it might be. The Concierge and desk staff were so accommodating and friendly. The position could not have been better .

Reviews.Title: “Location, Mystique and Old World Elegance & Charm”
Reviews.Author: BobRen62
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel if you go with realistic expectations. I have stayed here about a half dozen times going back over the course of fifteen years or so, and I always look forward to my next return. The location is superb. The back of the hotel is literally on the mouth of the Grand Canal, and a just a short five minute walk to San Marco. Yet, one must traverse several small alleys to find the place, so you are in a very quiet area (which belies the reality of the location, I know!!!). Virtually anything you want to see in Venice is a short walk away, or a short Vaporetto ride. The service is great, particularly the desk and concierge staff. On my recent visit, Roberto and Massimo were the perfect concierges and gentlemen, helping with everything from arranging a massage, to dinner reservations and transportation. Really helpful and pleasant. The only staff drawback were some of the guys in the restaurant. They are the kind that mutter about tourists under their breath and give the hotel (and Venice for that matter) a bad name. They are but a mere distraction from an otherwise great service team. The physical plant of the hotel can be a bit old and tired, but that is Old Europe and Old Venice, and that is why I say you need to keep expectations in check. They appear to be doing substantial renovations, and th eroom I had (although upgraded as a paying Platinum member) was very very nice. All in all this remains one of my favorite hotels in one of my favorite cities. I'm dropping in again in a month and can hardly wait.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Must Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: rich527
Reviews.Content: I am a Gold Member of Starwood Hotels and only use Starwood every time we travel. The Westin Europa is a perfect example of why I only use Starwood. The guest service level at this hotel is amazing. Most employees have 10 and 15 year badges and you can tell a level of service and how the hotel will be by the dedication of their employees. Roberta and Alejandra at the Front Desk and Fabio the concierge were all so helpful and able to go above and beyond. We had a room on the fourth floor and the location of the hotel was perfect. You are blocks away from San Marco and only about half an hour walk from the Train Station. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, not only for the service but the location. The hotel arranged a courtesy taxi for us to Murano to a glass factory and it is worth asking the concierge about that, they take you out there and then it is roughly 7 euro to take the vaporetto back. Great Service, Great Room, and Great Location. The Westin Europa exceeded my expectations!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for fabulous Venice stay”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel for a first time in Venice: although we knew that arriving by taxi reserved through hotel was a splurge (it is not that hard to find the hotel from San Marco) we knew we'd be tired after a long trip and wanted the pleasure of arriving by boat to the hotel. This hotel was previously the palace of an old and renowned Venitian family, thus the hotel topography is that of a complex and huge private dwelling transformed into a hotel: meandering halls, small stairs, rooms in every crook and cranny: that itself was a pleasure and an adventure for us but could take by surprise those who overvalue order and symmetry. The hotel location is remarkable: easy access to San Marco and really to everywhere in Venice. We had great rooms with "partial" canal views which were really phenomenal views of Santa Maria Della Salute and the tip of Dorsoduro. Gym was good enough for Italy (no Ballys in wonderful palatial Venice). Can't comment on food at hotel: we ate every where else in Venice but the hotel kitchen looked busy and smelled wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Tutto bene !”
Reviews.Author: SheilaKentucky
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a partial Grand Canal view room. It was bit small for 570 euros per night but the view made up for it. We had to view the Grand Canal from the side. The location was excellent ! 5 mins walk to St Marks square , Doge's palace and St Mark's Basilica. We toured the GC on a Gondola and ate at nice places recommended by the concierge. They had very good service. We loved touring and exploring this beautiful City of Light. Don't forget to tour Murano ! They ship anywhere in the world. The only downside was the beds were so hard! Were those Heavenley beds? I think not.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem with Great Services”
Reviews.Author: falmalki
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I could ask for such nicest city on earth. Ideally located next to Piazza San Marco (city center) and w/in walking distance to everything else. Free boat-shuttle to Murano with privilege access to the key glass factory. Great food, staff, and reception. Best Italian breakfast buffet ever. The rooms are just spacious and amazing. I got a suite with my wife that I cannot think any other hotel may serve better space and service. Our schedule was tight, but we seriously thought of extending our stay to further enjoy our best pick in our Italy trip. Strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel infrastructure is getting tired”
Reviews.Author: larrykay
Reviews.Content: This grand old hotel, where we have stayed on numerous occssions, is getting a little long in the tooth. While the hotel recetion, porters, concierge and staff wee extremely courteous, more attention must be paid to keeping the old gal in tip top shape befitting a 5 star hotel.. Forget that we did not get our desired rooms the first night's stay, we did get an upgrade for the 2nd night, The "grand deluxe rooms" are small, the shower a 2 by nothing cubicle that I could hardly turn around ( pushing the water knob closed), some burned out light bulbs , it was still nice ( Venice, of course). The prices are outrageous, but it is Venice ! My advice, pin down in your reservation, the exact size of the room in your category!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and location, but had a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: Socalac83
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I checked in last Tuesday. We stayed for 3 nights on SPG Points and Cash. We arrived to the hotel at about 4:30 PM by water taxi. If you are staying at this hotel, take a water taxi. The taxi pulls up directly in front of the hotel on the water and the bellman immeditaley greets you and takes your bags. Way cool. So we checked in and were in a standard room. We asked to be upgraded, the only thing they had was a suite with a view of the water. This certainly wasn't a typical upgrade, so I agreed to the 75Euro per night fee. We made our way to the room, and it was great. Huge bathroom, wonderful view of the canal, awesome bed, etc... The room was amazing. About two minutes after we checked in the Bellman had our bags and set them in the closet, on the ground. Didn't bother to use the TWO luggage racks that we're in the room. I thought that was rather odd. Didn't ask us if we needed anything, rude, etc. We went and had drinks and a small appetizer at the bar, which were amazing. You're literally on the water. In my opinion, it's the best view in Venice. Without making this review a novel, I will discuss what I liked and what I really didn't like. DISLIKED: 1. I'm not sure I would of agreed to stay in this room, had I known I would be waking up each morning to the noise of construction directly above our room. Of course, nobody told us this at check-in, on their website, etc. Certainly, our room was not the only room affected by this noise. It was really loud, and from 8 to 5. I don't like the hotel telling me what time I will be woken up at. 2. The TV didn't work, when we got to the room. It took them 24 hours to get it work. They needed to bring us a new TV. 3. Internet, didn't work either the second day. 4. Shower didn't work for 6 hours one day. We were advised the night before, they would be doing work on the plumbing, 5. Didn't credit the right amount of starpoints to our account. Don't want to get into all the details of the negatives, but they were some major issues, and weren't handled as well as I would of liked. LIKED 1. The location is amazing. On the water, two minute walk to St. Marks 2. The room was huge and newly renovated, if there's no construction going on, request room 419. 3. The food was pretty good, with the exception of the room service we ordered for lunch one day. Although their breakfast buffet is 52 euro, that's like 70 US people. 4. MOST of the staff was great. The bartenders were very cool. Servers needed some help, specifically at breakfast. 5. Furnishings throughout the hotel were great. At the end of the day I would definitely return to this property as the issues we had are correctable. Put our bags on the luggage racks, make sure the tv and internet work, finish your construction and let guests know about it. Compensation for the issues: internet was comped for the two days we used it, free dinner at the restaurant, and 3000 starpoints. i'm not sure if I'm happy with what we recieved, but that's what we were offered. I just thought the construction was a slap in the face to its guests. The GM was nice enough to call the St. Regis in Rome and tell them we would be checking in the next day, I'm glad he did as we were upgraded at check-in, met the gm, and had fruit basket waiting in the room for us. Definitely get a view of the canal, make sure there's no construction, and don't settle for lackluster service

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: gogetter40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to celebrate our 40th birthdays in Venice, April 2009. We were upgraded to a beautiful room with a large terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. There was also a bottle of champagne and a note from the manager wishing us a happy birthday. We enjoyed the King size bed which was extremely comfortable. The room was small like many European hotel rooms, but clean and beautiful. There was no signs of construction that had been previously mentioned by other travellers. Perhaps the renovations were complete. The breakfast was very expensive so we chose to eat at nearby restaurants. The hotel is in a perfect location not far from San Marco and the Rialto bridge. Venice is stunningly beautiful and should not be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.....”
Reviews.Author: KGM77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in late January, which was low season in Venice. As a consequence we got a fantastic rate, which certainly influenced our opinion on the property. On arrival we were told that the cleaning staff would be on strike the next day and that our room would not be cleaned. We could've/should've pushed for some kind of compensation, but as it was only one day, we decided to live with it. Our room was quite small, nicely decorated, the usual Heavenly Bed and with a large bathroom. The bathroom had a separate shower and bath, however the shower was tiny, with a very low shower head which means anyone tall needs to shower in a completely contorted position. Never mind 5 star, it wouldnâ€™t even be acceptable in a 4 star! The room had a partial canal view and small balcony, which we didnâ€™t expect given the cheap price paid for the room and no SPG status. The interior of the hotel was extremelyâ€¦â€¦.wellâ€¦.bling, in a European style. Lots of antique furniture, gold leaf, chandeliers etc. The bar looked nice, as did the restaurant, but with commensurately high prices, as is the norm for Venice and as a result we didnâ€™t try either, preferring to eat out. The reception staff and concierge were friendly and professional and willing to help at all times. The best thing about the hotel is its location. Not only the view onto the Grand Canal/Lagoon, but the fact its only a stoneâ€™s throw from San Marco, the main designer shopping area, and the nearest waterbus stop. Although very central, the hotel is tucked away and doesnâ€™t get any passing traffic, and we were able to sleep soundly at night, even with the balcony doors open slightly. So the best of both worlds. One (semi) regret is deciding not to splash out and take a water taxi from the airport. Not only does the waterbus take a long time, but the Europa, like many canal hotels, has its own grand water entrance on the Grand Canal, which is a much more glamorous way to arrive that wheeling suitcases down a dark alley. Obviously different rules apply in Venice when it comes to hotels, you pay a lot for less than youâ€™d get pretty much anywhere in the world and if you take this into account, then the Europa comes recommended. Its hard to find a better located hotel in Venice. That said, personally I certainly wouldnâ€™t pay the â‚¬500 or â‚¬600 rack rate in the summer, but Iâ€™d definitely consider going back in the winter when the comparatively quiet streets, fog and cold weather make Venice a really romantic destination.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Jacktor31623
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Westin Europa and Regina was extremely satisfying. First of all, the hotel is in a great location - it is right on the Grand Canal and is less than a 10 minute walk from Piazza San Marco and the San Marco Vallaresso vaporetto stop is right around the corner from the property. If you are navigating the narrow streets of Venice for the first time, the hotel can be somewhat tricky to find. But all you need to do is pop into a local business or hotel and kindly ask for directions to the Europa and Regina. The room we were given was absolutely beautiful - the bedroom had wonderfully decorated walls, and the bathroom was extremely luxurious and had a heated marble floor! Internet is available directly in your room for the reasonable price of â‚¬10 for 24 hours. There is a wireless keyboard in the rooms that interacts directly with the television, so you have privacy while using the internet. There are two places to eat within the hotel, and both are fairly reasonably priced. There is a restaurant and then a bar which also serves food. We chose to eat at the bar on a rainy night since it was slightly cheaper, and had one of the best meals during our stay in Venice. The staff there was very friendly and the bar offers a wide variety of drinks. The staff at the front desk was also very helpful and friendly, even offering us large umbrellas as we were heading out on a rainy day. Overall, this hotel is wonderful and we highly recommend it to those traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: phil1ben
Reviews.Content: After arriving from Florence (see review of Savoy Hotel in Florence) we arrived at the Europa and Regina and spent three nights there. We reserved two rooms. One for my wife and I and another for my two boys (11 and 15). The hotel accomodated our request for adjoining rooms. In our opinion the hotel was in an excellent location right along the beginning (or end depending how you are going) of the Grand Canal. In terms of rates we thought we did OK because Starwood was running a special - pay for two nights get the third free. Our room rate also included the sumptuous buffet breakfast (57 euros per person per day). It had everything you could want and more. Utilizing this promotion we thought the hotel was a good value. It is important to remember that you are paying a good deal for Grand Canal frontage, as you do with all the hotels that front on the canal. The rooms were large and well appointed. The bathrooms had both a stall shower and a tub and were also large. The bathrooms were marble, floor to ceiling. A few rooms front on the Grand Canal. We had a side view of the canal off a small balcony which was very nice. As stated we found the hotel location very good and only a few blocks from St. Marx square, many restaurants, Harrys Bar, a vaporetto stop and great shopping. Other than breakfast we did not eat in the hotel. Generally, the Concierge Staff was friendly and polite, except for a short fellow (the hotel will know who I am referring to as they read this site often) who seemed to not want to be bothered and was generally unfriendly. It may be that he was uncomfortable speaking english, however, with so many Americans and Brits staying as guests this was surprising. We simply waited until someone else could help us. The night we arrived was unseasonably warm. No air conditioning was available because the hotel had not turned it on yet. Unfortunately, when we first inquired about it that evening, we were NOT told that it was not available yet and to the contrary were told that someone would be by to fix it. It was not until the morning that we learned that it was yet "turned on" for the season. The weather was beautiful the remainder of our stay and no A/C was needed. The remainder of the hotel was very nice, however, keep in mind it is made up of 5 different buildings so is somewhat fragmented. The salon on the first floor was very nice and it was great to eat breakfast every morning immediately on the Grand Canal looking at the traffic. The beds were very comfortable and I would describe the rooms as clean. Some construction was going on at one of the 5 buildings but it did not bother us at all. I suspect that this will be going on for some time. Only one minor mishap. We arrived back at the hotel from a day of sightseeing and found my kids room door ajar so that someone could walk right in. Fortunately nothing was taken. When we notified the front desk they responded quickly but did not seem to be as concerned as we were. I would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahfun123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights in march. They upgraded us with a view from our room. The hotel was clean and the service was very good except for the maid. The maid didnt really clean our room. I used the cups in the room but the maid never clean it. Those dirty cups were there all 4 nights. Also, the room is a little bit dusty because my husband was sneezy like crazy when he first went in. The food were very very expensive. And breakfast buffet cost $52EURO. Can you believe that?? The location was good and it was very easy to find when you get off the vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at an enormous price!”
Reviews.Author: goingfor50
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Europa, and left with mixed feelings. I used Starwood points for this as I would never pay the ridiculous room rates to stay here. This is NOT a 5 Star Hotel. The Hotel is difficult to find unless you want to spend 95 Euro for a private water taxi from the airport. The water taxi will drop you off right in front of the hotel, but if you walk from the vaparetto stop, you have to walk down a few alleys to get to the hotel. We spent about 18 Euro for the vaparetto/bus combo from the airport. If you arrive via train, then it's just a 13 Euro vaparetto ride. The room I reserved was very nice, a terrace room on the 7th floor. The guy at the front desk said it was on the canal, which it is not. Not even close. It's set back, with a distant view on the Canal. The room itself was great..sitting room, bedroom, and wonderful terrace. The hotel is undergoing construction and smells of paint and the like. Two drinks at the bar cost 30 Euro! The bed was not Heavenly, but OK. Hotel concierge was a little snobby too, and not very helpful. The location is great. Just a 5 min, walk to St Mark's Square. If you can use points here, then do it. Otherwise, don't spend the cash for this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, and experience”
Reviews.Author: RRDN
Reviews.Content: My family recently spent one night at this hotel and we give the highest marks across the board. We arrived early in the morning after an overnight sleeper train ride from Munich so we could leave our bags until check-in while we explored the city. The bellman and front desk staff gave us an extremely warm welcome. Without us asking, the gentleman at the front desk was able to find us one room already available (we had two adjoining) so we could at least freshen up before sightseeing. This was not expected and I would never begrudge a hotel not being able to give me an early check-in courtesy (oftentimes it is just not possible for them to do so). The fact that the front desk gentleman took this extra effort, on his own initiative, to find out if it was a possibility is the type of service that makes a great trip even more special. The rooms were perfect and the bathrooms large. Of course, it was extremely convenient, being just a block or two from St. Mark's Square and the waterbus stand. (Yes, if you take the waterbus, you have to walk a block or two and over one bridge -- but, hey, this IS Venice). If you have a bag on wheels you won't even notice. Overall the accommodations were fantastic and only outdone by an exceptional hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot in a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: Paddlenround
Reviews.Content: You must visit Venice in your lifetime. It is truly one of the remarkable and unique spots in the world. The Europa and Regina is the perfect place to stay. Centrally located close to the Piazza San Marco, the hotel is historic and well appointed. It has an amazing view of the Grand Canal and is lovely in every aspect. The service was impeccable and the rooms were large by US standards (which means huge compared to European standards). This is truly a gem in the heart of one of the most beautiful places on this earth.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel to spend a birthday”
Reviews.Author: MissKandMrJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 15th - 18th Jan. Booked via SPG.com as always, managed to get the 3 for 2 offer. From the airport we took the waterbus, which was 24 EUR and took about an hour to get to San Marco and the hotel was less than 10 minutes walk. Top tip â€“ print off the directions on the hotel website. If you get a water taxi it will pull up right outside the hotel as it on the Grand Canal. The hotel is fantastically opulent with marble and antiques everywhere. We got upgraded to a junior suite, as it was my birthday. The room was fabulous, a great view of the Grand Canal. Separate bath, shower, sofa, king size bed and chandelier. The hotel sent up a bottle of Bellini (local drink) and peaches with note wishing me happy birthday. We used Starpoints to get breakfast, this was lovely. We ate in the restaurant, which was on the Grand Canal, it was a lovely spot but very expensive. The staff were helpful and location of the hotel was perfect right near San Marco Square and the designer shops (behind Gucci).

Reviews.Title: “A disapointing Westin”
Reviews.Author: America410
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal for business and have stayed at Westins all over the world and was very disappointed in this property. I booked a very good deal; otherwise i would not have chosen to stay at this hotel because it is so overpriced for what you get (even in the low season). I was upgraded to a nicer room than i had booked which was really the only positive thing I have to say about this hotel. The beds are definitely not "heavenly beds" and the rooms need a lot of upgrades, however, the bathroom was nice. The staff is rude and unless you are dripping with money, and they arenâ€™t willing to help you. The hotel was definitely not fully booked but the staff seemed bothered by anything you asked of them. One concierge wouldnâ€™t give me the public waterbus schedule for an early flight I had because "he didnâ€™t want to be wrong and be the one responsible for me missing my flight". i have never encountered a concierge that doesnâ€™t have schedules for the local transportation or isnâ€™t willing to find out for a hotel guest. When I asked about private transportation to the airport, he quoted me a higher price than the concierge did the morning I left. He also quoted me the incorrect prices for the internet. After my first day of sightseeing, I came back to a room that was half cleaned. The bed wasnâ€™t made, the dirty glasses werenâ€™t taken away and I had no new towels. The maid had only come in and taken the dirty towels but hadnâ€™t done anything else. This was at 3 PM. When I told the front desk about this, they didnâ€™t apologize and acted like this was normal and the maids come around in 2 shifts. After my room was finally cleaned and I was settled in, I was walked in on without a knock by â€œroom serviceâ€� which was a man that counted the mini bar contents in front of me out loud and didnâ€™t believe me when I said I hadnâ€™t had anything from inside the mini bar. I thought this was so tacky and this is something that is usually done either by the maid or while the maid is in the room and should not be done in front of the guests. Throughout my stay the maids and hotel staff walked into my room 4-5 times without knocking so be sure to deadbolt your door at all times while you are in the room if you want any privacy. The room next to me was clearly smoking and it was a non-smoking wing, however, the hotel staff didnâ€™t do anything about it and didnâ€™t try to get rid of the smell. When I left the hotel at 5AM on the private transfer (the one I was quoted 2 different prices on), there were 2 hotel staff sleeping on the benches in the dining area which I thought was completely unprofessional and should NEVER be done at a hotel, especially one this expensive. I know the hotel wasnâ€™t fully booked so if they needed a nap, there were spare rooms they could have used!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the expense...just this once.”
Reviews.Author: Polyglot_Solider
Reviews.Content: As part of my wife's first visit to Europe, I took her to Venice. Venice isn't my favorite place in the world, partly because it's one of the most expensive and partly because it's impossible to find one square centimeter of it that isn't a tourist trap...but everyone should visit Venice at least once. There's only one way to do Venice right, and that's to actually stay in the city, because it's much, much nicer after the daytrippers leave at night . Stay for at least three nights. We did two, and came up a little short on what we wanted to do and see. Once you've reconciled yourself to the cost, it goes back to my dad's saying "for a nickel more, you go first class". So we splurged on the Europa. We got a room with two tiny balconies hanging over the grand canal, looking across at Santa Maria De La Salute, or just "Salute". The view alone was worth the price of the room. Waking up in the foggy dawn and standing out on the balcony, watching one gondolier "gondola-pool" a boatload of his buddies to their gondolas to prepare them for the day, private speedboats and taxis zipping around, the water bus passing by, and barges of food and other goods drifting up the canal was probably the best experience of all. If you stay in Venice, stay on the Grand Canal, and make sure you have a window, if not a balcony, over the canal. The only thing that would have made it better would have been a steaming mug of coffee...but of course you don't drink coffee in Venice, you drink espresso. And calling room service for a $$$ doppio would have been ridiculous. We didn't eat at the hotel restaraunt, so I can't comment on it, other than to say that the location is prime, with the terrace having pretty much the same view as our room, only from water level. You'll get lost trying to find the exit if you arrived by water taxi. The hotel sprawls over about four different buildings, and the ground floor is a maze. The exit, we eventually discovered (too embarrased to ask), is to the right of the front desk. As you leave, bear to the right to get to San Marco, and to the left to get to relatively less touristy areas. You can engage a gondola about 50 meters from the exit at the first bridge that you'd cross to reach the square. The furniture was top-notch, the bed extremely comfortable, the bathroom fixtures perfect, there is really nothing I would improve about the room. Given that it was October, I can't comment on the efficiency of the climate control system. The staff were extremely helpful when approached, and did not intrude otherwise. This is one of the hotels that has the room key on a hefty fob to encourage you to leave the key at the desk when you go out...could have something to do with the pickpockets that San Marco is so famous for? Oh, one more thing. The streets near the hotel, at least in the direction of San Marco, are full of street vendors hawking counterfeit luxury goods after about 8PM. Kind of annoying, and from what I hear, YOU are the one who risks getting heavilly fined by the police, not the vendor, if you buy the knockoffs. If expense weren't a factor, I'd stay in the same room every time I visit Venice (assuming I came back to Venice). I highly recommend the Europa (by the way, skip the long name, the locals just call it the Europa, as did a Brit that I met on the train, and he hadn't even stayed there before, just knew of the hotel)!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travLer2009
Reviews.Content: We were only here for a night, but we had an enjoyable stay at this hotel. The location is great and the hotel is beautiful, clean, and uniquely Venetian. Food and beverage is expensive, but that's the case everywhere in Venice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: theone_one
Reviews.Content: well they told me it was going to be a canel view but it was a side view for the canel and the is the 1st hotel which they didnt provide me any upgrade at all nothing special about it plus they are not that frindly

Reviews.Title: “Stayed on Starwood points and were treated wonderfully”
Reviews.Author: KEDBoston
Reviews.Content: Before my sister and I went on our vacation we read some reviews saying that people who stayed at this property using points were given bad rooms and treated rudely. This was absolutely not our experience. The woman at the desk spent extra time finding us a room directly over the Grand Canal - we couldn't have had a better location. Any need we had, from the concierge to the man who ran the bar making us quick "emergency" iced cappuchinos one day , was provided efficiently and nicely. The hotel's location is excellent and in the evenings they have a good singer on the deck over the canal. We have stayed in many Starwood hotels in many countries - using points - and have had consistently great experiences. I really think it's important to establish a friendly rapport at check-in and appreciation for courtesies extended and you will have a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: BobOrlando
Reviews.Content: The Westin Europa & Regina is the perfect hotel to spend a weekend in Venice. I stayed in different 5 star hotels in Venice and I highly recommend this gorgeous property. We arrived at the train station land we catch a private small boat taxi (very expensive but worthy!!!). just in front af the station. The hotel has a water entrance right on the canal grande and if you arrive by boat it is very unique experience. I had booked a standard room but when i checked in they upgrade me to a deluxe room, whitout any charge! >The room has a wonderful view, the bed is incredible large and the cotton linen is ok. What made the difference is the breakfast on the terrace on the canal grande. There was a very famous italian art critic set near me! You can choose what you want from the very generousbuffet! All the sevices are as a five stars hotel, hte location is 3 minute by walk from san marco square. I really reccomand thi hotel. I hope to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Grand Canal setting”
Reviews.Author: keela
Reviews.Content: Date of stay Tuesday 26th August 2008 Stay for 1 night only prior to Cruise Holiday. I booked a 12 night cruise with Celebrity Cruises for the 27th August. I flew to Venice on the 26th as there was no flight on the 27th from Leeds/Bradford. I booked the Westin hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. I made the booking with Travel Republic as the price was the most favourable and included full breakfast. This was my 4th visit to Venice and it is a city that I absolutely love. The Westin Europa Regina Hotel is within the pedestrian area of the city Due to the proximity of the Hotel the only way to arrive with the least inconvenience is by Water Taxi. Taking the public water transport would leave me at St Markâ€™s Square and not really suitable as this would involve pulling bags over cobbled street and alley to reach the hotel entrance. The journey took about 30 minutes. I walked the short distance to where the water taxi terminal was and was immediately assisted with bags etc and we were off. It is in my opinion a wonderful way to arrive in Venice. Felt a bit like a Bond Movie as we were fairly zipping along! The taxi fare was 95 euro and this was clearly marked on the taxi jetty. On arrival at the hotel jetty we were met by 2 people who dealt with the baggage and a hotel Receptionist who escorted me to the check in desk. As I walked from the hotel jetty to the Reception I noted the grandeur of the hotel and it certainly was very impressive. The check in completed I was escorted to my room. I was taken aback by the size of the room it was very small and had expected more from what I had paid. I noted from the Trip Advisor that many guests stayed here with Starwood points but as we had paid a lot of money I felt that this was a bit of a let down. Yes the hotel was beautiful but I was going to spend the night in a less than impressive room. I called down to the desk and was told they would call me back. After some time and being anxious to get out and around Venice I went to the Reception and once again told them of my disappointment. I was told to call back later and to speak to the Receptionist on duty. I went out for some time to drink in the atmosphere of this truly wonderul city On my return to the Hotel I were told that They would offer me an upgraded my room. I asked to look at the room before I accepted the offer. This room was large with double aspect windows and a wonderful view of the Canal. It had a view of San Marco and so was delighted to move to this beautiful room. This large room had painted furniture and the walls were lined with a pale blue striped silk. There was a huge bed and a very large TV. The bathrooms are marble with a shower over the bath. The shower had a twin head and there had a very good pressure. The carpets were a little worn in all areas but this did not detract from my overall impression of the hotel. My booking included breakfast which if not included cost 50 euros. There was an excellent buffet which included fresh orange juice as well as many others, several smoothies. Many types of fresh fruit, cereals, cheeses, ham, smoked salmon, etc. There was also a hot plate with the usual bacon sausages egg etc. There was a great variety of breads cakes pastries etc. I ate breakfast on the terrace restaurant which is right on the canal side. It was wonderful to sit here and watch the various boats on the canal. It is such a romantic city and I would encourage anyone to book a hotel on the canal side. There were many little birds around and they flitted on and off the tables as people left. I went to the buffet and my cups etc were all changed as the birds had been at my table. The staff were attentive and efficient both at the Reception, the Porters, Concierge and the Dining room staff. I loved my time at this hotel and would be very happy to stay here again provided I got a room similar to the one I was moved to. All in all another wonderful visit to Venice

Reviews.Title: “old world charm, great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelsnob75
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Europa and Regina twice, once in November of 2006 and once in February of 2008 (and plan to return for a third trip in 2010). The location is wonderful. The first time we received an upgrade to a full canal view which was one of the best experiences of my life (drinking Prosecco on your balcony on the Grand Canal is a "bucket list" must do). The second time our room was a partial canal view, it was very nice but after the first experience a bit of a let down. The hotel is expensive (we used points) but very nice for a splurge or honeymoon. The decor is tasteful and the staff helpful. The hotel is a 3 minute walk from San Marco square and it would be hard to find a better location. I wish there was a lounge or other benefit for SPG members though we did receive a lovely bottle of wine on each check it. I disagree with other reviews that degrade this hotel, it is one the best hotels I have stayed in (I don't work for Starwood or the hotel). The hotel is quite old (200+ I'm guessing) and has more old world charm, it is not a W and is perfect as it is. I do agree with the other reviews that the food/alcohol is expensive (Venice is NOT cheap regardless of where you stay). Someone charged a 150E breakfast to our room, we protested and the charge was removed. Even at 20E a glass enjoy a Prosecco on the Grand Canal while you are there, you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Triumph of marketing over substance”
Reviews.Author: holtex
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bauer two years ago but they were full so we booked here instead. Disappointing. Arriving on foot or by boat at the Bauer there is a sense of occasion, but our first introduction to the Westin was after being directed by their sign down dirty alleys one yard wide, and having to struggle with cases past staff having a fag break outside the service entrances. We booked a Grand Canal view room. Apart from the view, which is great, the room was a pretty standard anywhere-in-the-world hotel room. It wasn't a patch on the one we had at the Bauer. The so-called Westin Heavenly bed turned out to be two singles shoved together. There's a thing called a Westin Heavenly shower over the bath, which is just a shower with two heads, one of which is pointless - surely just dreamed up by a marketing department. Breakfast was not included in the deal, and they wanted 50 euros each for that. I am prepared to pay a lot for some things, but not get ripped off first thing in the morning to the tune of 100 euros to feed self and wife. We ate out. We won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Scoubidou123
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in The Westin Hotel Europa & Regina. The hotel and the views are just amazing. I can only recommend paying the extra for a room at the canal, the view is really worth it. We got a room with a balcony as requested in the booking. The staff was friendly and responsive. Another advantage is that the hotel is a few streets away from the crowds, allowing you to find some rest. The rooms are in traditional style. I agree with some of the reviews mentioning that the staircase might need some refurbishment. This hotel might be slightly over-priced, but honestly, considering the views and the overall experience it was fully worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: MidwestCannoli_lover
Reviews.Content: We used our Starwood points to stay here. Although it is a very nice hotel, we somehow expected more from a 5 star hotel (having never experienced that many stars ourselves). The rooms had big marble floored bathrooms, a soft bed, and plush towels. We also appreciated the terry cloth bathrobes and candy brought to us every night. We paid for internet in our room (via TV) which was 10 euros for 24 hours but convienent. The prices in the hotel for the restaurant or to buy snacks is outrageously expensive and gave us a good laugh. There are a ton of restaurants within walking distance so this wasn't a problem. The hotel is in a prime location, just a minute or so from St. Mark's Square. We took the water bus from the train station to the hotel which worked great. Use the directions the hotel gives you to find the hotel otherwise good luck! It is kind of hidden. We used the water bus to transport us to the airport when we went home. The water bus was easy and much cheaper than the transportation the hotel can arrange for you. Having been to 2, 3, and 4 star hotels and bed & breakfast's during our entire stay, this hotel felt the most like an American run hotel. Wasn't as intimate experience you get with staff in a smaller hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you like waking up to the smell of Diesel & Garbage Boats, stay here”
Reviews.Author: bythebay590
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights here threw the hotel directly. Check in was quick, we had just dragged two suitcases an entire day across the country and for a tip they want to take them up to our room, please, so attitude started right away. We were shown to our room by the desk clerk, she showed us how to use the door key, and here's your room, bye. No, here's your safe, etc.... I asked when we checked in if the there would be noise in the morning as we were hoping to sleep in a little. She said no construction noise but you might hear the boats. We not only got the pleasure of hearing the boats, their engines revving,the smell of their diesel waffing threw the windows, the garbage barge pick up right under our room windows Rm 349, plus deliverys, and waiters dragging the breakfast tables and chairs around on the wood deck below, making it sound more like we were in an industrial mecca, instead of "romantic" Venice. The shower was ridiculously tiny, everytime I turned around I shut off the water, I'm 5' 2", 150, not small but not huge either. Unless you're anorexic, forget it. The toilet leaked and the hotwater faucet leaked. I think some of the previous reviews were written by employees of this hotel. It's got alot of marble, guess to impress, and a ridiculous entrance. My husband saw a rat on the deck (where they serve breakfast) behind me our first night there while we were eating. An over-priced meal both dinner and especially breakfast, don't eat here!! NOT IMPRESSED!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Escaramujo
Reviews.Content: Great experience at this hotel. Call ahead and let them know at what time you are arriving: Mr Luca Zennaro, the starwood hotel representative at the airport will be waiting for you and help you arrange for a Taxi. Don't even think about getting to the hotel in any other way. Pay the 100 euros, enjoy the vistas and arrive to the Hotel were they will be waiting for you in their dock. The trip will take 25 minutes. If you use the Vaporeto it will be almost 2 hours until you arrive. Our room was nice but smelled to much to cigaretes. After complaining we were personally taken to another room until we found the one that was perfect. It was beautiful, no view but beautiful. Ate breakfast twice at the hotel. Very expensive at 52 euros, but you can use starwood points (1500) to pay for it (instant awards, Gold member) This is a deal and the breakfast, sitting at the canal is just fantastic. When we left. Mr Zennaro was waiting at the airport, helping us with our luggage and with our check in process. Great service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our honeymoon in Italy”
Reviews.Author: RuinHuntress
Reviews.Content: We began our honeymoon at the end of August in Venice. The Westin was the second of two hotels we stayed at while in this beautiful city. What can I say? We were simply blown away by this hotel. The staff, the service, the restaurant on the canal (the best part of the canal in my opinion, I might add), the fact that we were actually taken to our room when we were checked in by the front desk clerk to see if we approved, the sparkling wine and hand made sweets on the first night's turndown, the note from the manager wishing us a wonderful stay...ok, I could go on, you get the point, it was fantastic. The room was in a word: stunning. Since this is an ancient building (like most in Venice) it has been renovated but the old-world charm remains. I personally like more modern hotels myself, but I have to say this hotel was the exception. From the Murano glass chandelier in our room to the plush sky blue material on the walls, to the old, tall balcony doors (three of them) opening directly onto the canal, the place was a dream. We paid about $500 for this room through Expedia BUT I am positive that was some kind of deal because it's worth 3 times that. I would advise that if you are in Venice for your honeymoon or any other special occasion - try to get a room on the canal for at least part of your stay. It makes the city so much more memorable. It's a very good idea to let the hotel know in advance if you are coming for your honeymoon, etc - they really go out of their way to make you feel special. In the 2 weeks that we travelled through Italy, this was our best hotel experience. I highly recommend the Westin to anyone taking a trip to Venice. We are coming back here in the future for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mattsaab
Reviews.Content: This 5 star gem is ideally situated in the center of Venice on the Grand Canal. The rennovated property drips with elegance and sparkels with appropriate decor. The hotel actually manages to be in the center of the chaos, but retains a sense of calm with it's almost secret entrance and plaza. Our room was upgraded at check in and we couldn't have been happier. The junior sweet was beautifully decorated and the bathroom was spacious with its own window. We had terrible problems with the tempertutre of the water in the shower and almost were scaled several times (seriously), but we loved the hotel otherwise. The restaurant prices are overpriced (even for Venice) and we avoided them, but they are beautiful. Check online for prices and especially the starwood web site since rates vary greatly depending on the time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redsailbeth
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon last week at this hotel and loved it. I found the staff to be friendly and sincerely helpful, not aloof or sycophantic as can be the case in high-end hotels, particularly in Europe. The hotel's location is perfect - it is centred around a quiet courtyard yet is just a couple of steps from St Marks and all the action. Our room, in the Regina side, had a couple of small balconies with a side-view onto the Grand Canal, was larger than I expected and nicely furnished with good quality finishings as one would expect in a Westin. I agree with some comments that the carpet on the stairway needs renewing, this seems to be just in the areas of high traffic, up to the second or third floor and certainly the furnishings in our room did not seem tired at all. We didn't eat in the hotel but had a couple of drinks on the outside terrace. Yes you will pay more for your 'spritz con bitter' there than in a small square but the with amazing view and ambience it is more than worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, paid with points, were happy, great location”
Reviews.Author: CLW8
Reviews.Content: This place is nice. Keep in mind it is venice so even our upgraded room was small. We paid with points and had a partial canal view which we were impressed with....we could see a lot of the canal. The room is nicely decorated and old but not gross or dirty or anything weird that usually comes along with old hotels. The lobby is pretty. We havent found the staff to be really nice or anything. Everyone is Venice doesnt seem to be very service oriented. We said it was our honeymoon and we got nothing extra except a "congrats" upon check in. The breakfast is good (buffet) but super expensive (like $40). Not worth the money except for the fact that they have a very charming patio on the water where you can eat. It rained and we had to move inside though so kind of disappointing. Gym looks nice although we didnt use it. Location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful Hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: TransCon1
Reviews.Content: We arrived by water taxi and i can't imagine a better entrance to the hotel and Venice. It was pricy, but well worth the view, the memories and the pictures. You arrive at what is actually the "front" of the hotel We stayed two nights on Starwood Starpoints. I understand it is very expensive using dollars. But our experience was great. The room is a little small for me, the Mrs. and baby of 7 months. The crib took up a lot of the free space in the room. That being said, this is Venice and space is at a premium. But it was very nice with a dark red marble bath and top notch linens. Our son again got a Westin Kids backpack and hat and things. He still plays with the hat and backpack. We asked for a room overlooking the Grand Canal (I'm sure everyone does) and were told that they were sold out. Now, I don't mind being told, "that's not what you reserved" or "I can upgrade you for a fee," but I really resent being lied to. An older couple checked in after us, specified that they wanted a canel view and were told the same. "sold out." They however had paid for it and had confirmation of that from their travel agent. They guy at the desk quickly changed his story. I hate that BS -- we are adults spending a lot of money -- lets just be honest. The view we had was of the rooftops of Venice and had its own charm. Breakfast on the terrace was great (real american breakfast and then some). It was expensive, but with the view (right on the grand canal and the lagoon) and the food, I felt it wasn't a bad value (although only did it one morning -- it is expensive). The hotel was cental enought to walk to everything -- St. Marks, Harry's Bar, shopping, water taxi / bus.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of what you're told before you get there”
Reviews.Author: aaronsmom7
Reviews.Content: We were there the beginning of August. The room was beautiful but the A/C didn't work well. There were water temp problems in the shower. And we were told they would give us a canal view and something special for our anniversary. What we got was an interior view of some construction on the other side and nothing special for our anniversary. I thought the Conceirge was rude. When I inquired if they had a waterbus schedule or information, he practically laughed in my face and said that was "public transporation" and he didn't have anything on it. Again, the room was very nice, but hot, and the breakfast on the Grand Canal was lovely. Not sure I would stay here or recommend to a friend. Sorry :(

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: CM002
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel really beautiful. Lovely public areas with lots of marble and nice furniture. It was also nicely animated (whereas some expensive hotels can seem a bit stuffy and deserted). The restaurant and bar both have wonderful terraces overlooking the Canale Grande. Breakfast is absurdly expensive, but somehow worth it given the selection and quality of the food, and of course the gorgeous setting. We secured a very good deal via the starwood website so overall I found this to be pretty good value. We booked the basic room category and got a spacious room overlooking the backyard. It was absolutely fine, quiet and well appointed. Good airconditioning and no insects at all. Good turn-down service too. One quibble would be that there were just blankets and no duvet (unlike the usual Westin Heavenly bedding). There is a small fitness room, which is a nice facility to have, particularly as space is at such a premium in Venice. The location is great, just a few steps away from the posh shops, the beautiful St Moise church and San Marco. The only criticism I would make concerns the staff. Whilst many of them were friendly and helpful, particularly in the restaurant, a few others at reception/ concierge desk could certainly improve. But then we did not need to rely on them and this did not really impair a wonderful stay in a very charming property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Europa!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Europa following a 7 day cruise. It was a wonderful end to our European vacation! The bathroom was extra large with a seperate shower and oversized tub. This room was much better than the other Venice hotel we stayed in. I would highly reccomend this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would definately suggest taking a water taxi it drops you off right at the front door. It was difficult to find walking through cobblestone streets with luggage! I booked the room with my Starwood points and was given an upgrade when we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat the E&R!”
Reviews.Author: ferdia35
Reviews.Content: The Europa & Regina is nestled in a quiet area just off san Marco nearby Chiesa di San Moise - and is located right on the grand canal. Although this was not our first visit to the E&R, it was our first stay with children - which has a completely different dynamic. We had a very early arrival from an over night train, so although our room was still occupied, the friendly member of front office off loaded our luggage, and we were free to ramble the city. When we called back, the room was ready - and was well worth the wait. A junior suite with interconnecting room for the children, which absorbed our luggage - not an easy thing to do! The room itself was had numerous balconies with canal views, (including one of the bathrooms:), was very spacious and decorated with great attention to detail (described as Venetian Baroque by the hotel) - really could not fault it in any way. Breakfast was a major treat, helpful & efficient staff, fresh fruit, hot buffet, eggs - all tastes catered for, but the real joy was it's canal views, right across to Chiesa di Santa della Salute. Each evening, we started out with a drink at Bar Tiepolo , which again offered panoramic views. On our last night we had a very pleasant meal on the terrace, although we did miss the older waiter who'd a great rapport with our children. There was a complimentary shuttle service across Lagoon to the Excelsior on the hour, where you can avail of this hotel's facilities. We used this on two afternoons - once we hired a unit on the lido , the second we just stayed at the pool. The concierge was really helpful, and went to great lengths to ensure a place for us on a particular tour- not easily organised, his predecessor would be pleased:) This hotel makes everything seem easy, is very child friendly - every member of staff ready with a smile - and I would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “loved the breakfast terrace”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europa/Regina, a 5* Westin Hotel, with friends for 3nights from 16th August 2008. The service was excellent. The rooms were well furnished and very clean. The best part was the wonderful breakfast which we had on the terrace in the sunshine, watching the cruise ships go by. The terrace is on the canal, on decking! Very much a wow factor.The hotel is opposite the Salute church, very near St Marks square. There was an an excellent choice for breakfast, both hot and cold and a wide choice of cheese, meats, breads and fruit. Very good service at the tables, taking away plates etc. We were made very welcome. Lots of special touches, the turn down service with slippers and mats, sweets on the pillow etc. Overall we loved it and if you want a special hotel with wonderful views look for the rooms on the front,on the canal. We had a back room which was a standard room, so no view, but lovely room and very quiet. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissappointed in the Europa & Regina”
Reviews.Author: floridatravelpro
Reviews.Content: This was the first time for my wife and I to stay at this hotel and visit Venice. I have have traveled a great deal on business in my 30 year career and have a good sense for travel expectations. First , Venice is a wonderful place to visit. Many opportunities to see and enjoy this delightful city. One of the more expensive places I have travel to but for a few days well worth the trip. The Westin Hotel was selected after reading many on line trip reports for many hotels, primaraly for it's location and preceived four star rating. We took a private boat from the airport to the hotel for 90 Euros. There is a desk outside baggage at the airport that you can walk up to and book one for immediate departure to the hotel dock. The trip is about 20 minutes across the open water.... Following check in we we taken to our room on the fifth flloor with a "panaramic view" the view consisted of a water view across a side alley to the canal. Not great but OK. I quickly noticed that the room was warm...Was told that the hotel system is old and the room will cool in time. We unpacked and closed the drapes and lightsand went out to view the city. Returning 4 hours later the room did cool down a bit but was still warm. Since we havd unpacked we dicided to keep the room since the entire hotel is on the same air conditining system and the forced air was very very weak. The room had nice but very old furnishings and the carpet was worn and ripped from wear by the closet. The bath was large but the shower was very small and the water did not drain well creating a pool of water at your feet during use. The bigist issue we had was using my starwood points to cover the breakfast . For 1500 points would cover breatkast for the cost 104 Euros. We used this system the first day and decided to do the same on day two of our stay. I was told I did not have enought points to cover the second day when I knew I did and after much discussion and my showing the m documentation about my point total they admitted to over charging my starwood account by four times! Not that that was enough when we were checking out they charged me 104 Euros for the second days breakfast on my hotel bill. We did get it corrected but the attitude was one of indifference. As if I was putting them out of their way to correct their billing errors. By the way..if you order a drink be prepared to be charged alot...I oreded a standeded 7 and 7 (wiskey and ginger ale) and was billed 15 euros for the wiskey and another 6 euros for the ginger ale for a total of 21 euros plus a 10 % VAT which is about $35 US dollars....I shouold have ordered wine! Finally, when we were ready to leave I requested a bellman to take our baggage down from the room so we could meet our transportation at the dock. After 15 minutes we decided to do it ourselves since they did not show. This hotel is in a great location to St. Marks Square but I honestly would look at other options for the cost . We enjoyed the city but were very dissappointed in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a stunning view”
Reviews.Author: Shirls45
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Had probally the best breakfast have ever had in a hotel in Europe. Its just not easy to find when you go alone and especially with heavy suitcases. So would suggest better signs to the hotel. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great annivesary”
Reviews.Author: skibuff
Reviews.Content: I and my wife, my wife's sister and her husband celebrated our joint 44th anniversary at the hotel. I had booked with Points and Cash for three nights and one night at the web site rate of 300 Euros. I also had notified the Hotel of the celebration. We took the Water Taxi from the airport (good walk from the terminal to the dock) and arrived at the Hotel dock where all the luggage was handled by the bell staff. Check in was smooth and we received an upgrade to a top floor room on the Europa side with a large balcony and views of the Grand Canal, courtyard and parts of Venice as well as the Bauer Hotel next door. The room was well furnished and we received a bottle of Champagne, box of Jelly candies and a large bowl of Nectarines. The next day, the anniversary date, we also received a large vase of roses. The bed was very comfortable and turn down service was provided. The bath room had a large tub but no separate shower. Towels were plentiful and quickly replaced by the day housekeeping service while we were out and about. The buffet breakfast was huge and more like a full menu operation. We did happen to see a rather large seagull land on a nearby table while the guests were at the buffet for additional food. He helped himself to a sausage before he was shooed away by the waiter who replaced the entire table setting. Such are the adventures of outdoor dining. We also ate dinner in the dining room and one lunch on the outdoor bar side facility. Food and service was very good at both but definitely NOT inexpensive. My sister in law did rave about the olives served as a "free" bar snack. I wanted to change our return flights to an earlier time and the Concierge was extremely helpful. After trying a number of times to contact Air France via phone and not having success (being Sunday, most such services in Italy are hit or miss, mostly misses), he contacted the Ciga representative at the airport who then proceeded to make all the arrangements directly with the Air France Desk at Marco Polo airport. I was later offered three choices for an earlier flight, selected one and the change was made. I even got a fax confirmation later in the day delivered to our room. Superb service. Giga, who operates this hotel and others in Venice runs a shuttle motor boat to the Lido Beach and other locations that is free to hotel guests. I noted several guests traveling to the Lido for swimming or sight seeing. The boat is a beautiful wood inboard with room for what appears to be 20 or more passengers. I believe it runs every hour at 5 past the hour but it may be seasonal. After four nights, we again used the water taxi to the airport arranged by the Hotel and ended a very memorable stay in Venice. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone and note that it was an extremely good deal using Cash and Points from the Starwood Preferred program.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Rethw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for our Wedding Anniversary on the 6th of August, I emailed the Hotel ahead to let them know. They upgraded us to room 612 which had the biggest terrace in the Hotel. We also received wine on our Anniversary day which was a nice thought. Views from the terrace were awe inspiring. The bar area and terrace was nice to sit and watch the water traffic go by. Take the Blue line Alilaguna from the Airport (it takes 1 hour 15 minutes). After getting off at the San Marco stop head left over the bridge and walk past Harrys Bar then up Valleserro (the ice cream shop will be directly in front of you). Take a left at the Ice cream shop and keep walking (past Prada etc.) go over the Bridge and take the first left down next to the canal....easy. We found the concierge very helpful and all staff extremely obliging. We were greeted well by the reception staff. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again if we were to visit Venice again. DO NOT take a map, Venice is smaller than you think and the best part is just seeing where your feet take you. We struggled to find somewhere to eat but would recommend eating / drinking at the 'Bacaro' lounge, which is on the same street as Prada etc that you walked past to get to the hotel. It was modern and contemporary, good food, great atmosphere and great service.
