We also treated ourselves to a drink at Harrys Bar - it is very expensive....go if you feel the need to say that you have experienced Harrys Bar but there are better bars with more atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CosSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin in Venice for 5 nights this past July. We booked directly through Starwood website. Following what others recommended, we booked a private water taxi through the hotel for our arrival and I will echo the recommendations of the others in saying Do it! It is a magical and wonderful way to arrive in Venice. We booked the arrival through the hotel which was 180 euros (it includes being greeted at the airport by a hostess, a private transfer to the docks and the water taxi to the hotel) but for the return to the airport we took a private water taxi which the concierge booked for us for 95 euros. A terrific way to arrive and takes the sting out of having to leave Venice! The check in procedure took a very long time and we were just hanging around waiting behind a mass of people at the front desk, felt that this was disorganized. We were given room 256, described on the website as a grand deluxe dream room with a view of the Grand Canal, in the Regina side, in my view the best side as the view from that side of the hotel was of the Church of Salute. In fact lying on the bed I could see the church, the tourists milling around the steps of the Church. I threw open the windows and heard O Sole Mio being belted out by a singer on the gondolas...the water lapping against the docks...It was truly the perfect room. The bed was in fact heavenly and the slippers and bathrobes top notch. We were given champagne and fruit jelly candies on arrival. (The jelly candies made an appearance each night on our bed). The bathroom itself was marble and new. Mirrors on all sides. There was a bath tub and a separate shower. The shower stall was a bit squeezed...just don't drop any soap! There is no room to bend down to pick it up. The complimentary shampoo and conditioner was not great, so the ladies may want to bring their own. The body lotion was wonderful. The view being so great I would have liked to keep the windows open but in July there were mosquitos. The first night I got bitten in three places. Luckily I had brought the anti mosquito tablets that you stick in the electric socket. This and the fact that we kept the windows closed in the evenings seems to have done the trick. I would recommend booking a room with breakfast. The area is near San Marco and full of tourist traps, I think it would have been difficult for us to walk out and find a place for breakfast before having any coffee each morning. The buffet is 52 euros which seems alot but if you went for the A la carte breakfast menu, you could easily reach that if you wanted, OJ, eggs, toast and fruit. The buffet was a huge spread with plum, tomato, OJ, apple, grapefruit juice further there was mango, banana and strawberry smoothies. Breads, toast, tarts, cereals, eggs, bacon, sausages, grilled tomatos (these were fantastic by the way) and home fries. There were cold cuts, smoked salmon and a cheese trolley. You could also order buttermilk pancakes as part of the buffet or a three egg omelette to order. Breakfast is until a welcome 11am. We didn't need to eat lunch due to the extensive breakfast each morning. The location of the hotel is perfect. We ended up walking everywhere and only took the vaporetto twice, once to go to Murano on our own and once to go out for dinner on the Dorsoduro side. The location, next door basically to San Marco meant that after a half day of sight seeing (Doge's Palace, the Campanile, Bridge of Sighs...) you could easily swing by the hotel for a refreshing shower and a little nap before getting on with the rest of your day. After dinner you can grab a gelato on your way home! The only negative thing I can say is that the entire concierge team, in general was unhelpful. I asked about Murano and he told me that the best thing was to go on a free factory tour although my question was how do I get there? I asked about the Secret Itineraries tour and his reply was come tomorrow and we will call them to see. I replied I wanted to see if I can do it today and he said that you cannot book the same day...so how does going tomorrow to book make any sense? It seemed to me as if they just put things off. I understand that there are many tourists asking the same questions. Maybe they could do a FAQ sheet for the guests... Finally, I had a guidebook from 2006 (Lonely Planet) I don't know when it was researched but the prices have pretty much doubled since then... I would recommend this hotel highly. It is expensive but for us it was definetly worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beware Booking with SPG Points”
Reviews.Author: zadar
Reviews.Content: I was completely disappointed with the Westin. I paid with American Express points (120,000 for 2 nights) that were converted to SPG points. We were given a room way in the back of the Hotel. The carpet in the Hallways & in the Room was worn out...it had to be at least 30 years old. Grime had settled in at the edges. The walls were dirty, they hadn't seen paint in decades. Initially, the flat screen Philips TV didn't work. We reported this to the Concierge desk on our way out to sightsee. When we arrived back to our room that evening, it still didn't work. Someone did eventually come and fix it....DURING THE SOCCER GAME! The next morning we were surprised that there was no hot water and we had to take cold showers. We let the front desk know about the problem. When we returned later that day to get ready for dinner the hot water was restored, but the radiator in the bathroom was blasting heat! Maybe they thought that would help with the cold showers. As I read through the reviews here, there seems to be commonality. If you pay with POINTS in the high season your experience will be far different than a guest with cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: mck9982
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights on the last leg of a 3 city European tour. The experience started when our Taxi pulled up to the beautiful exterior and the welcoming staff. The hotel is extremely beautilful inside and makes you feel truly romantic. The staff was very friendly and helped with all of my requests. I booked a room overlooking the Grand Canal and was very happy with our awesome view. The action on the grand canal is really fun to see and for our first time in Venice the view is so necessary. Great hotel bar and they treat you with such high class. Also, the wait staff at the breakfast buffett was so flexible and nice. Great experience and we would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: burkesn
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the wife for our honeymoon. It was our first time in Venice and we aboslutely loved the hotel. I stayed using my starwood points and they gave us a top floor room with balcony overlooking the city. They also had champagne and chocolates waiting when we checked in. Venice is a tough city to navigate and even tougher with bags. The hotel isa bit of a walk from the water bus, but there are also private water taxis taht take you right to the front door. I thought the location was great, the staff nice and the room very elegant and with lots of personality. Don't miss the breakfast buffet which had a huge selection of delicious treats.

Reviews.Title: “A great option in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Reldim
Reviews.Content: The Westin Europa in Venice is a great option for the discerning traveler who wants to be close to everything in Venice. We particularly liked that we were less than a 5 minute walk to St Marks Square, and the walk took us past the top European Designer boutiques including Prada, Gucci, Cavali, Feragamo and more. Not a bad walk! The hotel had its own water taxi stand, but except for our arrival we never used this very expensive form of transportation. We bought a 3 day Vaporetta pass and learned to enjoy the far less expensive "water bus" to get everywhere we wanted to go. The stop was a quick 3 minute walk from the Westin, located near the St Marks Royal Gardens. The hotel had a classic architecture and the room was very large for European standards. We liked the padded fabric covered walls and marble clad bathroom, as well as 32" flat screen TV (although there were only a couple of English channels). If breakfast is not included in yoyr rate, walk to a near by cafe to avoid spending more than $90 on breakfast in the hotel. A word of advice: skip the temptation to book a canal front room. We spent $200 a night extra for this view and quickly learned that after spending every moment on the canals or looking at them, the last thing we cared about was looking at it some more through our window. Since most Venice hotels don't have balconies, you will only be paying for a window view - truly not worth it. Trust me and save the money. Except for the moment that you first arrive and look out the window, you'll never even care about the view. Service was personal and truly top notch and the staff at the front desk remembered us when we walked by. The health club was complimentary, had the latest equipment and quite nice, although internet access is a bit expensive. You have a choice of using their computer or a connection in the room.. Overall, we loved the decor, great location and feeling of quality that this hotel had. A great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: tbc2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really beautiful. The staff is courteous but not overly friendly. Our room was very nice and clean, fairly large too. They have a beautiful patio restaurant that is worth having breakfast at for the view. I loved the location - The hotel is right near St. Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of your Dreams”
Reviews.Author: Alamedabonnie
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel of your dreams. Superb decor, superb service and a fabulous location in the magical city of Venice. Caution: from the airport get the Venice Card (or order online before you go) for free transport to the hotel instead of the outrageous cost of a private water taxi. The decor of the rooms is fabulous as was the size of my room overlooking tile roof-tops. The daily service included a bowl of fresh cherries and bottled water compliments of the hotel manager! The breakfast was 5 star: prosciutto and melon, wild salmon, cheese board, eggs, cappuccino, etc. The service was outstanding from the restaurant. Great concierge service--though a bit too much competition amongst the staff to accomodate my requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rgarick
Reviews.Content: The Westin Europa is an excellent hotel in a great location in Venice. We booked using Starwood Points, otherwise very expensive hotel! Our room had a partial canal view and it was very lovely with a beautiful bathroom. The hotel manager surprised us with champagne and candy since we were celebrating our anniversary-a nice touch! Used a private water taxi to get there but public transportation is just as good and much cheaper--will do that next time. The hotel has a wonderful bar/lounge with outside terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. Ordered 2 cokes and one dessert--very surprised at the bill though--35 euros!!! Unbelievably expensive...didn't bother to get breakfast at hotel. Bottom line--if you have points to stay here it is worth it due to the excellent location and easy to navigate to major sites--very close to St. Mark's Square....!

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: crispy71
Reviews.Content: The hotel was no better than okay, it is very run down and has a grubby, unkept feel about it. This hotel is three star at most! Then there is the attitude of the staff. They were rude, arrogant and totally unaccommodating and look down their nose at you, we asked if we could sit on the terrace to have breakfast , which is justthrough the door from the dining room, and were told very rudely and abruptly NO. The food was very bland, make sure you eat elsewhere if you are unfortunate enough to stay here. I was here with work so it was free, I would have been gutted if I had of been paying

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: alandubo
Reviews.Content: The Westin Europa and Regina is a combination of two hotels, located directly on the Grand Canal behind Piazza San Marco. You can't get a better location. Just a few minutes walk from the hotel is one of the main shopping and dining areas. As for the hotel itself, we found it above average for a European hotel. The rooms were decent, clean, and comfortable. The furniture was somewhat dated, and the bathroom needed a bit of a revamp, but overall we were pleased. We indulged in the buffet breakfast downstairs which was fantastic, but incredibly expensive (52 Euros a person). Take your appetite. The staff was friendly and always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, great location - but I guess that is the Venice experience”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Well Venice isn't know as one of the most expensive cities in Europe for nothing. The prices are high everywhere and this hotel is no exception. Thus, for the purposes of the review I'm ignoring the price paid and the 'value for money' aspect as i have no comparable experience within Venice. The location is fantastic! The restaurant overlooks the Grand canal and having breakfast (52 Euros for the full buffet breakfast - and no that's not a typo its five two) watching early morning Venice go about its work is wonderful. Our package included breakfast - I'd recommend yours does as well. The buffet is reasonable. Nothing special but adequate. The bar is very pleasant with a deck area overlooking the canal (its adjacent to the restaurant) and to finish the evening with a glass of wine (only 8 Euros = good value considering prices elsewhere and location) looking out over the canal is, again, one of life's better experiences. So the location is wonderful. Is it hard to find? Answer not really if you have directions. We used the standard water taxi from the railway station to the St Marco (adjacent to the spot as the public water bus from the airport drops off) and found the hotel with ease following the directions. The only word of caution is that in the ~250m walk there is a bridge (one of the very many in Venice) you need to carry your luggage over. Its about 10-15 steps up and then down. We used the water bus back to the airport. Its highly recommend as you get a free tour of the outlying islands en route. It takes about 1hr 15 mins and costs 12 euro per head. Service was perfunctionary. I think that reflects Venice as a whole. There are so many tourists no-one has to try too hard. Hotel has a decent gym (didn't use it). Internet connection in room - again didn't use it. Room was OK. Unfortunately we had two single beds pushed together but didn't complain and managed. Everything else as expected. The standard Westin 'dual head' shower which always seems like a good idea but isn't. I've given it 4 stars simply because of the restaurant and the bar experiences and the location - otherwise it would have been a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and view”
Reviews.Author: dlb1978
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our only night in Venice. We booked using Starpoints, and were upgraded on arrival. The room was a gorgeous full canal view room, with a sitting area, a very comfortable bed, and a large by European standards bathroom. It had a two small balconies that allowed you to stand right over the Grand Canal. The service was adequate for our short stay. When it was time for us to go to the airport, the hotel called us a water taxi which arrived on time at the hotel's dock. It is a huge understatement to say that everything in Venice is overpriced, and this hotel is no exception. If we had not been able to pay with Starpoints, we would have stayed somewhere else simply because of the cost. But, if you can afford it, or you have Starpoints, the Westin is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Unaccommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: sibby24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really beautiful. It was unfortunate that the staff had no interest in making our stay memorable. They had an usual attitude that we have never encountered at any hotel before. Our room was warm and we were told the air conditioning had not been turned on yet for the season. It was the end of April. We had to open the windows and their were no screens. My husband had a dozen mosquito bites. The staff were uninterested in our problem. We were glad that we had made all our plans and reservations before we left the U.S.A. because we didn't want to have to rely on them for anything. At the end of our stay, we requested a motor boat to bring us to the mainland and we waited longer than we should have and were told in a annoyed manner that it would be there shortly. Venice is a must see city. There are other beautiful 5 star hotels on the Grand Canal. I would not stay at the Westin Europa & Regina again and I am a starwoods preferred quest.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: JoGo13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the absolutely perfect way to end our group trip to Italy. The rooms were lovely, the lobby gorgeous, the service was perfect and the breakfasts could please anyone. I brought a group of 29 people to tour Italy and this hotel was the crown jewel of a very wonderful experience. From the hotel, we walked to several shops, restaurants and sites. The location proved convenient and easy to reach. The staff was helpful and polite and everyone enjoyed the time spent at this hotel. The outdoor sitting area for the bar was a relaxing stop after a day of sightseeing...but the prices are ridiculously high...but that seems to be for all of Italy...somehow, at this hotel, we did not mind the prices as everything was relaxing and the service was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel...it was clean, the rooms were adequate in size and the bathrooms were lovely, although we had a room with a separate shower that was the size of a phone booth...making it hard to lift your arms and wash your hair...but we survived it...and basically loved our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View!”
Reviews.Author: taloola
Reviews.Content: we are starwood patrons. booked early through site and used points. when we arrived we were upgraded to grand canal suite overlooking the Regatta Storica (labour day weekend) gondola races. It was wonderful. Staff and food excellent. Location cannot be beat. If you have Starwood points. Use them here! ...If not...very much worth the money for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, expensive but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Friendship88
Reviews.Content: We were there for our 21st anniversary and the manager sent a bottle of champange. Booked the room using Starwood points (which otherwise would cost some 500Euros per night!). We were apparently upgraded (according to the conceirge) to a top floor room overlooking the roofs, no canal view. Hotel said all canal view rooms were booked. The room we had was huge and comfortable, with a small separate room for a closet and a nice marble bathroom. Hotel service was aloof, though not unfriendly. Good location, right next to San Marco and vaperetto stop. Other then the price of the room, nothing to complain about. Oh, the hotel also arranges a free water taxi to the glass factory at Murano.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: danidb518
Reviews.Content: Venice was one of the stops during our two week first trip to Italy-first time overseas! And of course, it was one of the most expensive stops but we went with the 'trip of a lifetime', and 'who knows if we'll ever get to return' attitude and did it up right - paid for a room with a balcony and boy did we get what we asked for- when the desk clerk who showed us to our room opened the drapes, I kept saying: wow; oh my goodness, oh my goodness. Our room was front and center. And we also took the private water taxi for 65 euro that docks at the hotel's private landing. It was worth it since we had more than one piece of luggage to drag around! Did we let the cold, misty rainy weather bother us? No way, as it added to the 'wow' atmosphere. The staff was friendly and the breakfast buffet was very good. Would love to go back someday, and would stay here without hesitating.

Reviews.Title: “Location couldn't be much better.”
Reviews.Author: shamrock08
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a very pleasant five night stay at the Europa and Regina on Starwood points. We emailed them to let them know that it was our 25th anniversary. We were not upgraded and only had a view of rooftops. However, our room was very comfortable. It was at the end of a hallway and extremely quiet. We had one minor problem, when they left in the middle of making up our room one day. It was 4:00 and the wastebaskets had been emptied and the window had been opened, but the bed wasn't made and the used towels were sitting in a pile on the sink. We called the front desk, and it had been taken care of when we returned ninety minutes later. The staff was pleasant, and the location was great. We didn't have any problems finding the hotel by following the directions on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Westin!”
Reviews.Author: TSLove2Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary this year with a trip to Venice and Florence. While in Venice, we stayed at the Westin Europa & Regina. We had emailed the manager ahead of time, to let him know this was a special occasion for us, and upon arrival, we were upgraded to a junior suite with a view of the Grand Canal. The manager also sent chocolates and champagne to our room. The room was wonderful -- with old Venice charm! The bathroom was huge and we even had a walk in closet. The service was outstanding. We had a wonderful and memorable time in Venice. Thank you Westin for your "cash and points" booking option! And thank you to the Manager of the Europa and Regina hotel!!! P.S. -- as far as finding the hotel: One Trip Advisor reviewer had great directions from getting there from the Vaporetto stop. Once you get in the square with the St. Moise Church, you go over the bridge and turn left immediately under the archway shown in the fourth picture. Then follow signs to Europa & Regina!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay with a toddler”
Reviews.Author: aks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel our first five nights in Italy using our Starwood points. After a difficult day of travel, it was nice to arrive to a beautiful hotel with professional, warm staff and clean rooms. Our first room was partially overlooking the grand canal on the Europa side, but was on the first floor directly overhead the piano bar. The noise level did not work for our family needs (but would have been fine if you were out for dinner at that time). The staff accomodated our move to a different floor quickly and efficiently, and also offered us a complimentary breakfast for our troubles. The breakfast was very expensive (52 euros!) considering what it was, and I would not pay to go there. Since it was free, we did take advantage of it. There was plenty of fresh fruit and juices, scrambled eggs, meats, cold cuts and cheeses, breads, etc. There was also a small kids buffet that would have been great for an older child (3 or 4 and up). We found that asking the concierge for restaurant recommendations was the best way to go in terms of finding affordable, delicious food in Venice. We were pointed towards several good restaurants that were much better than the ones in our guidebook, most within 10-20 minutes walking. The concierge were also excellent at answering a variety of questions and directing you. The hotel is in an excellent location to a variety of sights, but it is in a touristy neighborhood. We did use the free boat to Murano, and while the free water taxi to and from the glass factory was fun, we found the intense sales pitch and lack of tour on the topic of Murano glass to be disappointing. If we had to do it again we would have just taken a vaporetto over and explored on our own. We stayed there with our two year old and they provided us with a portable crib. This was longer than a standard pack and play and had side walls that were mesh and a "headboard" and "footboard" that were fabric. While it was fine for our toddler, and I wouldn't want to lug a pack and play to Europe, I would have been slightly concerned about putting a younger child in it as our daughter rolled into the mesh and I would be fearful that a smaller baby could get stuck there. I am also not sure how firm the mattress was, as I didn't check and it was made up with sheets and a pillow for our daughter. Also, my daughter kept bumping her head into the metal bars at the top - the fabric was not padded. These are small issues of concern to likely only a few (and did not detract from our stay), but depending on how concerned you are on where your child sleeps I wanted to provide information on it. We saw several other families with small children staying at the hotel as well. Overall, we had a lovely stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: sledxl
Reviews.Content: It must be very difficult to manage properties in Venice - the challenges of the architecture, foundations, climate, and ancient buildings are daunting. That said, the Westin Europa in Venice is more than a bit dilapidated. Among our family we had 3 rooms, two of which were canal front. Though charming, the water damage and wear and tear in all 3 rooms was a bit more than necessary. Clearly the staff is overwhelmed by the work to be done. There is an old world faded elegance, but be warned that it is extremely expensive and I would not recommend the hotel in spite of the very excellent location. Do not get room service or breakfast - crazy expensive and poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel100
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is not easy to find. If you take The vaparetto to the St Mark's stop go straight and follow down to first street cross, make a left follow until you go over a bridge then make your first left after the bridge, make your first right, then left and you will find the tiny piazza where the hotel is located. The rooms are very nice, nice clean updated bathroom, nice decor. The bar is beautiful and may I suggest the apple martini.. unlike any I have ever had. There is an outdoor area that is exquisite at night and sits right on the Grand canal. The breakfast is very good. The location is perfect! You are minutes from St Marks, the bridge of sighs and the accedemia museum. Dont bother with maps... they dont work they will give you the general location.

Reviews.Title: “Book a room over the canal”
Reviews.Author: broadwood24
Reviews.Content: The Westin Europa is undoubtedly a beautiful five star hotel incorporating three palaces and overlooking the Grand Canal. There is no better way to arrive than in complete style by your private water taxi from the airport at around 100 euros, dropping you off at the hotel's own moorings. If arriving on foot it is a little tricky to find like most canal front hotels but once you reach the Hotel Violino D'Oro, San Marco you pass through its arch then a right and a left and you reach the square in front of the Westin hotel. Insist on a Grand Canal view otherwise there is little point in paying such high prices unless the view is unimportant and it is sheer luxury you are after. The breakfast buffet at 52 euros (US $78) is expensive as is everything else if you want to eat and drink at the hotel. Oatmeal at 9-50 euros, (U$ 15), a coffee 6-50 euros (U$10) and the set evening meal at 135 euros (over U$ 200) per person excluding drinks was too expensive to even try. If you can get a good deal which includes half board you will not regret your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superv location”
Reviews.Author: Silverio33
Reviews.Content: After a stay at a horrible hotel in Rome this hotel came as a relief from bad hotels. The hotel is expensive but the location is worth. the rooms are big and nicely decorated. the restaurant is ok and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed over the Carnival 2008 with SPG points”
Reviews.Author: JTOgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Europa & Regina (what a weird name by the way) with a friend over the Venetian Carnival for 2 nights. I booked through SPG with my points for a room with partial canal view. We were assigned room 410, which is on the top floor with a little balcony overlooking Santa Maria della Salute. The room is not big, and the king bed is really 2 beds combined together. This kind of bed arrangement seems to be popular in Europe. The mattresses were great and so were the sheets. Every night we found a little box of chocolate truffles on our bed. The bathroom had heated floors with one bathtub and one shower. We found the service to be great, but we did communicate to the staff in Italian. We had some problems with accessing internet through the TV, but the staff readily recognized the problem and waived the internet charge. The location was excellent, between St. Mark's square and the Rialto bridge. However, the entrance of the hotel was definitely not easy to find via land. Overall we had a great experience there. It was a great use of SPG points since everything was super booked and expensive in Venice during the Carnival.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: X70MJS
Reviews.Content: Easyjet had opened direct flights from Belfast and as we always take wekend break in December, why not. Booked via Starwood and got an upgrade on arrival. Room warm large and clean and comfortable. Location just could not be better and made the break fantastic. The hotel itself seemed a little impersonal and staff were okay but not very inviting. The hotel bar (piano) nice drnks pianist/singer just awful. Avoid the waterbus from the airport, the water taxi would be worth the extra, we used it on the way back, brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, plenty of character, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: DubaiBling
Reviews.Content: Having read many mixed reviews about this hotel I tried to arrive with an open mind. We chosse to take a private water taxi from the airport to the hotel, this in my opinion is the only way to arrive and depart, its costly if there are just 2 of you, at 90 euros each way, however the taxi can accommodate up to 8 guests and as the hotel has its own dock its simply a must. Some guests have commented on how difficult the hotel is to find if you arrive by Vaperetto ( public water bus) if you follow the hotels instructions it realy isnt that difficult although a suitcase with wheels is a must as its a 10 min walk and you do have 2 small bridges with steps to cross, the downside of using the Vaperetto is that they are busy and can take over an hour to reach San Marco ( nearest stop to hotel), the private taxi gets you there within 30 mins and is obviously just for your use. When we arrived at the hotel our luggage was taken from the taxi into the foyer and then arrived just after us in our room. We had a deluxe room in the original part of the hotel overlooking the canal. The room was almost a junior suite in size, plesantly furnished in a Venitian style. The bathroom was an all marble affair and had both a bath and seperate shower, it had just one sink and a bidet and wasnt overly large but had character and certainly served its purpose. The view from our room over the canal was great although the buildings opposite including the famous Basilica S. Maria Della Salute were under going restoration so were covered in scaffolding which was a shame. The hotel is made up of 4/5 diffrent adjoining buildings, the foyer and room type you see on the hotels website are situated in the original part of the hotel, you will also find the reception, main bar with its canal terrace in this part of the hotel together with the Grand Salon which is a very ornate drawing/sitting room, the main restaurant is situated in an adjoining building although each building is connected so they tend to blend into each other. We found the front desk staff and the Duty Manager friendly as were the concierge team, the restaurant staff im afraid were indiffrent and at breakfast if you dint ask you didnt get. Breakfast was in fact a huge disappointment, not only was the quality and choice of food poor the buffet was priced at 52 euros per person, I am very well travelled and have stayed in some of the finest hotels in the world and never have i seen a breakfast so expensive. They even charged 5 euros for 1 piece of thinly sliced toast and coffee is around 6.50 euros, the tip here is if possible get your breakfast included in your room rate, otherwise just for the basics you will be spending 50 plus euros a day per couple. Whilst in Venice we visited a few other Hotels and even the famous Gritti Palace and The Daniele have a faded elegance about them. If its high tech luxury in modern rooms with excellent levels of service for a fair price, Venice isnt the place for you. The city and its high end hotels may have character and a certain charm but we found staff have mixed attitudes and the outrageous cost of accommodation, food and drink almost everywhere in the city bears no relation to what you actualy get. Our visit was as a Birthday treat for my partner, we had realised that we would be in Venice when the Carnival ended, I hadnt thought this a problem until we arrived to find enough people to sink the place. Getting around and sightseeing were almost impossible. You could not see St Mark's Square for people let alone the amazing architecture around it, our timing was bad, however after the last day of Carnival we almost had the place to ourselves the contrast couldnt have been more different. A drink or ice cream at a cafe in St Marks square is a must, however be prepared to pay a 5 euro cover per table to go towards the orchestra if they are playing.Our 2 cappucinos and 2 limon ice creams came to just under 50 euros, like everything else its far from cheap. That said just off the square there are some pizza/pasta restaurants that are much more reasonable, no frills and quickly cooked food for around 12 euros per head. Not far from the Europa & Regina is a restaurant called The Caravella it forms part of a Hotel and fronts onto Calle Larga XXII Marzo almost opposite Gucci. Be warned this has to be the worst place i have ever eaten a meal, the staff are pompous and the decor resembles a mix between a run down English countryside pub meets the inside of an old naval war ship, not good. The food is not just expensive, 36 euros for a main course, but poor quality and badly cooked, our main meal was so small we had to fill ourselves with the contents of the bread basket. The Europa & Regina is in a good position close to San Marco square and the surrounding designer shops. The cost of a room is about average for Venice, if possible pay for a Canal View and try and get your breakfast included in your room rate, otherwise budget another 50 plus euros a night. Room service food and drinks are expensive as are drinks from the bar, however it appeared to be the same everywhere and after all its a 5* hotel in an expensive European city. Private water taxi is a must otherwise follow the hotels directions exactly and be prepared for a bit of pushing and shoving on the public water bus. I would also add that when its busy you may not get on the first water bus and therefore would have to wait another 30 mins for the next to arrive. Remember that even when the sun is out in the colder months the crossing from the airport to the city, however you do it can be a chilly one so wrap up warm. Be prepared at busy times for large crowds, expect everything to be expensive, make sure you have plenty of euros or credit cards with you and just enjoy Venice for what it is. If you take the trip to Murano to vist the glass factories be warned they will show you their most expensive pieces of work first( most start from 500 euros) and then if your pockets arent deep enough as a last resort you will be shown the 'tourist' shop that sells much more affordable items from 5 euros up to 2000 euros. We found that the choice of glassware was as good if not better actualy in the city, you can negotiate with the retailers on price and in my opinion get a good deal. Should you want any further advice. please e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PeanutButterJelly
Reviews.Content: My family is slowly getting used to European hotels so this was one toe in the water experience. We have stayed at many Westin and Starwood properties before getting Westin Europa in Venice. Our expectation was even higher due to $$$$ price tag per night, but how many times do you get to go to Venice "for the first time"? We booked our room through a consolidator and got a pretty good deal. We were told Italians come to Venice in Sept. when tourists leave. Contrary to some reviewers, it wasn't difficult to find this hotel. But it seems very easy to miss it all together. Once you get off the crowded water taxi, just follow your eyes from one Italian designer store to next, until you get to Bottega Venetta and turn left. If you see Gucci, you went to far (or was it Prada?). Check in was easy, though I am used to faster check in service. We had to pay extra money for a roll away for our daughter. I grumbled at this but, again we are getting used to European hotels. We loved the view from our hotel. Imagine seeing Grand Canal of Venice with taxi boats, gondolas... framed by two buildings on either side of Westin. Overall our room was roomy (wow) and comfortable. Even the rollaway was comfy, according to our daughter. The location of this hotel is awesome. It's a short walk to the St Mark's Square. A nice comfortable, roomy, gorgeous, clean hotel that we'll use again when we go back to Venice. This was an above average hotel for me. Staff at Westin seem jaded by all the tourists (may be American tourists). We did get a great restaurant recommendation from the concierge. We left in a private water taxi from the hotel (ask front desk staff) since we couldn't imagine packing into a public water taxi like sardines.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Place”
Reviews.Author: HopesandDreams
Reviews.Content: The Westin Europa is a nicely located Hotel (once you find it) for a stay in Venice. It is close to San Marco Square, with only one bridge to cross from the vaporetti stop. It is tucked away in what appears to be a back alley, which may be a bit discerning at first, but is quite common in Venice. The hotel lobby is nicely appointed, with a dark feel to it. The reception team was professional, but not overly gregarious. We had a standard room, that was decorated with standard venetian flair. If we were to stay here again, I would definately opt for an upgraded room, as the room did not reflect the bearing of the lobby. The furnishings were showing signs of wear, the carpet had a iron burn spot, and there was a definate need for attention to details in the repainting of trims and moldings. The first evening our room was equipped with 2 robes, but the next day, 1 robe was removed from the room. I requested a replacement of the robe, and never received the replacement. Also, upon check-in to our room, we did not receive bath slippers, and wore slippers from another hotel. Upon our return to the room on the SECOND day, we received 2 pair of slippers. These are small things, but small things make the difference between 4 and 5 star experiences. **One nice touch is the mask for sell in the room - saves you the trouble of looking for one, if you so choose. Overall, there are many hotels to select from in Venice. I have stayed in 6 different locations with varying price ranges. I found this to be a standard (non-charismatic) experience. As a Starwood Property, this is a good base - if the price fits your budget and you are looking for a large commercial Venetian hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Charm and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: funexplorer
Reviews.Content: I had heard mixed reviews about this hotel but I knew it had a good location and was a lot of SPG points. I was concerned about location because I had heard how expensive private taxis were. In fact the Concierge will get you a very expensive private taxi. I suspect they are getting a cut back. We chose to take the public water taxi after taking the bus to the stop at the top of the Grand Canal. We did not find the walk to the hotel difficult except that just before you turn left to the hotel walkway, there is a bridge we had to lug our luggage over. If you don't have roller luggage to get that far you may want to buy some. We had booked a partial canal view. The best part of the Canal view - the Church had scaffolding all over it. So the view was not as spectacular as it could have been. We had heard to request the older section which is closest to the front desk called "Casa Tiepolo wing". Also a prior post said 249 was a good room. We stayed in 107 in the Casa Tiepolo wing and liked our partial canal view. I forgot to ask if there was an upgrade suite in the newer section. I am glad I did not because this room had an elegant old world look with great marble and other amenities. A prior post had said room 415 was bad. As you may have heard from Samantha Brown on the travel channel when she was there, this hotel is the merger of 5 hotels over time. The breakfast was too expensive as we had heard. 50 Euro for an IHOP breakfast menu didn't seem worth it. No one seems to offer breakfast at non-hotel restaurants in Italy. All I can say is plan ahead or pay the ridiculous price or pack cereal. The best service we got was a free water taxi to a Murano Glass furnace. The glass factories pay for you in hopes you will buy glass from them. Marco the owner gave us a personal tour starting at the furnace. This factory specialized in Chandeliers and Mirrors. They had lots of other artists in their store. After our tour and after going through the gift shop we asked for where else we should go. He said the church and the Glass Museum. He didn't want us to go to other factories. We were not interested in any of their glass and ended up buying a few small items there and then went on to find our way to other places. He told us to be back by 4 pm to get a taxi back. I wish we had taken the public taxi back so we could stay longer. We did go to a large factory called Formia which has 50 glass blowers and does nice, but not as complicated work. We bought a nice glass piece from Formia. Back to the hotel - it has a nice restaurant on the canal (see attached photo). Although we did not eat there the view was great. I was not sure if we would like Venice and it turned out to be our favorite city for all of our Europe trip. We only stayed one night but had almost 2 full days in Venice - Murano. We would have stayed another night at this hotel and would recommend it to others. We did have a bad restaurant experience at Trattoria GiGi (not at the hotel) which is somewhat close to St. Marks Square. It looked nice and quaint but was terrible. I will never eat at a restaurant that several people here or Frommers, or Rick Steves or Zagat have recommended. The sitting room in this hotel is very elegant. The inside bar by the canal is very cozy and elegant. There is nice glass pieces in the hallway in display cases. There was a nice glass piece outside our room on the way to the stairs as well. This hotel is close to shopping. The gondoliers are right along the path about 50 yards from the entrance to the hotel. St. Marks square is close by as well. I would not spend less than 3 days in Venice - Murano when I go again. My wife bought a silk scarf for a good price. She also bought clothes at a shop close to St. Marks Square that was not a big noticeable name but was reasonably priced. If you must pay more, the big names are in the area as well, including Valentino, Versace and Prada. A very nice touch was a mask in our room that had a lot of character. It was next to the Mini Bar and was ~30 Euro so we bought it. It looked better than many we saw around Venice. Just across the canal is the Guggenheim Museum. It is interesting outside and inside. I would trade more time for not going if I had a choice. If you are taking a private taxi to and from the airport you need to at least take a taxi or public taxi all the way up the Grand Canal. The gondoliers simply won't go that far and it would take them too long. Whatever you do, plan your time wisely and enjoy the Elegance of Venice. The staff was polite and accommodate a 4 pm checkout consistent with my SPG gold status, and they were happy to hold our bags after we checked out to that we could do more before a late flight. We took the orange bus to and from the airport and feel now that I should have paid a little more and go on the blue bus. I tried to write a comprehensive trip review previously but Trip Advisor told me to break it up. I hope they post all of this. If you are reading this, this is the last sentence and hopefully they did not edit anything out.

Reviews.Title: “Completely satisfied”
Reviews.Author: JPax
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel. Concierge was very responsive to all requests. Lamberto arranged our water taxi transfer with greeter and van trasnfer from the airport for 170 euros; an expensive, but worthwhile expense after the long flight. I was happy to avoid lugging our bags and queing for a water taxi. Check-in and out was very efficient. We did not eat a single meal at the hotel, so I cannot comment on this. The room was a deluxe canal view number 250. The room was fantastic with three small balconies large enought to step out and view Salute and the canal. The corner room was beautiful with comfortable beds and fine linens. The bathroom had seperate tub and shower with bidet and covered with marble. I was very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Helen B
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice to celebrate my friends 50th Birthday. I emailed the hotel manager informing them of the occassion. On arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite and there was a bottle of wine and chocolates in our room, it was a lovely way to start off our weekend! Our holiday package included the buffet breakfast in the hotel, we were very pleased as the food in the hotel is very expensive. The staff could not do enough for us especially consierge, always full of advice and directions. We wanted to visit the island of Murano, (where they make the famous Venetian glass) our hotel provided us with a free water taxi there and back, it was great, as we had it to our selves. This is much cheaper than taking a gondola. The hotel is situated within minutes of St Marks square and is by the canal, which means it is accessibly by the water taxi. We noticed many people pulling their suitcases through the streets looking for their hotels, but we didn't have this problem. I was glad we paid the extra for private transfers to the hotel, well worth it! A tip if you visit the Basilica, if there is a long queue, go direct to the small church, where they ask you to deposit your bags, there they will give you a ticket to enter the church without any queing! Food is expensive in Venice, however, shopping is great we got lots of bargains! Every night in the hotel our rooms were made up for the night, curtains drawn and chocolates saying "Good Night" laid on the bed. We will certainly visit the Westin Europa & Regina again and November was a lovely time to go. My friend certainly enjoyed her 50th Birthday.

Reviews.Title: “excelent service”
Reviews.Author: Denis_Linda
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to this hotel 2 weeks ago - what a place to try and find if you are walking there - hidden away in a back street - which for me, made it very special in that I had not told my wife were she was going or which city she was going too till 3 min.s from boarding the plane. It does not look impressive at all from the street at all -- open the entrance door and you are in another world. simply stunning. the way to arrive is by water taxi if you want to impress - by the street if you want a suprise. The staff were brillient on arrival our room was filled with orchads, a bottle of champs. and boxes of chocolates - I had told the hotel it was our 25th wedding aniversery. the room was confortable clean and furnished to a high standard-- on the last day we did have a small prob with the heating - too hot -- the hotels responce was to move us to the penthouse suite - stunning! I would go there again and pay their prices - it is not cheap! but worth it. The only downer I would say was the corridor ouside the room - the carpets have seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel well-located”
Reviews.Author: Wakky_J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Europa & Regina Oct 27-30 as the first leg of an Italy trip. We were staying on SPG points. This was our first trip to Italy but we have been in Europe several times before. We both stay at Sheratons or Westins often when we travel on business. This trip to Italy was our reward to ourselves for all the nights spent away from home on business. We took the water taxi to the hotel from the airport. It's an expensive means of transport (100 euros) but we heard it could be difficult to find the hotel from Piazza San Marco the first time and we had been up 24 hours at this point. It saved us 30-60 minutes as it went directly to the hotel. The hotel itself was lovely.The room was large with the signature heavenly bed and a flat screen tv. We were hoping for a canal view but actually got a street view. We were in the room so little it didn't matter. The room was nicely decorated and the bathroom as well. We had 2 problems with the room - hot water wasn't working in the shower only and one light wasn't working properly. We called and someone came up immediately and the problems were both fixed within minutes. We used the concierge service to make a restaurant reservation for us and they did so. We didn't deal much with the concierge or front desk staff but they were professional, knowledgeable and friendly when we did deal with them. When we let them know the night before that we would be checking out very early the next morning the concierge offered to help us make arrangements for transportation to the train station. A few things to note: there were very few English channels which is of course understandable but other than a couple news channels and a movie channel there is nothing else. This probably won't matter but if you are like me and suffer from insomnia the first couple nights due to jet lag you may want to bring a DVD player or a good book. Also there is no coffee maker or iron in the room. I believe this may be the case throughout Venice due to fire regulations. The coffee maker was no great loss as the coffee and cappuccino were excellent in Venice but I would have like to iron some of the travel-induced wrinkles out of my clothes. A few Venice tips: Throughout our stay we learned that the best time of day to enjoy Venice was early in the morning and later in the evening. The crowds have dissipated and it's absolutely magical. Also, dress in layers and be prepared for weather changes.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonDCTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I fell in love with this magnificent hotel in Venice. By far one of the best hotels in Europe. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable, and quiet. The lobby is stunning and the staff is very friendly. We're definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury - Westin Europa & Regina - Venice”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just spent 3 nights at this hotel. It was a REALLY amazing stay. Everything was perfect. The staff was great. I'm posting my experience below. We had planned a romantic trip hitting several cities in Europe including Madrid, Barcelona, Rome, Paris and Venice. We are in Paris now staying at the Ritz and it's AMAZING as well. We landed early and I'll try to post a separate trip report after I get back home. I wanted to at least post a hotel report now. I booked a full Canal view suite. It was pricey at almost u$s 1,000 per night. I've stayed in some amazing hotels before but really I found this to be the best place I ever stayed considering the amazing view of the canal from our room! At the check-in they said the room wasn't ready yet but they told me that based on their availability and considering my past business with the hotel chain they were providing an upgrade to me. To an even bigger room still with a Canal View. I'm not sure what the rate is on this room but their website shows 1,500 EUROS per night. We went to go out and they stored our bags for us and they told us to come back at 2 PM. I asked the concierge a good place to eat. Really the entire staff was always great and friendly. I used the concierge a lot throughout my stay to get friendly tips on good restaurants and they were always spot on and most of the times they made the reservations for us and that ensured us great service when we got to the restaurants sometimes with the owner of the restaurants greeting us. The room was incredible! The view was breathtaking. I'll attach some photos of the view from my room that I took. The ceilings were really high (probably 15 foot ceilings) and the room was very big with a living room as well. The bathroom was big and all marble. Talk about old world charm! The room had 3 huge windows with a balcony stretching across the room. From the outside we could see it took up the entire front of the building so we had the entire floor view it seems. The bathroom had a separate shower stall (a bit small but worked great with great pressure and hot water) and a bathtub as well. The room had heavy curtains and black out blinds to block out the sun and it was VERY quiet. The staff throughout the stay was really great. One day it rained and they came up and brought us up a nice umbrella to use during our stay. Everyone was great and I can't say enough great things about it. I'd recommend a Canal View room if you can afford it. The room also had a big LCD tv with a pretty extensive cable package. We watched a bit of TV late at night as we are night owls. Also, there was high speed internet connection (not wireless) and it was 12 Euros per day. It works flawlessly and they billed it to our room. Really a great stay in a true 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Charles S
Reviews.Content: My wife & I finished our first trip to Italy (two weeks; Rome, Positano, Florence, and Venice) by spending five nights at Westin Europa and Regina Venice. Disclosure: I used 48000 Starwood points for this stay, under Starwood Preferred Guests' "Fifth Night Free" points offer (redeem points for four nights, and the fifth night is free). In advance of our stay, I contacted the hotel directly, to advise them we would require a rollaway bed for the first two nights of our stay (my sister had flown over from the US to spend some time with my wife & me during our trip to Italy), and to make a dinner reservation at La Cusina for my wife's birthday on 19 October. I received an email reply acknowledging both requests, and was advised that there would be a 125 Euros per night surcharge for the rollaway bed (exorbitant I thought, but apparently standard in many hotels across Italy, if not Europe). Following our arrival at Venice Stazione, we took a private water taxi directly to Westin Europa and Regina (60 Euros, plus 10 Euro tip). Though there were no porters to assist us with our bags from the water taxi, we thought this just a minor inconvenience, as we were soon assisted when we entered the hotel. Check in was fast, friendly, and efficient, with our reservation being in order. The rollaway bed was in the room and made up when we entered, and a complimentary bottle of Prosecco was chilling in an ice bucket for us. Our luggage was delivered soon afterwards. Though we had no view of the Grand Canal from our room, I believe that we did receive an upgrade, as the room was extra spacious, with a separate dressing room, and very large bathroom, with dual basins. However, unlike our room at Westin Excelsior Rome, the shower was over the bath, not separate. Service was consistently exceptional for the duration of our stay, far exceeding our expectations (especially considering what we had read in several TripAdvisor reviews of this property). If ever we phoned to request extra towels, ice, turndown service, etc., the staff were at our door so quickly that we felt they must have been expecting our call. When I asked the concierge if there was a business centre where I could copy my digital photos onto a disk for my sister, I was told no, and then nicely offered directions to a camera shop that would do this for me. We asked the concierge for recommendations on restaurants, and the advice was always excellent: lunches at Trattoria Alla Madonna, and Paradiso, both located near Rialto Bridge, with Paradiso being the better of the two. Antico Martini (located relatively close to the hotel) was the first recommendation from the concierge for a place to go for lunch with Italian friends who were coming to visit from Rome for the day, and we thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience (the house special risotto with scampi and rocket was quite nice and very filling). My wife's birthday dinner at La Cusina was outstanding, though extremely expensive, but worth the experience. We were given a corner table by the window, with a view across the Grand Canal to Santa Maria della Salute. Service was friendly and attentive. One of the waiters even took my wife's mobile phone and charged it for her during our dinner (her charger had stopped working earlier in the trip). Though I had not requested one, a birthday cake with candles was brought out, with four of the staff singing "Happy Birthday" in perfect English. A lady at the table opposite was also celebrating a birthday, and a cake was brought out for her earlier, though the singing was in Italian. Here is where the Westin Europa and Regina Venice really went out of their way in terms of "service": Within five minutes of checking out of the hotel, I received an SMS from British Airways, advising that our 11:25AM flight to London Gatwick had been cancelled. We were subsequently booked on a flight scheduled to depart at 10:25PM that evening. I advised the front desk clerk, who then granted my request to have our room back until the 4:00PM checkout time available to Starwood Gold Preferred Guests. Before actually staying at Westin Europa and Regina Venice, I told my wife there was no way that I would ever pay "real money" to stay there, given the rates the hotel charges. However, after spending five wonderful nights at Westin Europa and Regina Venice, and having experienced the service they provide, I would now gladly book a paid stay at this property should my wife & I ever be fortunate enough to return to Venice, which I found to be the most interesting, fascinating, and unusual city I have ever visited. I find it difficult to understand how some people who have written reviews about Westin Europa and Regina Venice did not enjoy their stay at this property, or could find fault with the service provided by the staff at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Dave1024
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an 8 city European holiday which was great. The Westen Europa & Regina was the most expensive of the hotels we stayed at an offered the least service. Check in took over one hour with the front desk seeming to be irritated at the number of guests. When people complained to the concierge they were moved to the front of the line which caused several guests to become furious. The whole stay was similar to this. The rooms are spacious but worn and nothing I could see about the hotel made it more than a 3 star hotel. I don't minsd paying high prices but when a coke from the honor bar costs $15 and coffee and rolls sent to the room costs $75, and the staff is not even pleasant. Venice is a must see city, but the local people are sick of the thousands of tourists crowding the city. If you have never been to Venice, save some money and stay at a lower priced hotel and you are likely to get better service. If you have been to Vencice your time and Money will be better spent elsewhere in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Westin Europa with our 2 boys booking interconnecting rooms in Mid September. We really enjoyed the hotel and our sons (7 & 12) loved having their own room. Location was perfect and having a drink on the canal in the bar was a treat. Would stay here again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place on The Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: Rinkman
Reviews.Content: The location is very good.......A short but confusing walk off of the Vaporetto. The staff is awesome. All very helpful and it seems like they all enjoy their jobs. Being close to St. Marks is cool, however getting off of the beaten path was 90% of my fun in Venice. I also wrote a review on the Excelsior in Rome and this place is far more exceptional. The only reason I may not stay here is I might want to be a bit away from all the action in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and canal views”
Reviews.Author: KCS_Marketing
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Europa & Regina is the location... you just can't beat having breakfast in an outdoor cafe right on the Grand Canal. The location is at the mouth of the canal, directly opposite Salute. The rooms are fine, and European in style. I've stayed in Venice several times before, so I know the value of having good plumbing and "things that work correctly." Staff is very helpful, and the service is good. It is a convenient location for walking in Venice...close to the Piazza San Marco, but tucked away off the main street so it was quiet and away from throngs of tourists. That was the best thing about the hotel... once you entered it, it did not feel touristy. The hotel arranges taxis to Murano, Lido, and other islands. I wanted to visit La Fenice, the opera house that was closed on my previous visits to Venice. The concierge organized a personal guide for us who was a former manager of the opera house. He was very knowledgable, and gave us a great tour. "One of our friends..." said the concierge. I'd highly recommend the Europa & Regina.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: travelbugbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Aug 26th to 27th. The hotel is just a few minutes walk from St. Marks Square but can be difficult to find if youâ€™re walking from the water bus stop. The hotel room was really nice though we didnâ€™t have a view of the canal. The internet is 10 euros for 24 hours and can be accessed through the TV. We took advantage of the complimentary boat ride to Lido, which was a nice beach but incredibly expensive to use their cabanaâ€™s and beach chairs (ranged from 40 euros. The concierge was always busy (there was usually only one or two) and rarely picked up the phone when we called. Not really up to par with N. American five star standards but this seems to be the case throughout our trip in Italy and Greece.

Reviews.Title: “I consider myself lucky”
Reviews.Author: TravelBunny76
Reviews.Content: I consider myself one of the lucky ones to have experienced the E&R. Pure bliss! Loved taking the hotel's boat service to Lido for beach and pool time. Absolutely divine.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location with beautiful views of the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: icorona
Reviews.Content: The Westin Regina is a beautiful hotel, located on the Grand Canal. St. Mark's Square is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel, through picturesque streets filled with beautiful boutiques and famous designer shops. Our experience with this hotel was a great one. Thankfully, we did not let our apprehensiveness over the negative reviews get in the way and booked this hotel. Since we have travelled extensively during our 23 years of marriage we already know that people staying at the very same hotel, within the same category room, can have a very different experience. Your resolve to not let minor things ruin your overall great experience at this beautiful and well situated hotel can make a big difference as well. Rooms: We were travelling with my parents and had booked 2 Grand Deluxe full canal view rooms that were equally priced. However, since we are Starwood Elite members, our room was upgraded to a master grand canal corner suite (room 250) which had five full windows that offered fantastic canal views, 3 of them with small step out balconies. I have to admit that considering the USD710.00 rate we had paid for our originally booked room, this is what I had expected our room to be like before the upgrade. Had we not been upgraded and been assigned the "Grand Deluxe full canal view room" my parents had (room 254), I would have felt I was not getting good value for the rates charged. Their room was indeed beautifully furnished with Murano glass accents everywhere and a large lavish marble bathroom offering all of the luxuries promised. However, since their "grand deluxe full canal view room" was recessed from the left and right side of the building, it was smaller than the standard size (still large in European standards) and their "full canal view" was limited, not offering the same full canal views that any one window in our room did. Dining: I know this is Venice and that overall Venice is very expensive, and we have been to other cities that can be quite more expensive, but this hotel's restaurant breakfast rate is gastronomical in comparison to any other. In any instance, I believe that paying over USD100.00 for a few simple pastries/rolls & two coffees is not good value for your money. However, I must admit that the magnificent setting of the hotel's restaurant, which offers beautiful 180* views of the grand canal makes it worth having dinner there at least once during your stay. The dinner menu is a little limited, the portions are very small and everything is a la carte, but every entree we tried was very delicious. Definitely better value for your money at dinner. Venture off the Beaten Path: Since we were travelling with my parents, we did not have a chance this time to walk off the beaten tourist path and try some of the restaurants in the more inset areas, but I highly recommend you do so, if possible. The food is significantly more traditional and of good quality, but most important the portion size is more adequate for the prices you are paying. In addition, it is nice to get to see other areas that offer a more authentic perspective of Venice and that are not so populated with tourists. I have to admit I missed that during this trip. Overall: In all fairness, I have to say that our overall experience with the Westin Europa & Regina was a fantastic one. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and if/when we do return to Venice we will most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME, 2 thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: cb333
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in Aug using my starwood pts. It was a memorable stay. We got room 308 which has partial canal view and a nice balcony. Room was clean, beds are comfy, showers are strong. It has a ~30in. LCD tv too. Staffs were very helpful. Location is so prime it's 3 min walk to st.mark's square. I would for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanielowe
Reviews.Content: You couldnt ask for a better location in all of Venice! The hotel is right on the canal and is the prefect setting to unwind with a glass of wine or a wonderful meal! My husband and I loved this hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Views of Canal”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegirl35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights and we absolutely loved it. When we first booked in I didnt like our room (in the old part) and when I politely requested a change of room to the newer part, they changed it promptly and with a smile even though they were heavily booked out. The view of the canal from the eating areas are spectacular and I found the food to be very good. The location was excellent and very quite at night. Very comfortable bed and lovely decor.I had read quite a few average reviews before I booked, but I found the hotel to be charming and value for money.I would strongly suggest finding a room rate which includes breakfast,as I believe they are very expensive.I loved it and can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location - But Better Value if using Starpoints!!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferKarol
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of the Daneli (another Starwood property) and the Europa and Regina we decided to stay at the Europa and Regina because the reviews were slightly better. This hotel is in a great location (you can take a water taxi to the front door, worth every expensive penny) and has an old world charm. Our favorite things were follows: 1. Great location, not in the middle of the square but a 1 minute walk 2. The rooms were a good size 3. Nice exercise room 4. Great decor in the main rooms of the hotel Our least favorite things 1. The most overpriced breakfast buffet in the world (and you can order off the normal menu, but they don't tell you this unless you ask, so ASK! unless you want to pay $200 USD for an average breakfast) 2. I later learned that we should have requested to stay in the renovated rooms. We were in an older room, and the air was not great. However, I heard this is not a problem in the newer rooms. 3. The staff was not that courteous, and they will NOT change your roomâ€¦ no matter how much you try. Overall, we would return to Venice, but may try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: NYNann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Europa and Regina at the end of our cruise. It was worth every penny we spent for a beautiful view of the Grand Canal. Service was excellent. We had booked a water taxi to take us to the airport. I asked the concierge to confirm it. There was no response so he ordered one for us which was 20 euro's cheaper than the one we had booked ourselves. We were given a complimentary bottle of champagne when I mentioned it was our 30th wedding anniversary. The location is excellent - close to St Mark's Square so we could stroll down there several times during the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The buffet breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “enjoy the uniqueness of Venice........”
Reviews.Author: travelloveraus
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the port where our water taxi was supposed to be picking us up. After a few mins I rang and spoke to the concierge at Westin Europa - Lamberto - remember that name, he apologised and reassured us that our taxi was on its way - it arrived within 10 mins. Upon arrival we were shown to reception whilst our luggage was taken by the doormen. Check in was carried out efficiently and we were shown to our 2 rooms - Canal view with small balconies. High ceilings with magnificent chandeliers, huge plasma tvs with internet access, gorgeous bathrooms with lots of fluffy towels and robes and lovely toileteries... housekeeping did a great job at turndown - a bottle of water and chocolates and slippers each night...the beds were very comfortable with gorgeous linen... the hotel was very expensive - coffee was ok, we had dinner one night and it was way over priced and small servings. Breakfast was included in our package and was fine, quite a good variety of hot and cold food. Staff were trying to please and did speak good english but you could sense that at times they were feeling stressed - poorly trained or just not in the right job ? all in all a beautiful hotel in a grand city....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place for 40th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: bobali
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews of the Westin E&R and they could not have been more wrong - or we were very lucky! I logged on as a Starwood Hotel Preferred Guest as a previous reviewer had mentioned and - yes when we arrived they asked us if we were members ( I have never used them before) - I gave them my email address and we were promptly given a SPG room on the 3rd floor. The manager also sent up a bottle of house bubbly on the first evening with a message wishing me happy birthday ! Absolutely beautiful - large king bed - robes - turndown service -large bathroom with shower and bath - etc etc. We were celebrating my 40th birthday and I particularly wanted to go to Venice. A Few Good Facts; Location - 100 yards from St Marks - situated on the Grand Canal Conceirge - Excellent - friendly and knowledgable Rooms - large and very well kept Breakfast - Ours was included in the trip price through Thomas Cook - it normally costs 52 euro per person - do not pay that - if it is included - enjoy - we certainly did. Buffet type lay out with all manner of fruits/breads/juices/bubbly for Bucks Fizz/freshly squeezed OJ/meats/cheeses etc etc - sat on the Grand Canal nothing could be more perfect. Arrival - get a Private Water Taxi 90 euros each way - we felt like movie stars - you also do not have to try and get through the crowds with your suit cases etc - everywhere you looked people were with maps trying to find their hotels whilst pulling their cases out of other peoples way. The water taxi takes you straight to the hotel pier and they whisk your luggage away. A Few Bad Facts; Harrys Bar is a complete rip off - staff and service was snooty and not worth the money - sit at the bar and it is slightly cheaper without the 12% service charge of a waiter bringing you your Bellini all of 4 steps !!! Husband eaten by mossies Hundreds of tourists day tripping so get out early and explore - best advice we had was just try and get lost and you'll see the real Venice - we certainly did - Go off the beaten track - the food is cheaper the shops are better and the people are going about their daily business - fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Old world glamour, but poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Wilderhillgirl
Reviews.Content: The Westin Europa is a well located hotel beautifully appointed in old world glamour. Our arrival by water taxi from the airport was fairly uneventful with no concierge to greet us. However, check in was prompt and courteous. As a general statement I do not mind paying high prices but I do expect that the accompanying service, quality of food, quality of the experience should match the price paid - this was not the case at the Westin Europa. Admittedly we were staying in peak tourist season but we were paying Euro 600 per night and so expected a full on luxury experience - I don't believe that this is what we received. We dined one night in the terraced restaurant and thought that the food was very poor especially for the price we paid. Equally the breakfast the following morning was a very disappointing experience. We had to wait to get a table on an over crowded terrace. Then we had to wait even longer to get a simple cup of coffee. Prices for breakfast were outrageous for what I would consider a good but not spectacular breakfast buffett. There was absolutely no sense of luxury about our dining experiences. The accomodation was spacious and generous both in the bedroom and bathroom. The only disappointment was the shower which for a five star room was a real let down. There was hardly any water pressure from the shower head and the bath that one stood in for a shower was tiny. All in all, a very well appointed comfortable hotel in a highly touristy part of the world but I certainly didn't think we received value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast (price) shock”
Reviews.Author: SantaBarbaraAtze
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel and location directly at Canale Grande. A continental braekfast at USD 30/pp and american USD 52/pp is not reasonable and justified. Bar prices are by comparison very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkangel6
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception at the Western Europa Regina, the food, wine, champagne & service was excellent! Nothing was too much for them, they were really friendly and made us all feel comfortable and welcome at all times. We had a party of 26 and was meant to have the terrace that other people at the hotel would share and we were going to be separated by a screen. I met with the manager of the hotel and assistants the day before we were married, the manager offered us the main terrace because he had no one booked on our day, that terraceis normally for large partys, he offered it to us with a choice of chairs, table clothes , napkins , flowers etc, this was not in our price and they did not charge any extra, he really made our day special.l We stayed the night at the hotel, we had a room over looking the grand canal, you just cannot get married in Venice and not wake up over looking the grand canal! lol! oh it was splendid! I wanted to pinch myself! everytime I woke up I would go to the window and look at the splendid views. The room was excellent! views. cleanliness excellent! room service excellent! only problem was that I did not find the woman very helpful that showed us the room and she tried to charge us again the next morning! lucky my co- ordinator appeared!!! So the down side was that all nite I was thirsty and I could not find the drinks cabinet/fridge. Wish I had taken more advantage of the room service. So overall, expensive, but worth every euro. Trully wonderful experience. Hopefully we will be going back again this year for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Europa and Regina”
Reviews.Author: 2Cows
Reviews.Content: The Westin was beautiful, staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was a little hard to find, but then again, many places are hard to find in Venice. Overall a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HoveGraham
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay in Venice at this hotel and I loved it. Yes the check in staff could be a little quicker and yes it could be hard to find (best to get a water taxi from the airport direct to the pontoon at the front of the hotel!) but on the whole I think this hotel is perfect. At check in (as I am a Starwood Guest member) I got an upgraded room without having to ask, aand boy what a room. it was enormous (particularly for a city centre hotel) and although it wasn't with a canal view, it had a lot of hanging space and a huge bathroom, all important to my fiance! It's position is fantastic, sitting ON the grand canal in the evening having a drink in the hotel bar and watching the world (or more precisely the Japanese tourists) float by cannot be beaten, and also it's proximity to St Marks Square makes it easy to find at the end of the days sightseeing. All in all a great choice if you can, or want to, afford it.

Reviews.Title: “A front row seat at the best show in town”
Reviews.Author: UKPaulG
