Reviews.Content: Although choices of hotels are extremely subjective, especially in special places like Venice, many of its aspects make this hotel totally sublime. The first (and best) is its location: directly onto the Grand Canal, opposite Santa Maria della Salute and at the point where the Canal opens out into the lagoon. Breakfast, drinks, lunch and dinner can be taken on the terraces overlooking the mesmerising activity of a busy day and night on Veniceâ€™s main highway. And (if like us) youâ€™re fortunate to have a room with a canal view you certainly wonâ€™t be watching the huge flat screen TV. Your window will provide you with the very best in entertainment, both humorous and dramatic. Your water taxi drops you off at the landing at the â€˜frontâ€™ of the hotel. And you can leave by the discrete door at the â€˜backâ€™ that leads onto a peaceful square with ivy-clad walls. The overall serenity is surprising considering that you are just a five-minute walk past eye-watering expensive designer shops to the mayhem of the Piazza St Marco. The next important aspect is the staff. We found them all to be friendly, helpful and polite. Our Italian is limited to menus and the usual greetings but the concierges and waiters answered our enquiries and orders clearly, correctly and, always, with plenty of Italian charm. Food is a particularly personal matter but the breakfasts offered something for every appetite from fruit and yoghurt to scrambled eggs, sausages, sautÃ© potatoes and fried tomatoes. All washed down with freshly squeezed juices, powerful coffee or iced prosecco. Obviously we also tried Veniceâ€™s tempting cafes and restaurants but lunch and dinner at the hotel was an amazing experience: tasty, thoughtfully prepared food served up with that unbeatable view. Iâ€™ve gone into some detail because there has been serious criticism of the Europa & Regina on this site. In terms of bedrooms, Iâ€™m afraid I always go for ambience over air-conditioning but the room seemed to offer all the stuff that picky travellers require: lots of pillows, fridge, power showers, towelling wraps, hair-dryers, pens, notepaper, and free goodies in the bathroom. Iâ€™m sure other similar hotels offer most of what Iâ€™ve described and some may be â€˜coolerâ€™ in decoration and attitude but very, very few offer the best luxury in Venice â€“ a front row seat on the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but some issues...”
Reviews.Author: v102377
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Europa & Regina from April 20, 2007 through April 23, 2007. We cashed in our Starwood points for a three night stay. We took the vaporetto (water bus) into Venice from the airport and got off at St. Markâ€™s Square. It took us a little while to find the hotel because it was our first time in Venice and the streets were a bit confusing to navigate. Hint: if you ask for directions, indicate that you are looking for the â€œEuropaâ€� and not the â€œWestin.â€� If you take the water taxi from the airport, they will drop you off directly at the hotel. The Good: The hotel is lovely, but the best thing is its terrific location! Minutes to St. Markâ€™s square, wonderful shopping, and the Rialto bridge area. Both the room and the bathroom were a good size for European standards. Also very close to vaporetto stops, Accademia bridge, and many restaurants. The Not so Good: We also had problems with temperature in our room like the previous reviewers. We learned that the hotels in Venice do not turn on the ACs in guestrooms until June 1st. This was fine since it was quite cool outside and we would not have minded just having our windows open. However, there are no screens on the windows in the hotel and we had a huge problem with mosquitoes coming into our room, which was no surprise since Venice is surrounded by water. After waking up with numerous mosquito bites after the first night, we opted to leave the windows closed for the remainder of our stay which made the room extremely stuffy. Another thing that bothered me a bit was the numerous dirty spots on the wall covering. Not something youâ€™d expect from a pricey hotel. Overall, we did like this hotel. However, if I had paid the regular room prices, which can be quite high, I would probably have been a bit disappointed. I would recommend this hotel because of its great location, but only if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “woooow”
Reviews.Author: xsho_shox
Reviews.Content: it was a wonderful stay & we like it so much. the room was perfect & the bathroom was so nice . the hotel is beter than the other hotels in that area. we enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Westin Europa & Regina Venice”
Reviews.Author: JonBaxter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at many Westin hotels.Â  We have enjoyed our stays and would recommend almost any of them.Â  However, the Westin Europa & Regina in Venice is not one of those.Â  A few minor issues: very small rooms, small bathrooms, no a/c, and problems with water temperature. Our major issue: We had done research on restaurants in Venice.Â  We asked our conceirge to help us pick 2 from our list -Â we wanted 2 romantic restaurants with good food.Â  For the first dinner, he recommended one not on our list.Â  This restaurant - Alla Revetta - was a family style/kid-friendly restaurant.Â  Everyone sits at cramped tables and share with 2-4 other people.Â  We shared our table with 2 different couples that we had never met.Â  It was uncomfortable.Â  Also, the food quality was poor.Â  For the second dinner, he recommended one on our list - Corte Sconta.Â  He "called" (while we stood at the desk) and he "made reservations".Â  He lied to us.Â  When we showed up, the restaurant was closed!Â  In fact, they had been closed for the last 2 days!Â  He had lied to our faces.Â Â I don't think that he ever called anyone, but was just pretending. We complained to the conceirge manager.Â  He apologized and was genuinely shocked at what this conceirge had done.Â  He made the conceirge apologize to us.Â  He also gave us a gift - a gift basket with alcohol and a cakeÂ leftover from Easter!!Â  In fact, it still had an Easter greeting card on the basket!Â  This was his idea of compensating us for ruining our dinner plans on our only nights in Venice. I had read other poor reviews about this hotel, I should have heeded their warning.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: rb1410
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 3 days in Venice to celebrate my Wife's 50th birthday. First time for us and we were not disapointed. On arrival at the hotel, was immediately impressed with the location. Right at the start of the Grand canal, and near to St .Marks Square ( a 5 minute walk). The interior of this hotel is luxurious. Our room was every thing we could have wished for, large, immaculate and elegant with a view right across the canal. Had dinner in the hotel one night and and the food /service was excellent. Even a birthday cake courtesy of the hotel (nice touch !). After dinner , there was a nice lounge to sit and have a drink. The piano player in the lounge was really friendly, chatting to everyone and playing all kinds of music. Really nice atmosphere. Yes it was expensive in this hotel, but what isn't in Venice. For a special occasion it was worth the extra to make it a memorable weekend. All in all a great trip, loved every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Where to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: TennisNutDallas
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night holiday to Venice...staying at the Westin Europa-Regina Hotel. After reading many more "negative" reviews about this hotel on this site I almost canceled my reservation and found another place to stay. I AM SO GLAD I DID NOT!! From first arrival at the Europa-Regena (after 12 hours enroute to Venice from Dallas, TX) we were greeted warmly and with smiles. The front desk folks were not only efficent in checking us in, but the front desk receptionist personally escorted us to our assigned room. My god it was even better than we expected or anticipated. During our entire stay the staff was overly helpful, friendly & accomodating...always with a smile (and not with their hands outstretched for a tip). As "seniors" in life, this trip was my Lady's dream before we..... The Westin Europa-Regina fulfilled every wish & expectation we hoped for. To all the other people who have written "negative" reviews/comments about this property...well, I wonder if you stayed at the same hotel. If you would like more or my experience please don't hesitate to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul71
Reviews.Content: The Europa and Regina definitely lived up to what I expected from the Westin line of hotels....beautifully decorated, with a friendly staff and well appointed rooms that are large compared to other European hotels I have stayed at in the past. The room itself was very comfortable and also very well decorated, however the bathroom was definitely on the "small" size...not what I typically expect from a Westin, and there was no refrigerator in the room, which would have been a nice addition. Also, be advised that if you are traveling in the fall/winter/early spring, the air conditioning will not operate and there are no screens in the windows, leaving me with a couple mosquito bites by the end of my trip, as the room did get quite warm and the windows needed to be left open quite often. Overall though if you're looking for a "luxury" hotel and aren't on a fixed budget, the Europa and Regina is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: claribaggles
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon to Venice for 4 nights. Having looked at the Westin website, we thought it would be a nice, plush place to stay for first week of marriage. How wrong we were! The staff at the reception desk were unfriendly, we were brought to our room and we couldn't stay in it - it was smelly and dirty, paint coming off the walls and black streaks along the walls, bulbs not working,small room for what we paid! When we were moved to a second room, it was OK! This is a five star hotel seemingly, but the only thing we found five star about it was it's price! It ruined our honeymoon - do not stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great value but location is great - very disappointed for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: El_Jefe_de_viaje
Reviews.Content: I am the classic example of the "Tragedy of the Commons" - someone who has used this site extensively to plan travel yet never has taken the time to contribute. So it should be some indication that I am contributing this review of the Westin Regina & Europe, Venice. It has motivated me to warn others of very poor value! I read the reviews prior to going and thought, "but it is a Westin..it can't be that bad." It was, as long as you are in the wrong part of the hotel. My major issue: Value for the money. I had a 50% off discount and still paid 352EUR per night Dec 27-30. OK, it is Venice and a 5 star property. But what about a 50EUR breakfast (200 EUR for our little family of 4?!) or a 125EUR per night roll away bed charge? Outrageous. I have stayed in numerous Luxury Collection locations with Starwood around Europe (including the fabulous Hotel Grande Bretagne in Athens) and never run into rates like this, at a Westin brand no less. But what disappointed me most is that, despite being "upgraded" to an Executive Room via my Gold SPG status, we walked into a room that was as "tired" as any I have stayed in over the past 5 years, and we have been a lot of places around the world. It was large and the bathroom was splendid, but the paint had marks all over each wall, the carpet was extremely worn, and I can't even begin to describe the chairs in the room - they had sags in the seats that would put the Grand Canyon to shame! I stay with Starwood extensively and have never had an issue with the quality of a Westin, until now. After 2 nights in that room (415), I asked the desk yet again if they had something nicer. A nice lady at the front desk showed me to two other rooms, one with a partial view and another "Executive Room." These rooms, however, were in a newly (10 yrs ago) refurbished wing of the hotel (something I had asked about twice and been told, no, the entire hotel is the same age). It was SO MUCH nicer. It was quality we were initially expecting and we were very pleased with that room (room 110), complete with its own sitting room with couch and separate bedroom. Yes, it was a bit smaller, but the quality fo the room was so much better. My advice: if you can qualify for an complimentary upgrade, ensure you get an Executive Room, at a minimum. And ask for a room in the wing "Casa Tiepolo." Otherwise, the location is superb - literally steps from an uncrowded Gondola location, a beautiful little church, all the brands (Prada, etc.) you could ever want, and maybe 400 meters from Piazza San Marco. VERY quiet. A water taxi from the Communale parking garage was 60EUR each way and drops you right at Westin's dock on the Canal Grande (don't park on the top level at Communale for visitors - try to push to get on a "private" deck lower down where there are more cameras, much more space, and less traffic - seems much more safe). It is directly across from a magnificent church, one of the best examples of Baroque in the world, Madonna della Salute.

Reviews.Title: “A few 'bugs' but as good as you can expect in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pasquali
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at at the Regina in Venice for three nights in October. The first room they gave us was spacious, but had mold, cracked paint, etc. I was fine with it, but my wife wasn't. So we moved to a much smaller room that was in better condition. But that wasn't the end of our problem. It was warm in Venice, kind of an Indian summer. They had turned off the air conditioning in the entire hotel and our room was very stuffy at night. So we opened the window to let some cooler air in. The next morning we woke up with terrible mosquito bites. We called downstairs and told them about the problem, but they said there was nothing they could do, because they couldn't turn the AC on. They did send someone up with bug spray. The next two nights there we kept the windows closed and had a tough time sleeping because it was so muggy inside. With that said, I don't think these problems are unique to this hotel. We talked to others in Venice who had similar problems at their hotels. I think it's the nature of Venice. On the positive side, the buffet breakfast at the hotel was fantastic, as was the location. I also worked out in their workout room, and it was clean and well-equipped. Bottom line: We loved Venice, but not the hotel -- although we readily admit that it was probably still as nice as we could find in Venice. I just wish they would put mosquito nets on the windows, so you can still keep the windows open at night and not get eaten alive! Bring bug spray and you'll probably be okay.

Reviews.Title: “excellet accomodation, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Miciogatto
Reviews.Content: We booked through their website a canal view room for just one night, but once arrived and entered their membership program we were upgraded into the most beautiful suite I have ever stayed in Venice, with 360Â° view of the city, huge terrace, lage living room and recently refurbished bathroom with bath tube and separate shower. Excellent short weekend!

Reviews.Title: “smells”
Reviews.Author: venice1234
Reviews.Content: The Westin Europa and Regina hotel was a very nice hotel, however I do have two concerns/comments. Our stay was from August 17th-20th and during that time it started to rain a small amount on Friday and heavier rain on Sat. Our room #564 was on the top floor, which was an "upgrade" we received upon arrival. There was an odor in the hallway on Friday evening. On Saturday, when we returned in the late afternoon the smell in the hallway was very strong, requiring us to open the window/door. This did not alleviate the problem. Finally, by late evening the smell was bad enough-I called the front desk and was told, I quote "It's Venice, it's old." I explained that it wasn't an old smell but a sewer type smell coming out of the A. C. unit or the pipes draining by the side door/window. The front desk's solution was to send someone up with a can of freshener for me to spray (which was almost empty), this only added a flowery layer to the putrid odor that persisted throughout the night, making it extremely difficult to sleep. We checked out the following morning. It's important to note that the other floors did not have the smell because we would walk down the 5 floors instead of using the elevator. Additionally, you have to enter the hotel from a side street, which had the feel of an alley. Mainly because it was very dark and empty. No one was in the courtyard, which would concern me if I were alone or for the sake of other visitor's safety, i.e. an older couple or young women.

Reviews.Title: “Grubby rooms and outdated bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Graham54
Reviews.Content: I took the wife for a birthday weekend break in February 2006. We arrived at the hotel's Jetty by Water taxi from the airport - a very stylish way to arrive. Check in was fine - we were uograded because I'd logged on to westin frequent stayer programme the night before we left. The room was average at best - the bed was good but the decor looked tired and certainly needed modernising and the carpet could do with an upgrade. The bathroom looked like it hadn't been upgraded since the 70's. The hotel is well located 2 minutes from San Marco and fronting the grand canal. We went to have drinks on a couple of terraces of the best hotels in Venice which were wonderful spots to watch the world go by. This hotels canal terrace looked tired.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: mica178
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Europa & Regina after a horrible experience at the Hotel des Bains on Venice Lido. What a lovely change! We were automatically upgraded to a junior suite, which was on the top floor and had a view of the Campinile and the rooftops of the local buildings. The suite was large with 1.5 marble bathrooms, a complete sitting room and a very large closet. The smell was typical for Venice, but everything else was fantastic. The location right off Piazza San Marco was great, for the romantic, there is a gondola stop right outside the main entrance. I would happily stay there again if there's no room in the Danieli.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-par experience”
Reviews.Author: winedoc
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend this property if you expect 5 star service. The front desk and conciege leaves quite a bit to be desired. We were given a room in the depths of the hotel with 3 flights of stairs that were difficult to navigate with a baby stroller. Upon requesting another room, we were rudely suggested that we go to another hotel. I reminded them that I was Starwood Platinum. She wasn't impressed. Oh well, is it possible that we have become accustomed to European "rudeness" or spoiled Americans??? This property is fine in comparison to other properties in Venice. The snooty, rude service is unacceptable at this lofty price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jde1905
Reviews.Content: We have just had a fabulous holiday in breathtakingly beautiful Venice. I arranged this five day trip to as a surprise for my Husband's 30th Birthday. After booking this hotel, I then read remarks that were non too favourable about this hotel. It turned out I had absolutely nothing to worry about at all. The hotel itself is very grand, perfectly placed with the most fantastic views. The staff were excellent and my request for a complimentary room upgrade was honoured to a fantastic canal view room (the Europa side) with a small balcony. The food was all of the highest standard both at breakfast but especially in the evening when it was presented and served beautifully. This hotel certainly does deserve its five star rating! Wouldn't have changed a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappoinment”
Reviews.Author: winniesue
Reviews.Content: recently traveled to many parts of italy and The Westin Europa Regina was our last stop and the Hotel I was looking forward to staying at the most. Was I ever surprised. Our room really needed a serious make over. The hallway to our room was dirty old and ugly. My daughter and her husband on the other hand had a beautiful room very large with a great view in a different much cleaner section. We had dinner what was written up in Frommers as a fantastic restaurant. It was awful and so expensive. Grant you we would have not minded if the food was good. The concierges were cranky and not helpful at all. The outside bar was beautiful . I have stayed in many Westins around the world and they were all superior I am not sure what happened to this one. I cannot beleive they call themselves a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect wedding reception & 1st night hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmmaWoodward
Reviews.Content: We got married in Venice on 10th August and our reception at this hotel completed a perfect day. We were welcomed off our water taxi by numerous staff - v.helpful as we had a baby & a great grandma in our party! We were shown to our enormous private reception area (complete with garden, private balcony terrace with views of Santa Maria), which we were v.impressed with, as there were only 14 of us! Our drinks & canapes were delicious & the meal out of this world. (I'm vegetarian & have never eaten such fantastic food before). The service was v.friendly (the waiters particularly loved our nephew & kept him entertained with colouring in sheets), and efficient - we had at least 3 dedicated waiters who ensured our (already paid for) wine glasses were kept full all night! After courses 7 courses & a beautful Italian wedding cake, we waved our families off & went up to our room. We received a free upgrade to a 4th floor room with views of Santa Maria, the room was fabulous! V.large, great bed, fab bathroom & plenty of wardrobe space for my v.long wedding dress! We also received a free bottle of bubbly & Tuscan chocolates & a wlecome letter from the manager which was lovely. We had a great 3 course breakfast on the terrace over the Grand Canal in the morning, I'm gald we didn't opt for breakfast in bed as the view was amazing! Again the staff were v.friendly & attentive. As you can probably tell, we loved this hotel & are already planning our return visit for our 1 year anniversary next year! Emma & Steve Woodward (PS: If anyone is thinking of getting married in Italy, we used Italia Romantica as our planners and they were fantastic.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RacingFan2006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our two teenage kids spent two nights at this hotel at the end of July. We took advantage of Westinâ€™s Famtastic program where the second room is Â½ price for accompanying children. We had two huge connecting rooms with a canal view and could not have been more pleased with the accommodations. Even though it was very hot outside, the air conditioning worked extremely well in both rooms. In our view, this hotel had a very nice classy feel to it. We were torn between the Hotel Danieli and this and we're glad we picked this one. The Europa has a much better outdoor breakfast area close to the water which we enjoyed every morning. The staff was very friendly to us, especially the crew that worked the breakfast shift. We had been traveling through Italy by rented car and especially liked Westinâ€™s program in Venice. They have an arrangement with Hertz whereby you just pull up in front and they valet park the car (in their own secured area). They call a porter who we followed to the water taxi and who handled all the luggage. It was painless. We enjoyed this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Venice, Italy: Westin Europa Regina: We just returned from our honeymoon in Italy. Among the various cities we visited, we stayed 3nights at the Westin Europa in Venice. This is supposed to be a luxury and classy hotel (NOT SO); we have never expericed such poor service anywhere. The doorman didn't even bother to open the door for us much less help with the luggage. To begin with, we had a wonderful view of what was probably the oldest and dirtiest wall in Venice. Our overpriced room was nice but had a broken a/c and we were forced to change rooms a 1o'clock in the morning to another room that barely had a/c. The following morning while enjoying a beautiful looking fruit salad, I found a worm crawling in it. I reported this incident to the waitor who thought it was funny and apologized almost laughing about it (it was not funny); I proceeded to report this to the kitchen manager and he too didn't think it was such a big deal and while the hotel manager was very apologetic, nothing was done to make us feel any better. This hotel was certainly not worth the $300 per night.....a Holiday Inn would have been much better!! Overall....don't waste your money at this hotel; it calls itself a luxury hotel but it has absolutely no class at all.

Reviews.Title: “crabby staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife and i were there for three days for our honeymoon. We found the staff to be uncooperative and very negative to us. When we tried to cash some american express travelers checks, the cashier said he couldn't cash them even though my wife signed them right in front of him. we asked to speak with the manager who was equally not helpful. upon our return to san francisco we filed a complaint to starwood who requested a response from the manager. we got a one sentence response saying there must have been a communications problem. the rooms were in need of updating and repair. not what we expected for $800 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Toadman
Reviews.Content: The Westin E&R is in a great location on the Grand Canal. It's not in the mayhem of San Marco but just a very short 3 minute walk to San Marco. We had a very nice room on the 6th floor in the Europa wing with a view of the canal. The king size bed was very comfortable and the turn down service was great. They left us slippers by our bed and mints every night. We left the window open and had no issues with bugs. The room was much larger than the other hotels that we stayed at in Italy save for the Marriott on Capri. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffett is quite extensive but it's very pricey. I believe it was Euros 40/pp and we only did it our last day there because of an early flight out of Venice. We would definitely stay here again our next time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Europa Fanstastic”
Reviews.Author: paulsurf
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nites prior to Cruise in a partial canal view deluxe. Arrived early at 11:30 AM and they took us immediatley to the 5 th floor Europa..This hotel was booked!!. The room was about 20 by 25 feet ..extremely large with a foyer , bathroom marble from floor and walls with coffered ceiling ( very classy) Furnishing very nice . Two double windows with small ledge and great canal view. We did not dine at the Europa( went to the La Terrazza roof top at the Danieli, Cips Club at the Cipriani and Fiaschetteria Toscana) but had lunch first day. Came back after dinner each nite and had drinks and a cigar on the deck outside. The service was first class.....I highly recommend this hotel for the location, accomodations,view and the service !!!

Reviews.Title: “westin europa and regina”
Reviews.Author: cdo
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the westin europa and regina for 2 days end of may. horrible experience!. When re arrived much exhaused from flying, we had reservations, (made way back in novemember) for 2 rooms. much to our dismay they told us that they only had 1 of the rooms. (and the hotel was booked). i understand things like that happen, but the manner in which we were treated was unacceptable! when we have had other problems in traveling with reservations (and we have), most "reputable" hotels will say something like, "why don't you go into the lounge, have a drink on us while we settle this matter". oh no, not the westin. they made us wait around for a hour or so, only to come back to say we can put you up in another hotel!!! (that meant moving all our luggage (AGAIN) onto the water taxi, and with NO UPGRADE FOR THE INCONVENIENCE!!! so after a shouting match (normally not our style, but VERY TIRED) and 2 hours later, we had our rooms. which by the way were DEFINATELY not worth the money. this hotel's public rooms are very nice but our rooms were worn and dingy. not what you wouold expect from a westin property!!! Be prepared to shell out LOTS of cash in venice. We never mind spending LOTS of money while on vacation, but in my opinion, venice is WAY overpriced for what you get. We had 2 cokes and a snack on the terrace... it came out to about 15 euros for a coke! oh and one final (sorry so long) the other room that our traveling friends had... it appears she got bug bites...... sorry guys, find another hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night and they upgraded our room for no extra charge. They said it was their gift to us. We already got a tremendous deal on the room we booked (40%), so this was definitely an added bonus. The grand canal terrace dining was lovely. Prices are expensive, but it's San Marco in Venice, that's what you should expect. The food and drinks were really good and the staff was kind. The service is slow, but again that is expected in Italy. The location was convenient and I would recommend this hotel looking for an american hotel in venice. I would also suggest searching booking['']for a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Was OK...”
Reviews.Author: PeckCheck
Reviews.Content: We took the Vaporetto from the station and checked into the Regina and Europa Hotel right by P.San Marco, mostly because we have Starwood membership and could stay there with points. The first room (in the Regina part) that they showed us was absolutely dreadful, and I mean DREADFUL. The room was small, dark and dirty, with worn thready carpets, tired bedding and a dark and dingy bathroom, all accompanied by a strange odor. The view was non-existant. We definitely expected something much better from this purported member of the "luxury collection" of the Starwood chain. We immediately requested a new room, and they moved us to a renovated room in the Europa portion of the hotel. This made a huge difference. This difference in room quality was made clear when we learned that this used to be two separate hotels until Westin purchased them and made them into one property. The rooms in Europa have been renovated, whereas the rooms in Regina have not, and they are clearly inferior. Our new room was a corner room, and though there still wasnâ€™t much of a view, at least it was more spacious and more importantly, it was clean. The marble bathroom was also quite nice, though there were some obvious mold issues. The only glitch was that the air-conditioner wasnâ€™t working that first night, and we couldnâ€™t really open the windows because of the mosquitoes. We called downstairs and they actually told us that the A/C wouldnâ€™t be on until June, due to some technical difficulties. And then inexplicably, it started working on the second night. Overall, we found the staff rather condescending and minimally helpful. It was as though they were doing us a favor by letting us stay at their hotel. I have stayed at numerous luxury hotels in the past, and I have yet to encounter a more aloof and haughty concierge staff. However, the location cannot be any better. It's literally two minutes (with luggage) from the vaporetto station(Vallaresso), and it's located in a quiet courtyard. The bar is nice, right on the Grand Canal, though the piano can be quite loud. The piano player/singer had an unfortunate habit of singing American songs badly, and I was sorely tempted to slip him a few Euros just to keep him quiet....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: satkin02
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Location is superb (right on the Grand Canal minutes from St. Mark's) and the room we were given was really spacious, clean, and nicely furnished. The piano bar was beautiful as was the open air deck where you could sit and enjoy a drink while watching the hive of activity on the Grand Canal. Very convenient when arriving by water taxi too (expensive)...you can be dropped off right at the door. Breakfast was excellent but expensive at 50E per person for the buffet. On the downside, the sink in the bathroom kept clogging which was annoying but not major. More disappointingly, the music in the boisterous piano bar went until about midnight every night and you could clearly hear it in our room. I don't understand why a hotel would generate their OWN noise that might affect one of their guest's sleep. Lastly, the staff were professional but quite cool and aloof...not welcoming at all. It was as if they served you but felt that they were better than you while doing so. This was especially the case with the conscierge staff. BTW, the bar (because of the location) and restaurant were really expensive for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid March. The first room we were given was very poor. Old worn carpet & the walls were all marked up. Very disappointing. We requested a different room & were given one which was much better. The staff was very polite. The area is very convenient to get around. Close to shopping & food. Easy to get around & we felt very safe in the area. If I had not been assigned to the 1st room, I would have given a higher score. All in all, I would stay there again, mainly due to it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Feb 2006. Generally excellent service and accomodation. Food average and breakfast expensive. Many of your negative reviews, I notice, date from one or two years ago and don't recognise them from the stay my wife and I had. To your reviewers who complain about the service, might I say that you are in one of the most famous cities in the World? Asking the concierge about good restaurants and locations? Get a grip. Get a guidebook. Get a map, for goodness' sake! BTW, most Italians at the least appreciate one making the effort to speak the language. Get a phrasebook.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel in Sept. 2005. The property location near St. Marco Square made it accessible & easy to walk & back forth from the square at any time. As a SPG Gold member, I was given an upgrade overlooking the canal. The lovely room was quite large & well decorated. The bathroom was also large. A bonus for a woman! The hotel is well kept & very clean. The opportunity to dine by the canal was lovely and the view divine. The restaurant staff was very accomodating. As was the bar staff. The concierge can be better versed on day trips- to occupy a traveller- especially one travelling alone. Good thing the GM thought of everything & took the liberty to include a "what-to-do in Venice" site-seeing card in each room. (The GM must also enjoy traveling & maximizing travel taking in the sites. His genuine thoughtfulness to reach out to guests goes beyond education. Bravo!) Thank you for a lovely stay. I hope the next one is better!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel/wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Excellent staff - very helpful. The room was huge - we had an upgrade. The complimentary boat trip to Murano was a big plus as well. The food was wonderful as well - I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: myview
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed here as part of the final leg of our honeymoon. We were very happy with the hotel. I called in advance to see if there was any chance of having a complimentary upgrade as it was our honeymoon. On arrival, we discovered that we had been upgraded and also had champagne and chocolates in our room, so we got off to a great start. The location of the hotel is excellent for exploring Venice as it is about 5 minutes from St Mark's Square. We enjoyed drinks in the evening watching the sunset over the Grand Canal, although the bar "tab" was quite painful! An excellent place with very helpful staff. Very much recommended. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Divine suite”
Reviews.Author: AnselmoDelBanco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Europa & Regina hotel. Room was magnificent, facing Canal Grande, and with a huge balcony! Decor is regal, bathroom is beautiful, bed are...well, heavenly! Service was patchy. Beware from the concierge who wil try and get a tip out of you. He actually run after us on the street after we checked out, reminding us that he found the address of a glass shop (which incidently was wrong!) hinting he should be tipped for this service (which required him to open the phonebook). Otherwise, no complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: evsie
Reviews.Content: Impresive entrance from the Grand Canal with own private dock. Public rooms all marble floors and fine furniture & art. Reception staff and concierge all helpful and speak english to varying degrees. had to change room on arrival and had personal help from reception manager who accompanied us to our new room and successfully arranged our luggage quickly to our new room. The Tiepalo bar and La Cusina restuarant both have terraces that are on the edge of the Grand canal. Breakfast is fantastic in this stunning location. The restuarant is expensive in line with most of Venice's good eating places. Cheaper snacks can be had in the Tieple bar and some evening entertainment is the norm here. The hotel is an easy 5 minute walk to St Mark's Square with all the attractions of shops, restuarants and free string quartet music if you only stand and listen without sitting down and buying something. Location of the hotel means you can beat the queues by going early and also beat the the day trippers arriving on the cruise boats to see the main sites in St. Mark's and the Doges Palace. The queues can be quite long!! Hotel has a good fitness room. Safes are free of charge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Wonderfully”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Venice. We used Starwood points for the stay and were treated superbly. Our original stay was planned for five nights; however, we decided to extend it another three and wanted to keep our room. The staff managed to do some fancy switching and accorded the request. It was then that we found we had been upgraded to one of the largest rooms in the hotel. The hotel benefits were 1. great location - about 5 minutes from Piazza San Marco, 2. the room was exceedingly large with a very large walk in closet and very large bathroom, 3. we had a partial lagoon view, 4. the room was absolutely silent. In eight days, it seemed we were virtually alone, even though the hotel was fairly full. The staff was courteous and helpful. We did have two issues, neither of which takes away from the overall feeling of great treatment. First, the bed was extremely firm - way too hard for comfort, which flies in the face of Westin's pride of bedding. Second, the cost for a full buffet breakfast was Euros 50/person. We did this once. It was very nice, but outrageously expensive. We had just as good breakfasts as part of the total room cost elsewhere. We ended up with cappucinos and yoghurt elsewhere. In spite of these two issues, the overall experience was marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “You would have to look hard to find a better hotel in this city.”
Reviews.Author: pablo_diablo_uk
Reviews.Content: Stay: November 05 Room view: Canal Grande view with stunning views of the Santa Maria Della Salute and the lower canal. Room (454): Clean, luxurious with the usual facilities for a quality hotel. Decorated in Venetian period style. No sign of wear and tear like some of the reviews here. The biggest bed I have ever seen in a hotel, I have slept in a few! The room had a balcony with seats and a table, try sipping some wine in the evening and watch the boats go by, go on it's what you have worked so hard for! Hotel Public Areas: Again luxurious, decorated in period style with lots of marble and period pieces. Oozing Italian style. Food: We only tried the Breakfast which was included in the room price. This was good with coffee to die for, this seems to be a trademark of Italian hotels. Dinner in the restaurant looked pricey but only to be expected in this kind of establishment. Location: Excellent, 5 minutes from San Marco, 10 seconds for gondola, 2 minutes from the nearest water bus. Lots of restaurants within 5 minutes radius of the hotel. Staff: Helpful and courteous, maybe not so much as other parts of the world, but who cares. Conclusion: If there are any hotels out there in Venice who can beat this one I would be surprised. Venice is a living, breathing museum, it has to be on your itinerary if you plan to tour Europe. Tip: Be prepared to barter with the Gondoliers, you should not pay more than 80 Euros for 40/45 minutes. The ultimate Venetian experience if you can find the cash. Extra tip: Buy a water bus 24 hour ticket for 10 Euros and take as many rides up and down the Canal Grande as you want. Take the slow No.1 bus and take in the sights, it takes about 40 minutes to go from canal top to bottom.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Shoechick
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I wasn't expecting much from the reviews that I had read here. We booked on points so I wasn't sure what type of room we would end up with. We were overjoyed to be upgraded to a Junior Suite overlooking the Grand Canal. It had the most amazing view! We had two large opening windows at the front as well as one at the side. The room was quite large and the bathrooms lovely. Everyone we encountered was wonderful. If we had paid for the rooms, I might have felt differently as yes, it does need some upgrading. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel after reading the prices ....ouch!! Hubby went out for Croissants for 2 Euro rather than the 50 Euro Breakfast. The location can't be beat. It's so central to everything and right on the vaporetto line. It took us all of five minutes to find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Pagetraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Europa and Regina for four nights in October. We had a wonderful room, with a small balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. We had room service breakfast (continental only) each morning and sat on the balcony watching all the boats go by on the Canal. We enjoyed the bar, which included a pianist in the evenings. The concierge staff was very helpful: before arriving, I had requested their assistance in restaurant reservations and they got us the best seat in the restaurant for our most memorable meal in Italy. I had no trouble finding the hotel, having traveled to Venice before and aware of some tricks to locating buildings (tiles on the walkway announced where to turn for the hotel). Our room was on the "Regina" side of the hotel. I would gladly return to this hotel. The hotel is a member of Starwood Group, of which I am a member. The floor that our room was on was reserved for Starwood members, so I recommend that if you are planning to stay at the hotel, that you join (free membership). Oh, and I forgot to mention that the hotel delivered a fruit basket and bottle of champagne when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, Rooms in need of RENOVATION”
Reviews.Author: lrnyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in October. We were "upgraded" to a junior suite with no view. Judging from the other reviews, however, I wonder if the standard room is actually the junior suite. The big minus is that the rooms are quite old and in need of renovation. Yes, I know it's Venice and there are no ultra modern hotels. But I certainly expected more given the rate I was paying. Cracks in the walls, bent light fixtures, stains on the carpet, etc. Bathrooms are marble but again in need of some modern fixtures. Rooms are a bit on the dark side. We were on the Europa side, I wonder if the Regina side may be nicer or more modern? Internet access is only availabe in the lobby areas for 5euro for 5 hours or 15euro for 24hrs. Breakfast is 50euro. The only day we tried to eat breakfast the restaurant was full and there was a line so we ended up eating at the Gritti Palace for less, go figure?? If it's your first trip to Venice, I would definitely take a water taxi to the hotel as it is a bit difficult to find. The website contains no directions but states "contact Concierge directly shortly before arrival". I did that but given his limited english and my limited Italian, I had a heck of a time finding the hotel until a kind gondola driver offered to take me there for 80euro. It was a nice ride but the hotel ended up being on the next block. Overall, service was good and the concierge staff was very helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but rooms in need of attention”
Reviews.Author: impavidus
Reviews.Content: I'd love to give this hotel top star ratings as its location is truly spectacular, situated on the 'Canal Grande' and only steps away from Piazza San Marco, but a combination of factors prevent me from rating it higher. The hotel public areas are truly spectacular, opulently covered in expensive marble, gildings and featuring magnificent chandeliers. The bar has a small terrace and you can enjoy a lovely meal in the restaurant with stunning views of the 'Canal Grande' and the Chiesa della Salute across - a dream for romantic couples of any age. Having set the scene let me now give you the disapponting news. First of all the bedrooms. I had a very large room which seemed OK at first, but closer inspection revealed poor housekeeping and maintenance. Part of the curtain was hanging by a thread, the wallpaper was dirty in places and missing in some of the corners where it had been lifted by luggage. The bathroom was also large but the sink had a very big crack. My room had no view (for which I guess you'd have to pay extra). Had I stayed in a three star hotel I would have overlooked these items, but in a place like this you'd really expect bedrooms to be absolutely spot on, especially for what you pay. I should also warn you that you should stay at this hotel with an inclusive B&B package or you will pay through the nose for breakfast. According to my recollection it was 25Eu for a simple continental breakfast and nearly double for a full buffet (yes dear American reader, that's nearly 50 bucks for some egg & bacon!). I steered clear of any room service, though I had a club sandwich in the bar at the price of a two course meal in a reasonable restaurant in London. Service is corteous but aloof, the concierge on duty during my stay wasn't particularly welcoming either. So a stunning location, public areas that are a dream but so-so bedrooms and top prices - you make up your own mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location, disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: todd_70
Reviews.Content: I should have known prior to arriving. As listed on the website, users are requested to email the hotel for directions. I emailed 5 days in advance and never received a reply. Fortunately, from the train station, it is fairly easy to navigate by asking the public transport staff what stop the hotel is at. For the price we paid, and as a Starwood gold member, and platinum amex holder, I requested an upgrade if possible (I know it is not always possible), but the hotel staff looked at me as if I spoke some alien language and didn't answer. Not a big deal, so we headed to the room. The room looked nice at first glance, side view of water, but there were little black mold spots on the walls, some kind of bug smeared into the ceiling, a ripped chair, one nightstand had a glass top-the other no glass top with a nice wood chip in it, and the bathroom lights were barely hanging in the mirror. I'm pretty flexible and always try to find the good things to highlight, but this to me is unsatisfactory. Maybe it was because we were in the "Europa" side and not the "Regina", however this is very unlike Starwood hotels. One good note though, the concierge, (the only one in the hotel that talked to us) followed us outside and asked if we would like him to set up any tours. The bar with the views of the grand canal (beautiful views) was unnecessarily expensive. I've traveled extensively throughout Europe and have no problem with spending, but 25 dollars for a long island iced tea is a little excessive. To add insult to injury, you can get a free ride to the island of Moreno for a glass tour, which the hotel has an agreement with a glass factory and is about 15-20 minutes away, but its 50 bucks to take you 10 minutes down the river to the train, so you are stuck lugging luggage through the narrow streets to the public transport. Typical tourist nickel and dime hotel. On a lighter note, the location was very convenient to the main sites. Venice is, and always will be magical, but still I'm very disappointed in the hotel:( (This is the worst review I've ever had to write)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location, Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Leoned
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in August of 2005 using Starwood Award Points. As a Platinum member (I travel for work approx. 100 nights per year), we were upgraded to a suite overlooking the Grand Canal. The rooms are very modern and bathrooms are marble with a tub, separate shower, sink, toilet and bidet. The entire facility was recently updated and it screams "first class" in the bar, the restaurant, on the Grand Canal patio and in the rooms. The hotel has a very nice patio on the Grand Canal and there was live music each night to set the tone. It was a beautiful location and naturally the drinks were not cheap. 8 euro for a ginger ale, 8 euro for a beer, and 12 - 15 euro for a mixed drink and a club sandwich was 22 euro. Yes, very expensive but to be away from the crowds and to have one of the best views in Venice you can almost, ALMOST, rationallize the prices. The view across the Canal to the San Maria della Salute is the icing on the cake. The hotel is about a four minute walk to San Marco and very convenient to all of the central sites in Venice. The hotel staff was very helpful and professional. They arranged for water taxis and dinner reservations and they did not dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: EricYu
Reviews.Content: I have do a lot homework on this site regarding Westin Europa and Regina before my trip to Venice and of course would like to contribute some honest comments after my trip back. We have stayed for 3 nights. Location - very good, right next to San Marco Square, very convenience for shopping and various restaurant. Special note that since our stay during July is very hot (temperature wise). It is very good to have hotel close by and you can always go back for refreshment in your own air conditioning room. There are not many cafe or restaurant in Venice hv aircon. service - It's great. From check-in, pepole in the front desk always very polite to our request. We booked through internet and upgrade to suite with partial canal view when we check in. We even hv late check-out until 4:00pm. They are very polite to our request. Concierge people also very nice to give any guidence. Food - very nice breakfast with fresh orange juice with variety of food. Not to mention good view rightby Grand Canal every morning. No wonder they charge EUR 50 per person for breakfast. We booked the room with breakfast include which seems a good deal Room - hv to said I am disappoint on this. I have been stayed dozen 5 star hotels and not to mention we have been upgrade to suite category. The room itself looks very shabby consider the decoration. Not exactly according to the web-site picture. But don't mistake the room itself very clean and comforable, heavenly bed truly good, and bath+shower room is very large and hv to said 'heavenly shower' very nice. Overall, consider what we pay for eur 275 per night with almost eur 100 (for 2 person) breakfast value and complimentary boat right to Lido (normally water bus charge you eur 10 per person per way) with all the highest class standing of Westin style of living. I have to said it is a worth money stay and definitely will stay in this hotel again unless I can find better room description/standard with same price in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Made my heart sing!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I booked the room I had put a note on my email asking for an upgrade if at all possible. We are Gold Starwood and Plat Amex card holders. We were upgraded to one of the best rooms we have ever stayed in. The room was a corner top floor suite with a terrace twice the size of our room. When we saw the Grand Canal view and terrace I hugged the concierge. We never wanted to leave. I woud never stay anywhere else when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay with miles; Once-in-a-Lifetime Treat”
Reviews.Author: Sf_winos
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing property in an unforgettable location. We had only one night to stay in Venice and accomodations are very expensive, so we opted to use our Starwood Points at the Westin Europa. The staff on arrival was very welcoming; we inquired to make sure we got a king size bed as requested. While they had assigned us a twin room, without a pause, they upgraded us to a junior suite on the top floor as the remaining room with a king bed. This room was small but beautiful with a terrace over the city that probably went for $700-1000 US per night. We were thrilled. The bed was super comfy and the bathroom marble with great amenities. Our only morning in Venice was started with the best coffee I've had in my life in the breakfast room right on the Grand Canal. The breakfast buffet appeared very basic for 30 or so Euros per person. We checked our bags for a day of sightseeing; the bellmen were helpful and friendly with our many questions. Note that this place is very hard to find on foot the first time, but once you get acclimated to the Venice layout, it's no problem. Be prepared to spend a lot and deal with Disneyland-type crowds at every turn. We will definitely return to Venice but off-season when we can enjoy it's charm better. We recommend the Westin if money is no object and you want American-style comfort that's hard to come by in an ancient city. This is no "palace" for the rates they charge; it is on par with places that charge about $300 per night in US cities. Definitely have a glass of wine at the patio at the bar one late evening -- the view of the canal and the basillica opposite the hotel at night is one you will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Get any Better than this...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW! This hotel is exceedingly nice---one of my favorites of all time, as a matter of fact. Our views over the canal were sublime, the furnishings were exquisite and the staff was very helpful. We also enjoyed the restaurant on the water---so elegant. I would give the Europa and Regina the highest possible rating on every aspect of the hotel. I look forward to the day when we can return.

Reviews.Title: “A dream hotel and city!!”
Reviews.Author: WhereWeGoinNext
Reviews.Content: If I could go to any hotel in Venice, this would be it. It is up to Westin standards but also has a personal charm-- not an out of a box boring hotel. We had an adventure finding it--which makes it nice and quiet--there are not crowds constantly walking by! Our room was on the 6 and 1/2 (7th really but they don't call it that!) floor and overlooked the grand canal, santa croce and in the distance you could see Lido. Our balcony was huge about 5 by 20. The staff was very helpful and since we were on our honeymoon, brought us a bottle of wine. It helps to mention you're on your honeymoon-- people become very interested in offering advice and become very patient! Our bed was Heavenly and the bathroom was very comfortable, as was the sitting room. The walls were painted and the room was decorated beautifully. We even ordered an "american" breakfast (we missed bacon and eggs after about 4 days of pastries) and were very pleased. The location was perfect-- we realized that we were about 2 minutes to San Marco square-- we became 'lost' many times but we felt completely safe-- Venice is almost like a Disneyland for grownups-- it just felt safe everywhere we went. The furnishings were as elegant as the city--fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great to place to stay if going to Venice”
Reviews.Author: sc4eva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice although very expensive. We only stayed because of using hotel points which meant we didnt spend any money. Everything was very nice and in the approiate style although not really our taste. Everything in Venice is WAY overpriced and not very good. We were happy to experience the city and hotel but will probably not go to Venice again. Overall if looking to use points or spend money, this hotel is ON the canal and about 5 min walk to all tourist interests.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect setting for a Venetian holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Regina in Venice in mid-May and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. We used Starwood points to pay for the room (12,000) and were upgraded to a canal-view suite with a gigantic living room, bedroom, powder room, and bathroom. The room was beautifully and tastefully decorated, oozing Venetian charm. The only qualm about the room was the bed; for Westin lovers out there, this bed is, unfortunately, not heavenly. Not a king but two twins joined together with a top sheet, the bed is a bit of disappointment (especially if the purpose of your visit is of a romantic nature). The hotel's public areas are grand and inviting, with the Tiepolo bar a great setting for an aperitivo (expensive albeit). The concierge was generally helpful, but the night staff was hit or miss. Leave your work at home though; internet access (not in the room) will cost you 8 euros for 30 minutes and 15 euros for an hour in the hotel's business center. The hotel's location is perfect, a three minute walk from the San Marco Vallaresso vaporetto (water subway) stop and right in the heart of all that is Venice. A water taxi from Piazzale Roma (the last bastion of cars/buses on the island of Venice) will cost you about 50 euros. Be prepared to spend your euros if you plan on dining in the hotel's restaurant; however, the concierge is very helpful in doling out recommendations for local, value-oriented restaurants (Trattoria all Madonna near the Rialto bridge a tested favorite). All in all, I would definitely stay at the Westin Regina again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at the Europa”
Reviews.Author: pkhanna
Reviews.Content: Bottom-Line: This was an excellent hotel amidst all the selections we could have made. It was tough to chose a hotel with all the posting here, but I went with my gut and expectations of Starwood prperties which have never let me down. And I was not disappointed: - Beautiful room (HUGE): I was upgraded as I requested an upgrade upon check-in and was granted a nice Executive suite - must have been a good 500sq.ft. - Braekfast was not cheap (but no where in Venice is), but had the best breakfast view on their terrace and excellent service - Concierge was top notch. Never gave us a bad restaurant recommendation and always got us a table. - Very friendly staff - Location was excellent For the price I paid (230 Euros per night), it was the best deal in all of Venice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “25 Dead Mosquitos”
Reviews.Author: NHF
Reviews.Content: For the amount of money the rooms cost per night, I would hope someone would get in there and clean the squashed mosquitos off the walls and ceilings. Nothing is better than looking up from bed and counting dead bugs! We used our Starwood points to stay for 2 nights during Carnevale this year. It was our second stay at this Westin in Venice. The first time our room was very nice. That time, we paid for the room. It made me wonder if using points gets one a downgraded room. We mentioned the dead bugs to the hotel with no attempt made to apologize or clean them up. I was greatly disappointed in our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: oldhousegirl
Reviews.Content: Others have criticized this hotel, but we really liked it. I speak Italian, so maybe the staff was nicer to us? The room wasn't recently renovated, but it was huge (especially by Venetian standards), and we upgraded to a canal view. In the evening we enjoyed standing out on the terrace. The location is terrific. You're right in the heart of things, yet it's very tranquil (as is much of Venice).

Reviews.Title: “August 204”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful throughout and in the best location on the Grand Canal. I found the service very good and the Reception and other staff very pleasant and helpful. There are many reviews about bad staff at this hotel. But, did those people take the time to pass the time of day with them rather than "key please". Because I took the time to speak to the staff and even have a laugh with them I had no problems.

HotelInfo.Name: The Westin Hotel Europa & Regina, Venice
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 2159, 30124 Venice, Italy
